loans.name: Janeth's Masuguru C Group

texts.en:
Janeth is 45 years old and is widow with 3 children whose ages range from 20 to 34 years old. Janeth is a fish seller. She started her business in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Hawa, Subira, and Saumu, who have businesses in soap and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy mor fish for her business.

loans.name: Sinisy Ll Group

texts.en:
Fatmata T. is the group leader of Sinisy solidarity group. Fatmata is 40 years old and married with 5 children. The family lives on subsistence farming but cannot grow enough for the family and for commercial purposes.

When Fatmata heard about Kiva, she organized the other group members, Fanta K., Saran K., Feremusu M., and Kutha S., to access loans to increase their production. The group grows rice, peanuts, carrots, and other vegetables for consumption and for sale. Therefore the group is requesting a loan of Le.2,500,00 to purchase fertilizer and vegetable, rice, and peanut seeds, as well as for hiring labor.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and increase production

loans.name: Papa Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Papa Abdoulaye Dème is a tailor at the big market in Thiès. He has been working in this profession for more than 7 years. He lives in Mbour, is married and father of 3 children. This is his 3rd loan and he is requesting it in order to satisfy the demands of his clients.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Papa Abdoulaye Dème est un tailleur sis au marché grand thiès. Il excerce ce métier depuis plus de 7ans. Habitant à Mbour I, il est marié et père de 3 enfants. Il est dans son 3ème prêt et il demande ce prêt pour satisfaire la demande.

loans.use: Purchase of Supplies and Fabrics

loans.name: Suubiryamukama Group

texts.en:
Rukia N. is 50 years and a widow with six children, one of whom is still in senior school while the rest are adults. She is a member of the Suubilyamukama group. She has owned a restaurant for a long time, from which she serves breakfast, lunch and supper to the locals. Her meals include a variety of bananas, sweet potatoes, rice, meat, chicken, fish and greens.

Rukia will use her part of the loan to buy more chairs, plates, forks and foodstuffs to boost her business. Her previous loans have helped her with paying school fees for her children and she has been able to buy two plots of land.

Rukia will share this loan with the other members of her group.

loans.use: To buy more chairs, plates, forks and foodstuffs for a restaurant.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Residing in the Chuaqanaq Cantón Pachipac sector of Nahualá, Sololá, she has been dedicated to the activity of weaving, specifically the production of typical fabrics and her husband works in the agricultural field. Through the weaving business she generates income to help her husband cover the family expenses. She is coming to ASDIR to increase their work capital, and thus, cover the demand for her products which are sold in the municipalities of Nahualá and Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan in the province of Sololá. With a little more capital she would be able to sell in nearby municipalities and improve her income to provide a higher quality of life to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Residente del Sector Chuaqanaq Cantón Pachipac, Nahualá, Sololá, desde hace Cinco años se dedica a la Artesanía “Tejeduría” , específicamente elaboración de telas típicas y el esposo de dedica a actividades de campo “Agricultura”, por medio de este trabajo genera ingresos económicos y ayuda a su esposo para sufragar los gastos de toda la familia, esta persona acude a ASDIR para ampliar su capital de trabajo y así poder cubrir la demanda de sus productos, estos productos son vendidos en el departamento de Chimaltenango y en el área o comunidades de los municipios de Nahualá y Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, del departamento de Sololá, con un poco más de capital estaría vendiendo en otros municipios cercanos y mejorar sus ingresos para brindar un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.

loans.use: Increase of work capital for artisan business, specifically production of typical fabric

loans.name: Mohammad Saliam

texts.en:
M. Saliam is 20 years old and lives in a household of 5 members. He is a carpet maker and he has looms inside his house. He is new to his business. He lost his father during the war 5 years ago so now he supports his family. He works together with his whole family making carpets and they send carpets to the bazaar for sale.

Now he needs a loan. Therefore he has requested an individual loan to buy a new loom to continue his business with more success in the future.

He is happy with all members of his family. The whole family wants to thank lenders around the world who make this opportunity possible in this poor country. Saliam and all members of his family want to continue their partnership with AFSG and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a new loom for making carpets as a home industry

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Chuon S., age 45, is married and lives with four of her five children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Working as a cow dealer with her husband, Chuon S. typically makes $10 each day. Her family is also supported by three of their children who work in the garment factory and in a casino. 

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Chuon S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of $350 to buy a cow, a purchase that she believes can increase her daily income. 

Mrs. S.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys H. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Gladys is a hairdresser who owns a beauty saloon, which she has run since 2001. Her husband is a trader. Gladys uses her income to pay for school fees, utility bills and other family expenses. Gladys will use the loan to purchase wigs and other hairdressing products. She wants to improve her services to attract more customers to her salon. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gladys plans to support her husband in their children's education.

loans.use: Gladys will use the loan to purchase wigs and other hairdressing products.

loans.name: Mustakim

texts.en: Y. Mustakim is 28 years old. He lives in Isfara; he is married and has three children. His wife is a housekeeper. Mustakim sells dried apricots in the central local market. He purchases dried apricots and processes them himself. Because he buys dried apricots wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. All this allows Mustakim to make his business quite successful and provide a stable income for his family. Today Mustakim requests 2500 Somoni ($750 USD) for the term of 8 months. He is going to spend the loan on more dried apricots to process and sell. He would like to increase his income and give his children a good education. Mustakim expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.

loans.use: To buy more dried apricots to process and sell.

loans.name: Keyla

texts.es: Keyla tiene 29 años, es madre de 2 hijos que estudian y son su razón de salir adelante, ella vive con su conviviente quien la apoya bastante en su hogar y en su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de combustible (petróleo y kerosén) al por menor, lo lleva a vender por las riveras del río a las distintas embarcaciones que lo requieren. Esta  labor la viene realizando desde hace 3 años, y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y conversar con muchas personas, además le es rentable porque ya se ha hecho muy conocida en la zona y tiene clientes que saben que el combustible que ella vende es de buena calidad, y solo le compran a ella. Este es su 5to crédito con MFP, Keyla demuestra ser una clienta muy responsable hasta el momento. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más combustible, así como también quiere mandar a repara el vehículo con el cual se transporta.
texts.en:
Keyla is 29 years old. She is the mother of two children who are studying and are her main reason for wanting to move forwards. She lives with her partner who helps her a lot in the home and with her business. She sells fuel (petrol and kerosene) on a retail level, taking it to sell on the banks of the river to the different crafts which need it. She's undertaken this work for the last three years and it is going very well. What she likes about this work is that she's familiar with many different places and talks with lots of people. Additionally, it's a profitable business as she's very well-known in the area and she has customers who know that she sells good-quality fuel, and only buy from her. This is her fifth credit from MFP, Keyla has shown that up until now she has been a very responsible client. With the money she is requesting she will buy more fuel, and she also wants to repair the vehicle she use to transport the fuel.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fuel wholesale

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Señor Juan de 50 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Miguela 47 de  años de edad. El Matrimonio tiene 3 hijas todas trabajando.
  
Juan es propietario de una despensa y copetín en el cual se inició en el año 1999, recibe la ayuda de su esposa quien se encarga de elaborar las ricas empanadas, sándwich de milanesa, sopa paraguaya y otros, para venderlos en el copetín.  

Ya cuentan con una clientela bien formada gracias a la buena atención  que les ofrece a sus clientes. 
Don Juan como un sueño personal, desea ampliar su negocio para llegar a ofrecer  más variedades de productos a su clientela.

El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías.
texts.en:
Juan is 50 years old and married to Miguela, who is 47. Their marriage produced three daughters, all of whom are working. Juan owns a food market and snack bar that he started in 1999. His wife helps him out by making delicious empanadas, meat cutlet sandwiches, Paraguayan soup, among other dishes, to sell at the snack bar. They now count on a well-established customer base thanks to the excellent attention they provide to their clientele. Juan’s personal dream is to expand his business to offer a greater variety of products to his patrons. He solicits this loan for the purchase of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as:  sugar, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 43-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Ali has owned a school bus for eighteen years. Ali requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his bus. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

loans.use: Ali will use the loan to do some maintenance work on his bus.

loans.name: Costansia

texts.en:
Costansia K. is married with four children, ages 28, 26, 24 and 19. 

Costansia owns a milling machine in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma.  She works at her business for 10 hours each day, and earns an average monthly profit of $155.

She requests her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more maize and sunflower oil for her business.
She hopes that through this loan, she can increase her profits, enabling her to grow her business, improve her home, provide more food for her family, pay school fees for her children, and save money for future use. 

She belongs to Darajani Group loan.

loans.use: To buy more maize and sunflower oil for her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica M. is 46 years old. She is married with five children, all of whom are still in school (ranging from primary to senior high school). She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Elmina in the Central Region of Ghana. Elmina is not only a fishing community but also one of the region's tourist attractions.

Veronica works as a trader to support her husband financially and to provide for her family. She sells ice cream in the local market square and also treks to other towns. Veronica also runs a mother care crèche in her community. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure ice cream in bulk. Her dream is to give her children the best possible education.

loans.use: To procure ice cream in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Rotifahon

texts.ru: Ротифахон 38 лет. 10 послежних лет она занимается предпринимательством и  торгует детской одеждой. Она замужем и имеет 2 детей. За детьми дома смотрит свекровь, а Ротифахон выходит на рынок торговать. Раньше года 3 назад Ротифахон не имела постоянной торговой точки и поэтому выезжала на различные рынки, где часы торговли были ограничены 5-6 часами. Сейчас она торгует целый день и прибыли остается больше. Она собирается расширить ассортимент и подала заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Rotifahon is 38 years old. For the past 10 years she has been an entrepreneur and sells children’s clothing. She is married and has 2 children. Her mother-in-law watches the children at home and Rotifahon goes to the market to sell. Earlier, around 3 years ago, Rotifahon did not have a permanent sales location and because of this traveled to different markets where sales hours were limited to 5-6 hours. Now she sells for the entire day and has more income left over. She plans to expand her product selection and has applied for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand product selection

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita A. is a resident of Candari, Pandan, Antique. She is a 53 year old woman and a mother to four sons. She is an education-oriented mother making her four children attends school regularly. Her eldest son is 24 years old and a college graduate and the youngest son is 16 years old and a grade six pupil. She is married to Rodolfo A., the Barangay Captain (head of the village) of Candari.

Anita is busy in the retail of bariw (a plant that its leaves are used in making sleeping mat) from the local folks. She then sells bariw to the neighboring towns and markets. She finds it very productive. She learned the business from her parents. The proceeds of the business were a big help to the family especially in the educational needs of her children. With her 5,000 pesos loan from ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) she can now buy bulk stocks of bariw for her retail.

Her greatest aspiration is that her children will be able to finish schooling and find jobs.

loans.use: To buy bulk stocks of bariw (a plant used to make sleeping mats) for retail.

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en: Mrs. Nguon R. is 29 years old, Her husband, Phoun, (pictured) is age 28. They live in Pursat Province where they own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. They grow rice and have two crops per year, in both the dry and rainy seasons. The young couple has given birth to three children, who arw minors(jA;PVI,[; and are still not enrolled in school. The family faces difficulty with transportation, they always spend a lot of money for touring needs. Therefore, Nguon R. is applying for a loan to buy a used motorbike in order to make the family's transportation easier.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike

loans.name: Razok

texts.ru: Шерназаров Разок проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 51 год. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Старшие сыновья работают в России. Разок по специальности колхозник. В данный момент более 28 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает бычков, а потом продает их. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы купить бычков.
texts.en:
Razok S. lives in the Rumy district. He is 51 years, married and has 5 children. His older sons work in Russia. Razok is a farmer by trade. He is currently involved in animal husbandry and has over 28 years of experience in this field. He feeds bulls and then sells them. Our client is requesting this loan in order to buy bulls.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Bancomunal El Grupo Real.
Julia es madre soltera, tiene 65 años, tres hijos mayores que trabajan son independientes.
Julia trabajaba cociendo cortinas, hace cuatro años, dejo de trabajar por que se opero del seno, de la vesícula, después de la operación sus hijos no quieren que trabajen, ella se dedica a  alquilar cuartos de su casa.
Desde que Julia esta en Finca aprendió a ser responsable con los prestamos y ser cumplida con los pagos.
 Julia necesita un préstamo de 600 soles, para  el arreglo de los cuartos que alquila en su casa. 
El sueño de Julia es tener una ferretería.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Community Bank "El Grupo Real".

Julia is a single mother, she is 65 years old. She has three children that are independent and are working.

Julia's work was making drapes. Four years ago she stopped working because she had breast and gall bladder operations. Her children didn't want her to work after the operations, so now she rents out rooms in her house.

Since Julia has been with Finca (Kiva Field Partner) she has been responsible with the loans granted to her and she has been on time with the payments.

Julia requires a loan of 600 soles to repair and remodel the rooms she rents out in her home.

Julia's dream is to have a hardware store.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair and remodel the rooms to rent out.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is divorced. He has a son who stayed with him after the divorce. Sergei has always tried to make sure his son has everything he needs and he has worked hard to meet his family's needs as a single parent.

Five years ago, he started his small business selling animal feed and pet supplies. Sergei sells his inventory in the central city market. He has gained much experience by working in this sphere of business. Currently, he has about 12,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. His net profit is about 5,000 Grivnyas.

Sergei is seeking a loan of 10,400 Grivnya to restock his inventory and raise additional income as a result. He is hoping to develop his small venture and to continue improving his financial standing. Sergei admits he is very grateful to his family because they helped him start this business. Sergei is hoping to use some of the income that the loan funds generate to buy new household appliances that would make his family's live much more comfortable.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida T. is from the village of Danao. She is 38 years old. Nida is married. To make a living, Nida operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (about $63) a month for these activities.

In 2007, Nida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Nida is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fishing nets. This will be the third loan taken out by Nida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Nuevo Encuentro Group

texts.es:
Frida C. vende cosméticos en la feria “16 de Julio” en su  puesto propio hace 10 años, ella necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería. Frida es integrante de la Asociación Comunal  “Nuevo Encuentro” que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal “Alto Lima”. Las  demás integrantes también tienen sus propios negocios como la costura de chamarras, faldas, tejido de chompas y  venta de verduras, repuestos de auto. Y necesitan el préstamo para la compra de materia prima (tela, hilo) y mercadería (verduras y repuestos).

Este grupo se caracteriza por ser unidas y alegres, además les gusta aprender y llevar a sus hijos al consultorio.
texts.en:
Frida C. sells cosmetics at the 16 de Julio market and has had her own booth for ten years. She needs the loan to buy merchandise. Frida is a member of the Nuevo Encuentro Communal Association which is a part of the Alto Lima Focal Center. The other members also have their own businesses such as sewing jackets and skirts, knitting sweaters, and selling vegetables and automotive spare parts. They need the loan to buy raw materials (cloth, thread) and merchandise (vegetables and spare parts). This group is notable for being close and happy. Also, they like to learn and to take their kids to work with them.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Materials and Merchandise

loans.name: Awurade Adom Group

texts.en:
Theresa is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, all of whom are in school. She works hard to support her husband and help him to provide for their family. 

Theresa is the leader of a trust bank group called "Awurade Adom," which means "God’s grace." The members of the group all work hard. They are engaged in commercial activities, such as selling food, groceries, and clothing. Some of them sell their products door-to-door ("hawking") while others trek to nearby communities to sell on their market days. They buy their goods in Kumasi and nearby towns. They have acquired a great deal of experience over the years and they want to expand their businesses, hence the need for the loan to buy goods in bulk to realize this dream. 

Theresa, the group leader, is seated in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy goods to sell

loans.name: Emmalyn

texts.en:
Emmalyn is already 27 years old, she manages a hog raising business to gain income for her family needs. She disposes her fully grown up pigs after four months. For every pig, Emmalyn is able to generate income of PHP3, 000 that is being used to sustain their immediate necessities at home. She plans to avail a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 4, 000 to purchase hog feeds that her hog raising needed to sustain their daily feeds supply. 

	 Emmalyn is married to Joseph C., he is a farmer. They have two children namely; Jocelyn, 11 years of age, and Helen Joyce, nine years old, both are presently elementary students. Her whole family lives in the far place of Casalatan Cauayan City, Isabela. She hopes to give their two children with complete education despite the distance of available school from their place. Emmalyn further said that; in every man’s struggles, he must be willing to sacrifice to become successful.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora tiene 42 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 4 hijos. Tras ocuparse a la siembra de café por muchos años, ahora Dora optó en dedicarse a la venta de combustibles, debido a la ubicación estratégica de su casa, pues es una zona muy concurrida, por ser la carretera principal de la selva central; mientras que su esposo se sigue dedicando a las labores agrícolas. Hace pocos meses inicio la venta de combustibles con un cilindro de petróleo y ahora ya cuenta con tres, por ello tienen anhelos de incrementar su negocio, ya que viene obteniendo buenas ganancias, atendiendo 16 horas al día. De ese modo logra cubrir la alimentación y educación de sus hijos.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y durante este periodo, la han nombrado la tesorera de su banco comunal debido a su carácter severo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en el incremento de dos más cilindros de petróleo.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: María Ángela

texts.es: María Ángela M. S. reside en Antiguo Cuscatlán municipio del departamento de La Libertad es madre soltera y vive con su único hijo Ricardo quien es ya todo un hombre de 32 años de edad. A pesar de que María tiene 61 años de edad sus deseos de superación siguen latentes, ella es una mujer trabajadora y responsable que atiende su propio negocio que consta de la elaboración de comida, la cual luego es comercializada todos los días en los desayunos y almuerzos, el deseo de María es seguir ampliando su negocio, deseo que solo puede ser posible con la ayuda de este crédito, que le permitirá a esta mujer emprendedora comprar mayor cantidad de insumos para aumentar la producción de sus platillos.
texts.en:
María Ángela M. S. lives in the town of Antiguo Cuscatlán, which is in the department of La Libertad. She is a single mother who lives with her only son Ricardo, who is 32 years old. Even though she is 61 years old, María still has the desire to succeed. She is a responsible and hardworking woman who manages her own food business, in which she prepares and sells breakfasts and lunches on a daily basis. Her hope is to continue expanding her business, which can only be possible with the help of this loan. As a result, this businesswoman will be able to buy supplies in large quantities so that she can produce more dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Open a workshop, buy planks of wood and tools

loans.name: Sala

texts.en:
Sala F. is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Asau. She is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Sala owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Sala has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Sala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sala has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to raise. Sala is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Sala plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Mirtha Luz

texts.es:
Mirtha Luz es una mujer perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 51 años, es soltera y madre de ocho hijos mayores los que la apoyan.
Se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches, actividad que realiza desde su casa.
Mirtha Luz forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace un año. 
El primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que invirtió en su negocio de comidas.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 900.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà sacos de arroz, aceite y otros insumos para la venta de sus platos. 
La meta de Mirtha Luz es tener una tienda de golosinas bien implementada.
texts.en:
Mirtha Luz is a persevering woman. She lives in Pucallpa, a city in the Ucayali region. She is 51 years old, single and mother of eight adult children, who are all supportive of her. She makes her living by selling food from her home in the evenings. Mirtha Luz has been a member of Madres Corajes Community Bank for the past year. The first loan she received was for 300 new soles, which she invested in her food business. She has asked for a loan of 900 new soles to buy rice in large bags, oil and other supplies for making the food she sells. Mirtha Luz’s goal is to own a well-stocked candy shop.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy rice, oils and other supplies for preparing food to sell.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es: La Sra. Zulma María es empleada en casa comercial denominada Planeta Modas ubicado en micro centro de Ciudad del Este, está casada con el Sr. Pedro Vázquez, el mismo se dedica al comercio, a la compra de mercaderías del vecino país como ser: pollos, azúcar, aceites etc., lo cual le generan mayor ingreso en la unidad familiar, están domiciliados en el Km 5 Barrio María Auxiliadora son padres de dos hijos, cuenta con un buen histórico de pago con la Fundación Paraguaya, se tratan de personas trabajadoras y con voluntad de pago
texts.en:
Zulma Maria works in a business known as Planeta Modas, located in the center of Ciudad del Este. She is married to Pedro Vazquez, who is also engaged in commerce, specifically, buying merchandise from the neighboring country, such as chickens, sugar, oils, etc. This generates the largest part of the family’s income. They live at Km. 5 in the Maria Auxiliadora Section, and have two children. Their payment history with the Paraguayan Foundation is good, for they are hard working and accept the responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as chickens, soft drinks, breads, staples (rice, sugar)

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a farmer from Norala, South Cotabato. She is 40 years old with a 14-year-old child. She has managed a rice field since 1991. It is the main source of income her family depends on.

Now she would like to request a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner, worth 12,000 Philippine pesos to expand her farm and supply the necessary materials for her rice field.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Gandolgor

texts.en:
Gandolgor is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Arhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent called “ger.”  Her two sons both attend a secondary school. 

Gandolgor operates a wooden products business with the help of her husband in their town. Her husband is responsible for making variety of wooden products such as tables, chairs, cupboards and so on, while Gandolgor is responsible for decorating and painting the products. They started their business in 1995 with working capital of 450,000 tugrugs (~320 USD). Over the years she has expanded and improved her business with working capital now reaching 4,500,000 tugrugs (~3200 USD). They are well known to residents of their town, because of their products' good quality and modern style. 

With their business profits, they were able to redesign and fix their home. To supplement to their earnings they also operate a meat trading business at a local market. Now they can fully support all of their family members' needs. She says, "For the future I want to expand my business." She is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase wood for her furniture business.

loans.use: Wood for furniture manufacture

loans.name: Carisma Group

texts.es:
La señora Anastacia Gloria C. Sánchez tiene 56 años de edad y vive en  Valle de Chalco Solidaridad  en el Estado de México desde hace 30 años. En este lugar tuvo a sus siete hijos. Hace 20 años enviudo y esto le afecto mucho tanto económicamente como moral ya que se quedo a cargo de sus hijos las cuales saco adelantes.  Seis de ellos ya se casarón. En este momento le queda un  hijo soltero y en edad escolar, siendo esa su preocupación de seguirlo apoyando. Ella quiere obtener ingresos en la venta de ropa de segundo uso.  Ella requiere de capital para  comprar la ropa por paca y esto le ayudara a tener mayores ganancias y solventar los gastos básicos de ella y su hijo quien también le ayuda en su negocio cuando tiene tiempo, por esta razón se une con algunos vecinos con mismas inquietudes para formar un grupo y solicitar un crédito a través de fundación Realidad. Ella agradece de ante mano el apoyo recibido para cumplir sus expectativas de vida y seguir luchando.
Las Personas con las que se une son:

Benita O. S. venta de joyería.
Víctor R. R.  venta de camisas.
Carmela G. Abundis venta de ropa.
Elizabeth R. E. Venta de accesorios para zapatos.
Juan Mejia G. Venta de básculas.
Karen T. Martínez venta de tenis.
Liliana R. E. venta de zapatos.
Anastacia G C. Sánchez venta de ropa usada(en la foto aparece con un pantalón blanco y sueter azul).
Carmen Z. H.  venta de dulces.
Eladio Martínez A. tiene una carpintería.
Cristóbal H. venta de ropa usada.
texts.en:
Anastacia is 56 years old and has lived in Valle de Chalco Solidaridad in the State of México for the past 30 years and her seven children were born there. She became a widow seven years ago, which affected her financially and emotionally, as she had to continue to care for her children, whom she has helped to get ahead. Six of them are now married. She has one school-aged son whom she must continue to support. She would like to earn some income selling second hand clothing and needs working capital in order to buy bundles of clothing. This will help her increase her income and allow her to pay for her and her son’s basic needs. He also helps her in her business when he is able. She has partnered with some of her neighbors, with similar concerns, to form a group and request a loan through “Fundación Realidad.” She is grateful for the support she has received during her struggle to meet her life’s expectations. Her partners are: Benita – Jewelry sales Víctor – Shirt sales Carmela – Clothing sales Elizabeth – Shoe accessory sales Juan – Scale sales Karen – Sneaker sales Liliana – Shoe sales Anastacia – Second hand clothing sales (shown wearing while pants and a blue sweater) Carmen – Candy sales Eladio – Has a carperntry shop Cristóbal – Second-hand clothing sales

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchace clothing and accessories for resale

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M., 33, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married and blessed with three children, she makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing a video and photo studio.

Josephine has been a regular member of Kiva field partner the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends weekly CCT fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s Cooperative.  Because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business, she has been able to consistently pay her dues.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for an 18,000 Philippine peso loan. She plans to use this money as a source of added capital that will help her pay off the charges for photo developing for the film and printing the negatives that her customers bring to her.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education until they reach college.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for developing film and printing photos from negatives.

loans.name: Siem's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers contains five members.

Mr. Siem S., 36, has been selected to be group leader by the members. He has two children who are studying at the secondary school. He earns a living by driving a motorcycle taxi and also works as a requirement laborer. He is married to Kean Sam, 35, who works selling a few groceries from home.

Recently Siem S. feels upset; he can’t earn much income because his motor taxi often is broken and is not attractive to the customers. To resolve the problem, Siem S. decided to seek a loan to replace his broken taxi.

The other four members of the group are:

Mr. H. is a taxi (Tuk Tuk) driver who requests a loan to replace his old taxi.

Mrs. S. is a single lady selling groceries to earn a living. She needs a loan to accumulate more grocery items.

Mrs. S. sells cooking ingredients from home and she requests a loan to accrue her business capital.

Mrs. Y. is a head chef for other parties. She is asking for a loan to buy an old motorcycle to ride to work. (Mrs. Y. was not available for photographing so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To replace a broken taxi.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda G. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 52 years old. Luzviminda is separated from her spouse and has four adult children. To make a living, Luzviminda owns & operates a business selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luzviminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Luzviminda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a hardworking and ambitious man who dreams of opening his own music studio in the future. He is a 45-year-old father of three. He sells herbal products such as food supplements, herbal medicine and soap. Besides that, he earns extra income from his gospel music production. 

David started selling herbal products four years ago and his business has improved since he joined Faulu Kenya. He belongs to a group called Winners SHG in Faulu Kenya whose members guarantee loans for each other. Currently, he has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to add to his stock of herbal medicine, soap and food supplements. He hopes that the new stock will raise his profit margin.

loans.use: To add stock of herbal products

loans.name: Juan Orlando

texts.es: Juan Orlando P. C., tiene la edad de 58 años, está casado, y tiene 8 hijos que son su mayor prioridad.  El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado, la idea aumentar el número de animales en su finca. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Don Juan trabaja desde hace varios años con el ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Juan Orlando P. C. is 58 years old. He is married and has eight children, who are his greatest priority. He wants the loan to buy livestock in order to increase the number of animals on his farm. He wants to adequately take care of the livestock in order to get the best income possible when he sells them. This is not his first loan with Fudescosur. He is very happy with the terms of the loan that they have always offered him. Juan has worked with livestock for several years. In the future he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and more economic stability. He also hopes to be able to keep growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn D. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 42 years old. Marilyn is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The primary source of income for the shop comes from selling food and daily-use products in the local community. Marilyn has been running her business for over three years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and engagement in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used  to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell; this loan is her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

NOTE: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Antonio José

texts.es:
Antonio Álvarez  Martínez, vive en la ciudadela 20 de Julio, con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos de 2 a 13 años  de edad, en una zona muy cerca del estadio de Futbol Metropolitano, sede del equipo campeón del futbol profesional Colombiano “El Junior de Barranquilla”. Y es que Antonio, se dedica especialmente a la venta de ropa deportiva como camisetas, pantalonetas, accesorios, gorras, sonajeros, banderas alusivas a diversos equipos, pero especialmente al Junior, quien tiene un  inmenso grupos de seguidores, que constantemente compran estos artículos gane o no gane, porque lo llevan como un accesorio  mas de su vestuario, sobre todo en estas épocas de mucho futbol.
 
 Inició su  actividad en el año 2003 como un negocio familiar, después de ser empleado de una microempresa, donde fabricaban recordatorios en cerámicas para eventos especiales;  pero Antonio cuando quiso obtener mas ingresos, emprendió esta  actividad  con la que tiene mucha afinidad, genera 2 empleos y trabaja de 9:00 A.M. AM  9:00 P.M. El dice que aunque tiene una gran competencia, en un escenario donde el futbol despierta la pasión de los  costeños, el mercado alcanza para todos; por eso es muy frecuente que los competidores en este negocio sean amigos y buenos compañeros de camino.  Su frecuencia de compra es cada dos días y necesita capital de trabajo para mantenerlo como fondo del negocio e ir actualizado y modernizando la mercancía que vende. Este es su segundo crédito y está aplicando por un monto de $1.300.000 COP porque comprará al por mayor, ropa deportiva alusiva al Junior y al mundial de futbol. Con su  crédito  sus ingresos se ha  incrementado,  porque aumentó el capital de trabajo. 

Antonio José sueña con tener su propio taller de confección de ropa deportiva  y poder terminar de su casa   los acabados que requiera y mas adelante tener su propio vehiculo y estos son justamente sus grandes desafíos.
texts.en:
Antonio Álvarez Martínez lives in the 20th of July neighborhood with his partner and their three children, who range in age from 2 to 13. They live near the Metropolitan Football (soccer) Stadium which is home to the current Colombian champions Junior of Barranquilla. Antonio works selling sportswear, like the jerseys, shorts, accessories, hats, rattles, and flags of all of the teams, but especially Junior, which has many supporters who always buy gear win or lose. They buy accessories to add to their outfit, and buy more during important parts of the season. He began this job in 2003 as a family business after working for a small business making ceramic souvenirs for special events, but Antonio wanted to earn more money. He started this job because he really enjoys it, has created two jobs, and he works a from 9:00 AM to 9:00 PM. He says that even though there is a lot of competition, the setting awakens the passion of the people on the coast and the market is large enough to provide sales for all the vendors. This is why many of the competitors in this business are friends and good companions to work with. He resupplies his business every two days and he needs capital to maintain his business funds and continue to update and modernize the merchandise he sells. This is his second loan and is applying for a loan of 1,300,000 Colombian Pesos because he buys the sportswear wholesale. His previous loan helped increase his income because he work capital increased. Antonio José dreams of having his own sportswear sewing shop and finishing improvements on his home and further in the future buying his own vehicle. These are the challenges he is facing.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of sportswear of Junior and other soccer teams worldwide

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
K. Samuel is 24 years old and single. At his young age, he is already into business instead of a better proposition like being at school. He has no regrets, however, as he says circumstances did not allow for his continued education.

Samuel now has an experience that stretches to five years and, though the positives outweigh the negatives in his banana-selling business operations, he says he has always been plagued by pests that constantly destroy his bananas at his stall. He reckons that with this loan, he will be able to buy drugs that can destroy these bugs.

In a week, Samuel says he makes profits that add to 100,000 shillings. In Kyeikucu, Ibanda, his hard work has always been lauded by his fellow business people who thought somebody of his age could not live up to the pressures of doing this kind of business. With this loan, he wants to buy more bananas that he will later resell.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Nura

texts.en: Nura T. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more food items to be cooked and sold in her restaurant. Nura is 39 years old and is married to a peasant farmer. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Nura hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant and stock more chairs and tables for better accommodation. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more food items to be cooked and sold in her restaurant

loans.name: Jaridian

texts.en:
Jaridian P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is married and has a 21-year-old child. Jaridian owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jaridian has been engaged in his business for over 35 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

Jaridian joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jaridian has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. He is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Jaridian from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve it.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth D. is married to an electrician and has three children. She has received senior high education.

Elizabeth sells soft drinks at Takoradi and uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase additional soft drinks to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou A. is 38-years-old, married with three-minor children, and lives with her husband in the province of Libertad, Antique. To supply additional income for her family, Marilou has been engaged in a hog raising business for almost four years.  Her husband, Rafael, is a farmer and works closely with her.

Marilou would like to obtain a loan to pay for more piglets, vitamins, and feed.  Marilou believes the purchase of additional piglets will increase her inventory and drive increased monthly revenue.  As a proud member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 2007, Marilou has been a devoted member demonstrating regular attendance to weekly meetings and solid repayments on previous loans.

Her long term goals are to maintain the productivity of her business, and support the education for her 3 children. She also dreams of a brighter tomorrow and a more prosperous standard of living.

loans.use: To pay for more piglets, vitamins, and feed.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida D. G. is from the village of Barangay Calaocan, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 50 years old. Aida is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Aida owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Aida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Aida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ndwanirira

texts.en: J. is a fifty-year-old woman, married with six children; two of the children are below eighteen years of age with two other dependents. Her husband is a retired civil servant, meaning she is in charge of the family's welfare. She is a banker and  is a very hardworking woman, focused and very forward-thinking. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda and her dream is to see her children with better qualifications and working in reputable organizations. J. intends to use the loan funds to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: Paying school fees for the children

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Mrs. Emma A. is presently engaged in selling relief goods, like bags and clothing, which is locally known as “Okay-okay”. She is also receiving support from her husband as her partner in their business. She is 38 years of age and blessed with two children now of school age. They are from the Barangay of Sangay Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She’s been engaged in this business for five years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. Just this year, Emma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. As a newly recognized member of PMPC under the Regular Loan program, she is now requesting a first loan of 15,000 PHP to be used as additional capital for her Okay-okay business. She plans to use additional revenue to improve general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, repaying loans, paying for insurance, advancing her children’s education and possibly expanding her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her "Okay-okay" business

location.town: Tudela-Sangay Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Daler

texts.en:
Daler owns a small clothing sales business in Dushanbe, in the capital of Tajikistan. He has space at a market area near the center of city where he sells a variety of men’s and women’s clothing. Daler has been in business for about eight years. He has benefited from having a great location with no other serious competitors close by. Daler is married and has two children for whom he is helping to pay school expenses. Daler has requested a loan to purchase a supply of clothing to sell in his business. 

                                                                                    
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing in order to increase the range of goods to sell

loans.name: Haydar

texts.ru:
Haydar A. 33 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Doch kotoroy 10 let ona uchitsya v shkole i sin kotoromu 5 let xodit v detskiy sadik. Haydar jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey semyoy.

Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye instrumenti i apparaturu dlya svoyey raboti. On ochen dobrosovestniy rabochiy on ochen lubit svoyu rabotu i s udovolstviyem vipolnyayet yeyo.
texts.en: Haydar A. is 33 years old.  He is married and has 2 children.  His 10-year-old daughter goes to school, and his 5-year-old son goes to kindergarten.  Haydar lives in the city of Baku with his family.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy tools and equipment necessary for his job.  He is a very conscientious worker, who loves and enjoys his work.

loans.use: Purchase of necessary tools and equipment

loans.name: Kikoma Women's Group

texts.en:
Prossy N. is 42 years old and married with eight children, six of whom are in school. She is the leader of the Kikoma group in Mubende. Prossy has a retail shop in Kikoma that has been in existence for twenty years. From her shop she is able to make 100,000 UGX in weekly profits. These profits have helped her with her children’s school fees along with help from her husband.

A retail shop is a marketable business in her area, and this is what inspired Prossy to start this business. She was a farmer before opening her shop. Now she has succeeded in life. Her plan is to be able to finish up her house so that her children can lead a decent life.

loans.use: To restock her shop with more general merchandise.

loans.name: Nancy Esther

texts.es: Nancy V. es una mujer casada propietaria del negocio “La Terraza D. Nacho”, un sitio en el barrio las Palmas D. Barranquilla, ubicado en la parte externa D. su vivienda y rodeado D. arboles que refrescan la estadía D. quienes van a compartir sanamente y en familia la música y las bebidas. Este negocio  lo inició Nancy con la ayuda D. su esposo y D. sus hijos, aprovechando que frente a su casa está ubicada una cancha D. futbol, donD. practican ese deporte todos los días, y los fines D. semanas y festivos juegan partidos D. campeonato. Su mayor volumen D. ventas es justamente los días sábados, domingos y días feriados, porque la gente que juega en la cancha,  no solo se divierte con la música que suena, sino que también toman bebidas  refrescantes   junto a sus familiares, es decir los convierte en día D. integración familiar que disfrutan es esta mencionada terraza.  Nancy tiene 5 años D. pertenecer a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con su credikiva, el quinto financiamiento, comprará refrescos, bebidas y confitería,  pues se acerca el final del año lleno D. fiestas y con ello se aumenta el consumo D. bebidas, licores y confitería lo cual incrementará en un 20% la rentabilidad sobre la inversión, en tanto su rotación D. inventarios es D. 20 días,  su rentabilidad sobre las ventas 25%, la liquidez actual 3,1%, liquidez futura 2.1%, su capacidad D. pago con el crédito es D. 68% y su endeudamiento futuro 49% . Su mayor desafío es continuar fortaleciendo sus negocio con cada inyección D. capital que haga a su negocio, por eso valora mucho los créditos,  pues con ellos ha logrado ampliarlo y con ello contribuir con el sostenimiento D. su familia, así como adecuar su vivienda y hasta sostener una convivencia saludable, lo que la hace verdaderamente felíz.
texts.en:
Nancy V. is a married woman who owns the business 'La Terraza D. Nacho' (Nacho's Sidewalk Café) which is located in Las Palmas neighborhood in Barranquilla.  Her business is located outsiD. her home and is surrounded by trees that refresh the stay of people who pleasantly enjoy the music and drinks she offers, together with their families.

Nancy started her business with her husband and childrens' help.  She takes advantage of the fact that there is a soccer pitch opposite her home where people play soccer every day.  On weekends and on holidays, they play championship matches.  Nancy makes her largest number of sales on Saturdays, Sundays and holidays because people who play on the pitch don't only enjoy the music which is playing but also like to have refreshing drinks with their families.  They spend the day with their families in Nancy's sidewalk café.

Nancy has been a member of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 5 years.  Her Kiva loan is her fifth loan and she will use it to buy drinks and confectionery since the end of year is approaching and it is filled with parties.  She hopes to increase her sales of soft drinks, alcoholic drinks and confectionery which will increase her return on investment by 20%.  Her stock turnover is every 20 days, her return on sales is 25%, her current liquidity is 3.1%, her future liquidity is 2.1%.  Her capacity to fulfill payment obligations with the loan is 68% and her future indebtedness is 49%.

Nancy's biggest challenge is to continue strengthening her business with each injection of capital that she makes.  For this reason, she very much appreciates the loans she receives because with them she has managed to expand her business, help support her family, adapt her home and even maintain a healthy relationship which makes her really happy.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, alcoholic drinks and confectionery wholesale

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr: Née en 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, Véronique est mariée à Théophile et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Véronique vit ensemble avec sa famille depuis sept ans à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Véronique n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Il y a environs cinq ans que Véronique mène comme activité la vente de sachets et de tissus de façon ambulante ; ce qui lui permet d'aider son mari dans les dépenses du ménage. Véronique achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que Véronique sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé afin d'élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, surtout en ces périodes de fêtes de fin d'année.
texts.en: Born in 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, Véronique is married to Théophile and is the mother of three, all of whom attend school. Véronique has been living with her family in Ekpè for seven years, in the Sèmè-Podji village. The couple share the family’s living expenses. Véronique has never attended school. Véronique has been selling bags and fabric door to door for about five years, a business which allows her to help her husband with the household expenses. Véronique buys her products at Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. This is the second time Véronique is seeking financial support from ALIDé in order to increase her business and to better satisfy the needs of her clientele, especially in these holiday periods at the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy bags and fabric

loans.name: Savang

texts.en:
Mrs. Savang L. and her husband, Mr. Ny Souy, are both 45 years old and have been married since 1990. They have two daughters; one is in university and the other is in high school. 

Savang is a weaver, a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband sells mangoes. He buys them from his fellow villagers before harvest season. When the mangoes grow, he transports them to sell in a Phnom Penh market. Savang is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to provide capital for her husband to purchase more mangoes under contract for resale.

loans.use: to provide capital for her husband to purchase more mangoes

loans.name: Mireille

texts.fr:
Depuis 2ans  Mireille a ouvert son salon de coiffure devant sa parcelle, elle travaille à plein temps sauf quand elle repart faire ses taches domestiques. Mariée, mère de 3enfant en bas âges, elle coiffe, maquille, tresse et fait des soins esthétiques à ses clientes.

Le prêt passé lui a vraiment aidé car elle avait amélioré son salon et avait ajouté les produits de tout genre que les femmes utilisent souvent pour les soins capillaires.
Les mèches  et tissages qu’elle vendait ont aussi contribué  aux remboursements hebdomadaires de Hope.

Avec le prochain prêt, elle va renforcer son salon, améliorer les conditions et faire des prix de promotions.
Pendant les périodes des fêtes de : Tabaski, Ramadan, noël et les autres cérémonies, elle fait des recettes qui dépassent 60.000F par jour.
Dans le but de faire plus, elle compte ouvrir un institut de beauté pour sa progéniture.
texts.en:
Two years ago, Mireille opened a hair salon in front of her property. She works full time, unless there is housework to be done. She is married with three young children. She does her clients’ hair, makeup, braids and beauty treatments.

A previous loan was very helpful as it allowed her to improve her salon and offer a variety of products commonly used by women for hair care. She was also selling hair extensions and weaves, which helped with the weekly loan payments to Hope.

With the next loan, she plans to strengthen her business, improve her conditions and offer promotions. During the holiday periods of Tabaski, Ramadan, Christmas and other celebrations, she earns over 60,000 F per day.

She also plans to open a beauty school to benefit her children.

loans.use: To purchase hair and beauty products

loans.name: Unidas Para Alcanzar El Exito Group

texts.es:
Natalia se dedica a la venta de bebidas como gaseosas y cervezas, ella recuerda que hace 7 años tenia su bodega donde vendía de todo lamentablemente la cerro por motivos de salud y al requerir esfuerzo no podía brindar una buena atención  ya después de algún tiempo su salud mejoro y  como le habían sobrado envases de gaseosas empezó nuevamente a vender  pero ahora solo el rubro de bebidas actualmente tiene el negocio en su misma casa acondiciono un lugar y  atiende al publico, quiere utilizar su préstamo para la compra de bebidas el negocio que ella desea  para mas adelante es la venta de ropa  quiere buscar un lugar en una zona comercial donde pueda poner un bazar de ropa espera lograrlo muy pronto, de otro lado como presidenta de grupo “UNIDAS PARA ALCANZAR EL ÉXITO” esta aprendiendo mucho son 07 socias  que conforman el grupo y lo que mas las caracteriza es la puntualidad en sus pagos.

 *Natalia esta vestida con polo amarillo.
texts.en:
Natalia se dedica a la venta de bebidas como gaseosas y cervezas, ella recuerda que hace 7 años tenia su bodega donde vendía de todo lamentablemente la cerro por motivos de salud y al requerir esfuerzo no podía brindar una buena atención  ya después de algún tiempo su salud mejoro y  como le habían sobrado envases de gaseosas empezó nuevamente a vender  pero ahora solo el rubro de bebidas actualmente tiene el negocio en su misma casa acondiciono un lugar y  atiende al publico, quiere utilizar su préstamo para la compra de bebidas el negocio que ella desea  para mas adelante es la venta de ropa  quiere buscar un lugar en una zona comercial donde pueda poner un bazar de ropa espera lograrlo muy pronto, de otro lado como presidenta de grupo “UNIDAS PARA ALCANZAR EL ÉXITO” esta aprendiendo mucho son 07 socias  que conforman el grupo y lo que mas las caracteriza es la puntualidad en sus pagos.

 *Natalia esta vestida con polo amarillo.

Natalia sells drinks like sodas and beers.  She remembers that 7 years ago she had a store where she sold a little of everything; unfortunately she closed it for health reasons, as she wasn't able to give it the full attention and energy that it required.  After some time her health improved, and since she had leftover bottles of sodas she began to sell them again, but now she only sells drinks.  Currently her business is in her home where she re-purposed an area to attend to the customers.  She wants to use her loan to buy drinks.  The business that she hopes to have in the future is selling clothes.  She wants to find a place in a commercial zone where she can put a clothes bazaar.  She hopes to achieve this very soon.  On the other hand, as president of the group "Unidas para alcanzar el exito" (united to reach success) she is learning a lot.  There are 7 members that make up the group, and they are all very punctual in their payments.

*Natalia is dressed in the yellow shirt.

loans.use: To buy drinks

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr: Mademoiselle  Akouwa   a 36  ans et mère  de  3  enfants.  Elle  habite  quartier Attiégou.  Elle fait  le commerce  de céréales pour  répondre aux besoins  de  ces  enfants.   Elle s’approvisionne  à  Anié en gros   et   revend  en  détail.   Elle  compte dans   cette  activité  6  ans  d’expérience.   Elle  demande  un  prêt  pour  acheter  3 sacs  de maïs, 3 sacs de mil et 2  sacs d’haricot.
texts.en: Akouwa is 36 years old and the mother of 3 children. She lives in the Attiegou quarter. She sells cereal grains in order to provide for her children's needs. She makes her purchases in wholesale at Anie and resells in retail. She has 6 years' experience in the field. She requests a loan to purchase 3 sacks of corn, 3 sacks of millet, and 2 sacks of beans.

loans.use: To purchase cereal grains.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 51, is a farmer in Nyamira town in Western Kenya. He is married with seven children between 3 and 22 years old. Five of the children are still in school. His mixed farm produces tea, which he sells through Kenya Tea Development Authority and beans, onions and milk, which are sold to the local market. He also relies on his pension pay to cater to the basic needs of his family. 

He has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes the income from the dairy project will cater to the education of the children still in school. He is focusing on acquiring more acreage to expand his farm and requesting more loans in the future.

He, however, laments that the markets are not offering good prices and pests and diseases are a great challenge to business.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Chen S., who is married and resides with her family in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples, sells fish, earning an income of USD 4 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 30 on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more fish for sale. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny A. is from the village of Canicapan Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Leny is single. To make a living, Leny owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buy and selling RTWs in the local community. Leny has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Leny joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leny is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like mosquito nets and blankets for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Leny from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products such as mosquito nets and blankets for sale

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea S. earns an income by providing sewing services to her neighbors. She has been running this sewing business for over two years. She can sew both traditional cloth and modern cloth. She makes about $3 profit per day to put towards her daily expenses. The other financial earner is her husband who is a gas seller in Ang Snoul district, which is not far from Phnom Penh City. Her husband’s business is growing smoothly because he has good communication skills in dealing with his valued clients. Currently, he wishes to expand his gas selling, but he faces a financial problem. To overcome this obstacle, Chea S. would like to ask for a loan from Kiva for her husband to use to stock up on gas in his store for future sales. The couple is blessed with two single children who are still enrolled at the local school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of gas for her husband's gas selling business

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina tiene 35 años, vive con su hija  en casa de un familiar. Desde hace 2 años vende dulces en la calle, en donde posee un pequeño stand móvil, instalándose en la puerta de los colegios u otros centros educativos. Es así que todos lo días se dirige ella con su stand muy temprano antes de que los alumnos entren al colegio y se queda hasta que culmine los dos turnos. Su trabajo es muy esforzado, pero su ímpetu de salir adelante hace que continúe, por ello procura siempre de que su negocio este abastecido con diversos productos comestibles y de golosinas, resultándole muy rentable su trabajo. Por ahora su mayor prioridad es tener una carretilla para transportador sus dulces. Es su crédito número 14 que tiene con MFP, trabajar en equipo es lo que más le agrada de su banco comunal además de que le ayuda a ser mejor en el control de sus finanzas por lo que esta muy agradecida y se compromete  a ser puntual en sus pagos en este ciclo de trabajo. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de dulces y gaseosas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Sabina is 35 years old and lives with her daughter in the home of a relative. For the past two years, she has been selling candy as a street vendor. Sabina has a small mobile stand that she sets up in front of schools and other learning centers. Every day she arrives very early with her stand before the students start classes and then stays until she has completed two shifts. Her work requires great effort, but the drive to move forward is what motivates her to continue. For this reason, she is always concerned about making sure her business is stocked with different food products and candies. These products make her work profitable. At the moment, her top priority is acquiring a cart for transporting candy.

This is her 14th loan with MFP. Sabina is very pleased to be a member of her Communal Bank because she gets to work as part of a team. She is grateful to be part of a group because it has helped her have better control over her finances. As a result, she promises to be prompt with her payments during this loan cycle. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of candy and sodas in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase candy and sodas.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 35 años de edad y es casado y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el realiza servicio de turismo y también servicio de taxi, el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, el también lleva turistas a distintos lugares como Ollantaytambo, Chinchero y Machupicchu, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de turismo.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para mantenimiento de su carro para comprar algunos repuestos de carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Madres Trabajadoras" ("working mothers") community bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is 35 years old and is married and has one child. The member alternates his daily activities with the transportation business. He provides a tourism service and also a taxi service. He works from 7AM until 6PM. He also takes tourists to different places like Ollantaytambo, Chinchero and Machupicchu. The member wishes to improve his tourism service.
