From the first loan from AqroInvest though Kiva, Tamella was able to make a small renovation of her shop. Tamella has requested a loan of 1,300 AZN to purchase more goods to increase her profit, which is currently 290 USD. 

Her husband is bread maker and his monthly profit is about 100 USD. This is not enough to cover the main needs of their two children. 

She hopes to use her profits to pay off her children’s college tuition. 

We are happy for another opportunity to assist her in developing a successful business. This will be her third loan from AqroInvest and second from Kiva, and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to increase profit.

loans.name: Dorotia

texts.en:
Dorotia is 55 years old and married with five children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past six years, Dorotia has operated a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

Dorotia is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 36 years old and married with four children. To make a living, Janeth has operated her general store for more than four years.  She earns about PHP 500 everyday.

She wants to expand her family business; that’s why she is taking out this loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional stock of items such as canned goods, biscuits, noodles and other ingredients to sell.

Janeth hopes to grow and expand her general store to secure her family's future and wants to educate her children so that they will become professionals someday. Despite the hardships of life, they are striving hard to earn and save for education purposes.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of canned goods, biscuits, noodles and other ingredients to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria Tumolba is from the village of Rang-ay, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 28 years old and married with two children. To make a living, Gloria has been selling different kinds of fish in the local community for almost 20 years and earns approximately PHP 800 daily.

According to Gloria, through the income generated from her business she has been able to give daily allowances to her children in school. Now, she wants to take a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase different kinds of fish, such as tilapia and milkfish to sell. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fish to sell

loans.name: Yeni

texts.es:
Yeni pertenece al banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” y cada treinta días las reuniones se realizan en la ciudad de Izcuchaca en la comunidad de Compone. 

Yeni tiene 23 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella nació en la comunidad de Yanama y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta y compra de yogurt, queso y granos secos. Yeni también se dedica  a la venta de verduras y ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Yeni requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo cebolla, zanahoria, coliflor y otras verduras. 

Yeni agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Yeni belongs to the community bank "San Isidro de Compone" and every 30 days the group meets in the city of Izcuchaca in the community of Compone.
Yeni is 23 years old and has a partner with whom she has a son. She was born in the community of Yanama and lives in the same city where she was born and where she works. She works selling and buying yogurt, cheese, and dried grains. Yeni also works selling vegetables and has been doing this for a year and the business is going very well. At this time, Yeni is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise such as onions, carrots, cauliflower, and other vegetables.
Yeni is grateful for the loan and values it, and promises to make her repayments by the monthly deadlines.

loans.use: to buy more supplies such as onions, carrots, cauliflower, and other vegetables.

loans.name: Sara Maria

texts.es:
SARA MARIA.
La señorita  Sara Maria,  necesita otro refinanciamiento de crédito para poder invertir en la compra de productos de primera nececidad en el pueblo donde ella vive ya que en su pueblo se selebra el dia de los santos  ella aprovecha  esa festividad para poder crecer sus ingresos y tambien quiere invertir en la compra  y venta de tarjetas telefónicas de las  tres empresas  inicio su negocio desde hace 8 años  con la ayuda de sus papas ella pudo lograr lo que hasta ahora tiene  y agradece a la institución  por la confianza que le ha brindado  durante el tiempo que ella a trabajado con créditos su deseo es siempre seguir adelante  y a si poder ayudar económicamente a sus padres cuando tienen alguna enfermedad, y poder  crecer  más su negocio y surtirlo
texts.en:
Sara María needs another loan to be able to invest in buying household necessities in the town where she lives, since in her town they celebrate All Saints' Day.  She is taking advantage of this celebration to be able to increase her income.  She also wants to invest in buying and selling phone cards for the three companies.

She started her business eight years ago.  With the help of her parents she managed to achieve what she has up to the present.  She is grateful to the institution for the trust it has given her during the time that she has worked with loans.

Sara María's desire is always to get ahead, and so be able to help her parents financially when they have some illness, and be able to grow her business and stock it.

loans.use: to buy household necessities.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina is 60 years old. She is a market vendor and sells women's and children's clothes in the central market of Agsu city. She is married and has five children. Her son helps to run the business and bring clothes from another city. Sakina has 5 years of experience and her profit is 300 AZN. She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan to purchase more stock and increase her profit. This will allow her to improve the life of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Ismary Yessenia

texts.es:
La señora Ismary tiene 35 años y vive en La Rosa, un barrio que pertenece al municipio de Yoro. Ismary es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos: una niña de 12 y un niño de 5 años de edad. La niña está asistiendo a la escuela. 

Hace 12 años Ismary empezó una pulpería con esfuerzos propios. A través de los años ella ha mantenido bien el negocio. Trabaja todo el día en la pulpería, la cual está ubicada dentro de su casa. Ismary comenta que su casa está en la esquina del parque de la comunidad y que no hay pulperías cerca. Puso el negocio para dar un mejor servicio a la comunidad y para superarse. Ofrece una variedad de productos como arroz, azúcar, manteca, cafe, refrescos, jugos, pan, churros, sal, cubitos, sopa, y huevos entre otros. 

Ismary tiene la visión de ampliar sus ventas y convertir la pulpería en un mini-bodega. Solicitó este crédito de L20,000 para surtir su inventario con la compra de refrescos, manteca, churros, huevos y otros productos. Con las ganancias, Ismary espera educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Ismary is 35 years old and lives in La Rosa, a neighborhood in the town of Yoro.  Ismary is a single mother with two children; a 12-year-old daughter and a 5-year-old son.  Her daughter attends school.

Twelve years ago, Ismary opened a convenience store through her own efforts.  Over the years, she has been able to keep the business going well.  She works every day in the convenience store, which is located in her home.  Ismary comments that her home is on a corner of the community park, and there aren't any other convenience stores nearby.  She started the business in order to provide a service to the community, and to be able to move ahead in life.  She offers a variety of products for sale, such as rice, sugar, butter, coffee, sodas, juice, bread, churros (fritters), salt, ice-cubes, soup, and eggs among other things.

Ismary has a vision of expanding her sales and converting her convenience store to a mini-market.  She is requesting this credit of L20,000 to stock up on inventory by purchasing sodas, butter, churros, eggs, and other products.   With the profits, Ismary hopes to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, butter, churros (fritters), eggs and other products.

loans.name: Barbara Hilda

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Barbara continua con su negocio de la tienda de abarrotes y su restaurante, la socia se organiza muy bien y trabaja mucho por lo menos tendra este ritmo un par de años mas para poder luego descanzar y solo dedicarse a su tienda de abarrotes. La socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, fideos, leche, panetones para las fiestas navideñas entre otros y también viveres e ingredientes para el restaurante.
texts.en: This member is Barbara, who has continued with her grocery store and restaurant businesses. She is well organized and works very hard, and she will have to do so for at least another couple of years before she can relax and focus only on her grocery store.  On this occasion Barbara has requested a loan to buy staple goods like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, panettone for Christmas, and other ingredients and provisions she needs for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy staple goods such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, panettone for Christmas, and other ingredients and provisions she needs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Amani Group

texts.en:
Blantina is a 49-year-old mother of four, among them one child receiving a secondary education. She has been producing maize for over three years. She is also dealing with business activities buying and selling fish. She is getting a low income due to the number of problems facing agricultural activities such as crop diseases and lack of fertilizers.

Blantina is looking for a new source of funds that can help her to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. Also she is working hard to expand her scale of production from 2 to 10 acres that can lead to an increase in her income. 

In photo attached there are seven members of the group and three members names available are those with Kiva loan and the rest four members don't have loan.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es: El señor Cipriano es nuevo integrante del grupo, el va a comprar con su préstamo blusas y pantalones de dama, el tiene 48 años de edad, es casado tiene 1 hijo varón que estudia la primaria, el vende ropa, el solicito su préstamo para comprar blusas y pantalones para dama, el inicio su negocio hace 10 años, por falta de recursos económicos fue comprando poco a poco, el ofrece a su clientes faldas, blusas, camisas pantalones, ropa interior de dama y niñas, el sale a vender su mercancía los fines de semana va de casa en casa ofreciendo la ropa, su negocio es importante porque va sacando para la comida y para los gastos de la escuela de su hijo, el se siente feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir lo va a utilizar para surtir su negocio y tenerlo bien surtido de ropa y así tener mas mercancia para ofreceerles a sus clientes. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que su hijo se supere, que siga estudiando y que venda mejor su ropa. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por la confianza que nos tienen, que sin conocernos nos ayudan con sus préstamos y le vamos a echar ganas a trabajar en los negocios para vivir mejor con la familia”.
texts.en:
Señor Cipriano is a new group member. He will use this loan to buy blouses and women's pants. He is 48, married, and has one son who is in elementary school. Cipriano sells clothing and has requested this loan for the purchase of blouses and women's pants. He started his business 10 years ago, and because he did not have much capital he has been buying stock bit by bit. He offers skirts, blouses, shirts, pants, and underwear for women and girls. He goes out to sell his merchandise door to door on weekends.
His business is important for providing his family's daily bread and for covering his son's school costs. Cipriano is happy to have this loan. He will use it to stock his business in order to have lots of merchandise to offer his customers. His hopes and dreams are to sell better clothing and for his son to succeed and keep studying. The group members have the following message for Kiva and the Fundacion Realidad:
"Thank you very much for your confidence in us. You don't even know us, but you are helping us with our loans. This encourages us to work in order to improve our families' lives."

loans.use: to buy blouses and women's pants.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a 24-year-old married man with one child, too young for school. He lives in a rental house with neither electricity or piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

For the past three years, Juma has operated a retail shop, selling items at the market to his neighbours and passersby. The major challenge in his place of operation is seasonality. With a loan of KES 20,000 Juma wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice to sell. 

Juma decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. He has a dream for the future to expand his business to wholesale and to hire more employees.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en: Maria Fe is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with four children. Maria Fe makes and peddles corn snacks like binake and tilaob. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making corn snacks. Maria Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 and, in the future, hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making corn snacks

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
Don José tiene 58 años de edad, el vive con su  familia, tiene 4 hijo, Su actividad principal es la venta de lubricantes y repuestos, desde hace más de 15 años,  Don José, esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de productos como ser: neumáticos, parches, líquidos de frenos, aceites y otros para la buena atención de sus clientes, el realiza sus ventas en un local junto a su casa de habitación , el es una persona muy trabajadora, ya que su negocio a sido la principal fuente ingresos, y se ha ganado la clientela por su buena manera de atenderlos, con el préstamo que reciba Don José, le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar, y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Los sueños de Don José es tener una parchadora de neumáticos automática y surtir mas su local 
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras Abril 2012
texts.en:
José, 58, lives with his family and has four children.  His main job for more than 15 years has been selling lubricants and spare parts.

José is requesting the loan to buy such products as tires, patches, brake fluid, motor oil, and other things for good customer service.

He makes his sales in a space next to his home.  He is a very hardworking person because his business has been his main source of income and he has gained customers for his good service.  The loan will help José to have a better business and get better income to cover the household expenses and give his family a better quality of life.

José's dreams are to have an automatic tire patcher and to supply his store more.

Danli, El Paraíso, Honduras, April 2012

loans.use: to buy tires, patches, brake fluid, motor oil, and other products.

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr: Angèle est une femme de 54 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 14 et 28 ans. Trois de ses enfants vont à l'école. Elle a ouvert un restaurant qu'elle gère depuis des années. c'est grâce à lui qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter les produit de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour elle. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de ses denrées alimentaires ( son stock de viande, de poisson et plantains et le petit nécessaire pour cuisiner ses plats. Cela lui évitera les déplacements quotidiens et diminuera ses frais de taxi, ça augmentera aussi ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce profit pour agrandir son restaurant, l'autre l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.ans
texts.en: Angèle is a 54-year-old married mother of four children between the ages of 14 and 28. Three of her children attend school. She opened a restaurant which she has run for many years. It is thanks to this restaurant that she is able to provide for her family. Buying specific catering produce does not earn her a great deal of money. This is where the importance of this business loan comes in. It would allow her to increase her food stocks (meat, fish, plantains and small essentials for cooking the dishes). This loan will cut out daily travel and reduce her taxi expenses. It will also increase her profits. She will reinvest part of these profits into expanding her restaurant. The rest will go towards providing for her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of meat, fish and plantains

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en: Teodoro B. was born in Quevado, Ecuador and has lived in Guayaquil for nearly fifteen years now. He is married with five children and owns a small auto mechanic shop called Taller Mecánico B.. Teodoro rents a shop in an area called La Zona and would like to own this building someday. When he first started out as an apprentice mechanic in another shop, he always dreamed of growing his business to be one of the biggest in Guayaquil. His hours are 9am until 7pm Monday through Saturday. Mr. B. is requesting a $950 loan to be able to purchase materials most often used in the day-today management of his repair shop. Specifically, he needs to buy engine compressors, gauges, hoses, pumps, and a heavy duty set of power tools. Teodoro want prospective lenders to know that he has a specific plan for reaching out to new clients and intends on growing his business two-fold over the next year.

loans.use: Specifically, he needs to buy engine compressors, gauges, hoses, pumps, and a heavy duty set of power tools.

loans.name: Ahadaga

texts.en:
This 37-year-old man lives in Khaladj village,Salyan region. He is married and has a child.

Ahadaga breeds calves in a private farm shed. He has been in this business for 4 years. With this business he meets the demands of his family. Through his business he has gained a great deal of knowledge and skills to expand his business.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy 4 calves.

loans.use: To buy 4 calves

loans.name: Faaoloviti

texts.en: Faaoloviti is a 38-year-old married woman with three children.  Neither she nor her husband has work outside of their small taro plantation.  Faaoloviti recognizes the importance of continually reinvesting in their land and plants to ensure they remain a viable and steady source of income.  Some of their crop has recently been the object of theft and a playground for wild animals.  Thus, Faaoloviti and her husband would like to invest in a barrier fence to protect their crop.

loans.use: Buy fencing material

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Saroeurn married in 1979 and has 2 sons and one daughter. Her husband passed away in 1997. She only managed to go to school through grade 3.

Saroeurn has been working in a brick kiln since 2002, and she is currently also growing vegetables to make extra money to support her family. All her sons and daughter have a job; her sons work in a company in Phnom Penh and her daughter is an administrator in a garment factory.

Saroeurn would like to borrow $500 from MAXIMA to fix her roof and the wall of the house so that the family will be not worry about the weather any more. They are friendly and honest. All members of the family have monthly income so we are sure they will pay back the loan without any problems.

loans.use: Fixing house - repairing the roof and wall.

loans.name: Izafa

texts.en:
Izafa S. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Lachin district of Azerbaijan in the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict territory. She settled with her family in Sumgait city. She is 41 years old and married with 3 children. Izafa is the only breadwinner in her family.

Having borrowed a first loan of $500 from Normicro, she opened a shop. The second time, she borrowed $800 and built a grocery store. All her loans were paid back timely. The third time, she applied for a $1,000 loan from KIVA for expanding the area of her shop and increasing the assortment of food for sale. She has already achieved this goal and paid all her monthly payments in time.

Izafa now needs another $1,200 loan from Kiva to expand her business further, open a vegetables section in the store and buy digital scales. She hopes to improve the living conditions of her family with the additional expansion of her business.

loans.use: To expand her business, open a vegetables section in her stores and to buy a set of digital scales.

loans.name: Kafa

texts.en: Kafa is a hairdresser who lives with her husband in in Ouzai, a very poor area in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. Kafa is a 44-year-old woman who is striving to help her husband support their extended family (they have no children). She is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase beauty products and develop her business. Kafa belongs to a loan group with other women from the same area.  A group is usually constituted of self-chosen women living in vulnerable conditions. The group lending is based on incrementA. increases of loan amounts and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages the collaboration approach in the borrowing community. It is a very powerful tool towards economic empowerment of women. Kafa has borrowed five loans from A. Majmoua in the past and always repaid her them on time. Kafa is proud of being an economically active woman in her society.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for her hairdresser business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate the business stall, and to purchase additional stock for shoes, including shoe soles, and leather

loans.name: Sariah

texts.en: Sariah is 44-year-old woman who produces bamboo handicrafts at her house. She usually earns about US$ 23 per month. Her husband, M., has no fixed income. She is requesting a loan of US$ 150 to expand her business. Since she became a member of MBK, her business is doing better and better. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Odete Alberto

texts.pt:
Odete Alberto M., bearer of ID number 110255407P, is married and has 3 children. She joined the program on October 28, 2005 and is on her 6th loan. She is requesting 15000 MT, to be repaid in 6 months. She plans to invest the money in her business of selling staple goods such as eggs, oil, etc.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Odete Alberto M., portadora do BI nº 110255407P vive maritalmente tem 3 filhos entrou no programa a 28/10/05 esta no 6º coclo vai tomar o valor de 15000 apagar em 6 meses com o valor vai investir no negocio ela vende produtos de 1º necessidade tais como ovos oleo etc.

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Maqbool's Group

texts.en:
I have been a group leader for the last five years.  Shahnaz K., Fatima A., Bushra M. and Jameela R. all will buy separate dairy cows for their milk business. These women are very cooperative and exhibit the necessary discipline required. 
I belong to KRK, a small semi urban in Pakistan. I am a mother of five girls and four boys. Four of my kids are married including three girls and one boy. I am borrowing for my milk sales business; I sell milk to various milkmen in my town who come to my house to collect milk. With my share of loan I plan to buy an additional dairy cow. My income has increased substantially over the past four years since I am the member at Asasah.  My business grew and I was able to save enough money to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: Buy an additional cow

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es:
Martha is a 38-year-old young single woman. She lives in the neighborhood “380” with her 16-year-old daughter. She works as a cashier at a department store called SIMAN. This single mother was able to buy her house with her own effort. She has done improvements to the house with the help of loans, in order to set up a business of selling chicken in the future. She is requesting a loan to build a roofed porch for her house. Little by little she is trying to make her house a safer place and this way her daughter will be able to support her in the business that she has in mind to have more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha Es una joven mujer de 38 años de edad, soltera y habita en el Barrio 380 con su hija de 16 años de dad. Trabaja como cajera en una Tienda por departamento llamada SIMAN, con esfuerzo propio esta madre soltera compró su casa y ha venido mejorándola con apoyo de créditos, con el propósito de montar un negocio de venta de pollo en un futuro. Solicita un crédito para construir el porche de su casa y techarlo, poco a poco pretende darle a su casa mas seguridad y así su hija le apoyará en el negocio que tanto tiene en su mente para tener más ingresos.

loans.use: Buid the porch for her house.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Mr. C. Conrrado lives together with his family, which is composed of three people including his wife and a nine-year-old daughter who is in her third year of primary school. Mr. C. is the only financial provider of his family; through his own force and a long period of time he worked as a driver and was finally able to acquire a local taxi line in the city of Juigalpa, which allows him to guarantee his family their daily bread. As part of his role as a sole source of income, with this loan request he hopes to be able to change his vehicle's tire and provide his clientele with a better sense of safety. Early in the morning, at 4:00 a.m., he begins his eight-hour shift, and in spite of the competition he has been able to carry his family forward. His primary goal is to develop as a small business owner and as the head of a family.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. C. Conrrado habita junto a su familia compuesta por 3 personas, su esposa y una hija de 9 años que cursa el 3er grado de primaria; el Sr. C. es el unico sosten familiar, por esfuerzo propio y mucho tiempo de trabajo como conductor, logró adquirir una linea de taxi local en la ciudad de Juigalpa, el que le permite garantizar el pan de cada dia a su familia; consistiendo en su unica fuente de ingreso, con la presente solicitud pretende realizar cambio de llantas al vehiculo y presentar mayor seguridad a su clientela. Temprano a las 4:00 a.m. comienza su turno el que tiene duracion de 8 horas, a pesar de la competencia ha logrado sacar adelante a su nucleo familiar, su principal obtetivo es desarrollarse como pequeño empresario y como padre de familia.

loans.use: Vehicle Maintenance (Source of Work)

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen F. M., wife of F. M., has six children: one daughter and five sons. Previously, she successfully started her own sweetmeat business, from a loan that she received from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. She would now like a loan to buy and expand the sweetmeat shop.

Her loan group members include: Razia B., who wants to repair a rickshaw; Razia B., who wants to start a tea business; Zubaida B., who wants to expand her electronics business; and Kubran B., who wants to expand her food business. This loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Ricarda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ricarda Torrez has a small general store in the municipality of Sandino in Managua, Nicaragua. She began the business more than 30 years ago, and has been able to improve the quality of life and financial situation for her family.

To continue to grow her business, she now needs to invest in more products to sell to her customers. She is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to make the necessary purchases and continue to move her business forward.

La señora Ricarda Torrez se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual lo atiende en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua Nicaragua.

El negocio lo comenzó desde hace mas de 30 años y por medio de este ha mejorado su condición económica y ha logrado salir adelante junto con su familia.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo, actualmente su negocio necesita la pronta inversión en la compra de sus productos para comercializarlos. Es por esta sencilla razón que solicita el crédito en Ceprodel para realizar dicha compra y así salir adelante en su negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
Nelly has been dedicated to selling clothes via order for the past five years. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Previously she had a stock of products in her home, but due to economic problems she now only takes part in the purchase and immediate delivery of the items. For the past six years she has also participated in neighborhood committees. The loans she has requested have helped her with the purchase of the clothing she offers. Nelly would like to have a post in the market where she could sell clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Nelly se dedica a la venta de ropa por pedidos desde hace 5 años. Sus clientes son sus conocidos y vecinos. Antes ella tenía stock de productos en su casa, pero por problemas económicos, solo se dedica a la compra y reparto inmediato. Desde hace 6 años, ella también participa en la directiva del comité del vaso de leche de su barrio Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para comprar la ropa que ofrece. A Nelly le gustaría tener un puesto en el mercado donde vender ropa.

loans.use: Purchase the clothing she offers via orders / Para comprar la ropa que ofrece por pedidos.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan Bautista is 59 years old. He has been married for 30 years to Nimia, who is 52 years old. Together they have raised three children who are already grown up. Their children have finished secondary school and have begun jobs in various professions.

Juan Bautista tells us that he began his business 40 years ago because he didn't have a chance to study and he had to look for work. This was how one day he found work with a tailor in the area and learned from him everything related to the profession.

With significant sacrifice and efforts, he has managed to save a good amount of money with which he was able to open his own tailoring shop 20 years ago. Today he has various sewing machines and he gives work to two people he trusts. He makes coats of all kinds and sizes, and recently he opened a well known tailor shop in the capital. For this opportunity he needs a loan in order to buy fabric as he has received an important order of coats for school uniforms.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Bautista tiene 59 años de edad, está casado hace 30 años con Nimia que tiene 52 años de edad. Juntos han criado a tres hijos que ya son mayores de edad, han culminado sus estudios secundarios y se encuentran trabajando en distintas profesiones.

Juan Bautista comenta que se inició en la profesión hace 40 años debido a que no tuvo muchas oportunidades para estudiar y tuvo que salir a buscar un empleo. Fue así que un día consiguió trabajo con un sastre de la zona y aprendió con él todo lo relacionado a la profesión.

Con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo logró ahorrar una buena cantidad de dinero con el cual pudo montar su taller propio hace 20 años.

Hoy día ya cuenta con varias máquinas de coser y le da trabajo a dos personas que son de su entera confianza. Confecciona sacos de todo tipo y tamaño que luego entrega a una conocida sastrería de la capital.

En esta oportunidad necesita de un préstamo para la compra de telas debido a que recibió un pedido importante de sacos para uniformes de colegios.

loans.use: To buy different types of fabric

loans.name: Mrs. Sam On Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This Village Bank loan consists of 16 members living in Chouy Dang Village in Kandal Province, led by Village Bank President Mrs. S. O., who owns a small grocery store in the local village. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it and so is requesting a loan to add more grocery goods to her inventory. Her husband, Mr. HoE. La, is a fisherman who makes a small income through the sale of his catches. 

Mrs. S. O. is 38 years old and the mother of three children, two of wH. are employed in a garment factory while the youngest is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods for her inventory.

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Mrs. Un R. was born in 1960 and lives in Pour Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She owns 1.5 hectare piece of land which she typically uses to grow rice. She is unable to cultivate rice because she does not have enough cows to plow the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase another cow to plow the rice field. With the rest of the money she will buy fertilizers and rice seed.

Mrs. Un R. is a 48-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and the other is a construction worker.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and buy fertilizers and rice seed.

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Al Progreso del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 41años de edad y tiene 3 hijos con su conviviente. Menciona que ha podido salir adelante aún cuando su centro de trabajo es su casa, que queda en la Av. Arias Graciani s/n Yungay, lugar donde funciona su tienda de abarrotes. Piensa que su mayor logro ha sido sacar adelante a su 3 hijos y hacer crecer su negocio junto a su conviviente, porque cuando ella empezó, nos manifiesta que empezó con una cantidad de S/. 1,000 y ahora ella estima que tiene en todo su negocio un aproximado de S/.180,000. En estos momentos, comenta, se encuentra tranquila porque todo le va muy bien, invirtiendo y teniendo utilidades específicamente para sacar adelante a su familia.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará víveres complementarios como cajas de detergente, jabones y crema dental.

Deysi menciona que asiste a capacitaciones para mejorar su negocio y que también le encantaría recibirlas por parte del Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Deysi belongs to the Community Bank "Mujeres Al Progreso" of teh district and province of Yungay in the region of Ancash.

She is 41 years old and she has 3 children with her common law husband. She says that she has seen success running her business from her home, located at Av. Arias Graciani in Yungay. From her home she runs a convenience store. She says that her greatest success has been raising her 3 children and having expanded her business with the help of her husband. When she started out she only had S/.1000 and now they estimate that they have S/.180,000 including everything in their store. Currently she feels comfortable because everything is going very well and especially because she has the means to take care of her family.

With this loan of S/.1700, which will be repaid in a term of 6 months, she will purchase products such as boxes of detergents, soaps, and toothpaste.

Deysi says that she is making efforts to improve her business and she would also like to continue being part of the movement Manuela Ramos.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products such as detergents, soaps, and toothpaste.

loans.name: Donatien

texts.en:
Muraho (Hello!) from Donatien U. in the northern province of Rwanda! Donatien is 26 years old.

Donatien started by selling groundnuts (peanuts) in the center of Masha, Cyabingo Sector, with a capital of 300 Rwf given him by his mother. This 300 Rwf working capital increased to 3000 Rwf in six months; then he started to sell salt. This business grew and enabled him to buy land for his mother and a bike, which helps him with transport.

After 3 years, his capital had increased to 80,000 Rwf and he started selling clothes in the market of Masha Center in Cyabingo sector. The business has been prosperous since he has reached a working capital of 300 000 Rwf, and with that amount, he opened a small shop in the same center of Masha. He decided to shift that rural center to Musanze Town after reaching a working capital of 400 000 Rwf. There, he is running a business selling different articles such as perfumes, soaps, bags, and detergent.

Donatien is requesting a loan worth 400 000 Rwf which will help him to expand his business. This loan will be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: Further expand his ever-growing business

loans.name: Sose

texts.en: Sose L., 35, is married and has three children.  She has many years experience in the plantation business. Her husband is a very good farmer, who works very hard on the plantation.  She sells to the general public and villagers three days per week. Sose has had two previous loans with SPBD, which are her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. She plans to purchase Gromoxone, sting, weedkiller chemicals, and taro tops for her plantation business.

loans.use: Purchase Gromoxone, sting, weedkiller chemicals, and taro tops for plantation

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El señor Marcos J. tiene ya mas de un año con su negocio de abarrotes, es el fuente de ingresos de su familia para poder darle lo mejor ya que tiene 4 hijos y dos de ellos están estudian.
Don Marco desea que su negocio crezca más y tener variedad de productos, como es papelería, mercería, perfumería y artículos para el hogar.  Pero en este momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder invertir en su negocio.
Es por eso que solicita de esté préstamo para poder comprar la mercancía y así no tener que descapitalizar su negocio. Y tener más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Marcos J. has had his grocery store business for more than a year. It is the source of income for his family to give them the best he can. He has 4 children, two of whom are studying. Marco would like his business to grow more and to have a variety of products like stationery, notions, perfume and articles for the home. But he does not currently have the money he needs to invest in his business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so he can buy merchandise and not have to take capital out of his business. And to increase his family´s income.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
Maria es una señora muy dedicada a su familia, por ello siempre busca la manera de apoyara a su esposo con el mantenimiento de ella. Es así que desde hace nueve años trabaja ofreciendo servicio de limpieza en la Municipalidad de su distrito. Antes de este trabajo ayudaba a vender a una amiga todo lo referente a productos de belleza y eventualmente preparando comida. Sin embargo, luego de un tiempo se independizó y con la ayuda de su hija vendía por su cuenta cosméticos por catálogo.
Sus ganancias siempre las ha destinado para la construcción de su casa. Justo ahora esta arreglando la fachada de su casa, ya que en unos meses piensa abrir, si consigue el capital, una bodega en su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is a women very dedicated to her family, and she always looks for ways to support her husband in maintaining the family. It's for this reason that for the past 9 years she worked offering a cleaning service in her district council. Before this job, she used to help a friend selling beauty products and eventually preparing food. After a time she became independent and with the help of her daughter, began to sell cosmetics from a catalogue from her own account. Her earnings have always been destined for the construction of her house. Now she is repairing the facade of her house, where, in a few months, if she obtains the capital, she is thinking of opening a grocery store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House construction

loans.name: Carmen Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Carmen del Socorro C. tiene la edad de 36 años habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla junto a su esposo él cual trabaja como electricista para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar; ellos tienen a su cargo dos hijos una adolescente de 13 años y niño de diez los cuales estudian, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de infraestructura del hogar para que sus hijos vivan cómodamente y por ende mejorar económicamente y la vez la  venta de la producción. Ella desde hace quince años se dedica a la agricultura durante este tiempo la mayor dificultad que se le ha presentado es la falta de financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes ya que estos carecen de mantenimiento lo cual no se desarrolla lo suficiente  para la venta de primera; inicio la activad de agricultora ya que por parte de su esposo hubo motivación par la misma y delegados de la zona del programa reforma agraria  quienes les brindaron un lote de una manzana para que la trabajará. Ella con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes para inducirlo al cultivo y obtener una buena cosecha y vender a buen precio al mercado
texts.en:
Carmen del Socorro C. is 36 years old. She lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla division with her husband, who works as an electrician to support the family. Together, they care for their two children, a 13-year-old girl and 10-year-old boy, who are both in school. Her family plans to improve the infrastructure of their home so they can live comfortably and thereby improve their econonomic situation and increase their sales.

Since the age of 15, Carmen has worked in agriculture. During this time, the most difficult challenge she has faced is not having enough money to buy fertilizers, the lack of which prevents her from selling top-quality products. She began farming because of her husband and because of the agricultural reforms which provided her with her own farm lot. With this loan, she will purchase fertilizers so she can have a good harvest and obtain good prices at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for farming

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
La sra. Ramona tiene 51 años, esta casada, y tiene 6(seis) hijos.  Su negocio tiene una antiguedad de 15 años y en su negocio vende todo tipo de mercaderias de consumo. La inversión del préstamo, lo destinó a la compra de todo tipo de mercaderias para la canasta fliar, lo que hizo su negocio este bién surtido. Los ingresos que le genera este negocio le permite cubrir los gastos propios de su familia además de los gastos del colegio de sus hijos.

Al inicio comenta que fue muy duro y difícil iniciar este negocio ya que no contaba con capital, y  las primeras inversiones realizadas fueron gracias a sus ahorros y con la ayuda de su marido que le facilito un pequeño capital.

En este emprendimiento Ramona tiene el apoyo y acompañamiento de sus dos hijos mayores quienes la ayudan en atender su negocio los dias que ella sale a hacer las compras y que muestran gran responsabilidad en la hora de hacerlo.
texts.en:
Ramona is 51-years old, married, and has six children. In her business, which is 15-years old, she sells all types of consumables. The loan will be used to buy all kinds of merchandise for the typical buyer, keeping her store well-stocked. The income from her business allows her to cover her family's household expenses as well as education costs. At first it was difficult to start her business, as she didn't have much starting capital and her initial investments were thanks to her savings and the help of her husband, who was able to obtain some money. In this enterprise Ramona has the support and company of her two older children, who help her to attend to the store on the days when she has to leave to make purchases and are very responsible in their work.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for consumption

loans.name: 39-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en: Thường

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Vukosava

texts.en:
Vukosava lives in a very developed village in Bosnia. She was born in 1985, is married and has one child. Vukosava’s child is still little and Vuskosava stays at home to take care of her house and her child. Her husband is employed and pays most of their household costs.

Vukosava also earns some income by working on her computer. She makes promotional material, does diploma work, price-lists for restaurants and similar material. She is very creative and wants to develop her business. She is  requesting her first loan from WWI (Women for Women International) in the amount of 1200 KM to purchase needed materials and equipment.

loans.use: To buy needed materials and computer equipment

loans.name: Mrs Rim Choem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is for a group of 24 people living in Mkak village in Kandal province, and the group will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs Rim C. is 57 years old and the village bank president. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is a garment factory employee while the other is a construction worker. Mrs Rim C. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice, and she needs fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

Eighteen members in this group have end-of-term (EoT) loans. This means they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. (The rest have monthly payment loans.) EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. An EoT loan allows the borrower to repay portions of the principal whenever he or she is financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Holmurod

texts.ru: Холмурод давлатов проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 50 лет. Женат, имеет 9 детей. Холмурод более 30 лет занимается растениводством. Он выращивает бахчевые и рисовые растения. В этом ему также помогает его семья. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения для посева.
texts.en:
Holmurod D. lives in the Rumy district. He is 50 years old, married and has 9 children. Holmurod has been involved in agriculture for over 30 years. He grows melon and rice plants. His family also helps him with the business. Our client is requesting this loan in order to buy mineral fertilizer for sowing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es: Doña Catarina Z. cuenta con 52 años de edad, es casada de oficios Comerciante, “Compra y venta de ropas típicas para mujeres”, habita junto  con su esposo y sus hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 10 años en el comercio en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xolcajá del Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Catarina Z. is a 52-year-old married woman who buys and sells traditional women’s clothing. She lives with her husband and children. She and her husband have been in this craft for 10 years, working from their home in the Paraje Xolcajá in the Poxlajuj canton, department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Currently, customer demand has risen, but her financial situation does not allow her to increase her capital, which is why she is turning to Asociación ASDIR for a loan with the intention of purchasing more merchandise. This way, she can boost sales, hoping to be able to help her children get ahead and have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience T. is 43 and is married. She has four children who are all still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Techiman in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. She is a trader who sells textile materials. She sells ready-made clothes and lace materials at the market square and also in her community. Patience has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy more textile goods to increase her stock. She aspires to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Nakalama C 1 North Kwayidi Alaisa Group

texts.en: Alaisa K. is 45 years old. She is married with eight children, one of whom is going to school. Also, she is taking care of three dependents who are also schooling. She has a soft drinks business selling juice like splash, Safi, soda, fresh passion fruits, water and so forth. She is using the loan to purchase the soft drinks mentioned above for resale. She is operating this business to earn a living and moreso to educate her children. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to construct a house and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Lomer

texts.en:
Lomer H. is from the village of Pigsag -an Cagayan de Oro City. He is 37 years old. Lomer is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Lomer owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Lomer has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lomer joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lomer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Lomer is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Lomer from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Teolith

texts.es:
La señora Teolith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 57 años, es madre de 02 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Teolith, lleva años 15 dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo así implementar su taller de confección de vestidos mas establecido y teniendo la habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, decidió implementar su propio negocio ubicado en su misma casa.

Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus costuras, trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. A quienes les  atiende  con la amabilidad y el carisma  que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 400.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Teolith, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Teolith is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Valerosas II” (Courageous Women II), which is located in the District of Tarapoto, Province of San Martín, Department of San Martín. She is 57 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children who are financially independent.

Teolith has been making clothes for 15 years. Over time, she started generating her own income and saving money. She wanted to start a dressmaking shop and utilize her sewing ability, so she did not hesitate in seeking assistance from Manuela Ramos with starting a home-based business.

She tells us that she receives several orders in advance from customers requesting clothing. She attends to her clients with a friendly and charismatic personality.

With her loan of 400 soles, Teolith will buy meters of fabric in different styles and colors, scissors, large spools of thread in various colors, regular and sewing machine needles, pins, and buttons.

Teolith feels that now she is a very accomplished woman with more desire to achieve and fulfill her other dreams. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Grace Group

texts.en:
Grace Group consists of five borrowers led by 39-year-old Jonas Q.. He is married and has three children, ages two to eighteen years old, with some attending classes from kindergarten to ninth grade. He is a high school graduate but couldn't continue his education due to lack of financial support from his parents.

Jonas and his family live in West Point, close to downtown Monrovia in Liberia. West Point is a very crowded community, so life is difficult there. As a result of hardship and poverty, the crime rate is very high in West Point; therefore, most people living there wish they could afford to relocate.

Jonas’s business is importing goods for personal use from Ghana and selling them to the residents of West Point. This business enables him to feed and care for his entire family. Jonas has been running this business for over eight years, and giving his customers quality goods is what has brought him this far. 

While Jonas started this business with a small amount of cash, it is now growing, and he would like to establish a big store. He needs and is requesting this loan in order to import more goods from Ghana.

Jonas's dream is for his children to become well educated and have a good future.

loans.use: To import more goods from Ghana

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de pagne pour la revente

loans.name: Afiavi

texts.fr: R. Afiavi est née le 17 Juillet 1971 à Aného au Togo, État voisin du Bénin. Mariée à KAYOSSI Joseph, un militaire,  Afiavi est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. C'est depuis cinq ans que  Afiavi réside au quartier Akpakpa Sodjéatinmè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Afiavi vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. A l'école, Afiavi s'est juste arrêtée au cours primaire. C'est une couturière qui vend également des tissus pour rideaux et draps depuis 11 ans, à son domicile et par le système de distribution. Afiavi fait ses approvisionnements à Lomé, capitale du Togo.  Afiavi n'a jamais obtenu de crédit de ALIDé ; elle sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité en la diversifiant et accroître son fonds de roulement.  Afiavi ambitionne plus tard ouvrir sa propre boutique pour ses activités.
texts.en:
Afiavi R. was born July 17, 1971 in Aného, Togo, a neighboring country of Benin. She is married to Joseph Kayossi, a military officer. Afiavi is the mother of two children who all attend school. For five years Afiavi has lived in the Akpakpa Sodjéatinmè neighborhood of Cotonou, economical capital of Benin. Afiavi helps her husband in the family expenses. As to school, Afiavi herself quit school at the primary level. For 11 years she has been a dressmaker who also sells fabrics for curtains and sheets from her residence and through a distribution system. Afiavi purchases her supplies in Lomé, the capital of Togo. Afiavi has never obtained a loan from ALIDé before. She requests a credit from ALIDé to grow and diversify her business and increase her working capital. Afiavi aims later to open her own shop for her activities.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase curtains, sheets and kitchen implements.

loans.name: Silvio Jose

texts.es: Silvio,  es soltero, no tiene hijos, trabaja como notificador del poder Judicial en el municipio de Nueva Guinea desde hace 4 años, esta solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do crèdito, para invertirlo en compra de materiales de construcciòn y posteriormente con otro credito hacer la construccion de su casa,  pues actualmente habita en casa de sus padres, su sueño es seguir estudiando para llegar a ser un excelente profesional y tener mejores condiciones, es un joven muy querido por sus compañeros de trabajo por ser muy humilde y de buenas costumbres.
texts.en:
Silvio is single and has no children. He has worked as a process server for the court in the municipality of Nueva Guinea for the past four years. He is requesting his second loan in order to purchase construction materials and later, with another loan, construct his house. Currently he lives in his parents' home. His dream is to keep studying so he can become an excellent professional and have better living conditions. He is a young man who is adored by his co-workers for his humility and good manners.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
This is Rosario P., 65 years old.  She and her husband Venerando, 67, are vendors.  They live in Parola, Tondo, Manila- a shanty community very near Manila Bay.  They have two children.
 
Rosario has been doing business for twenty-five years.  She buys and sells assorted fruit.  Her fruit dealership now earns more than P50,000 a month.  She grew tired of moving around delivering fruit so she is looking forward to having her own fruit stall near their house or in the market.  

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 1998.  Rosario has applied for a new loan in the amount of P50,000.   With this additional capital, she plans to purchase more assorted fruit for her business.

Rosario hopes to send all her grandchildren to school from the fruit of her labor.  



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit

loans.name: Aerepaquita Nidia

texts.en: Aeropaquita is a nurse by profession, but the business that she started on her own is the sale on foot of used clothes as well as medicines. She has been managing this business for ten years and is an excellent client of Fundación León 2000.   She reports that her loans always help her to live a little more comfortably.  Aeropaquita has been struggling a little with her health but says that little by little she is getting better. Her dream is to improve her business and to be able to establish it in her home.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es: Juana María Q. B. de 58 años los sábados y viernes recorre el mercado oriental y los talleres de calzado en busca de los modelos que desea comercializar. Luego lo distribuye entre sus clientes esto es un trabajo arduo pero que le llena de satisfacción el sentirse útil  y capaz.
texts.en:
Every Friday and Saturday 58-year old Juana María Q. B. goes to the eastern market and the workshops that make footwear looking for the styles of shoes she wants to buy. Then she delivers them to her customers. The work is hard but it fills her with satisfaction and makes her feel useful and capable.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Twesigangane Group, Lugazi

texts.en: N. Margaret is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a hard-working and devoted lady who has had with a retail shop in Nantabulirirwa for a long time. Margaret is married with five children and she takes care of her siblings. Her business profits and savings help her in taking care of her family and dependants. In a week, Margaret makes 40,000/= profit and she hopes to increase this when she has more stock.  She needs a loan to be able to restock her shop with more sugar, salt, cooking oil, bread and soap for shop expansion.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her shop

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en: Mrs. Vuthy P. is 32 years old, and she is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Sokhun Dey, is a motorbike taxi driver who owns an old motorbike to support their family living. They are villagers in Phnum Lonteah village, in Takeo province. This family has a problem because their motorbike is old and breaks down. In order to support her husband, Mrs. Vuthy P. decided to ask for a loan amount 1,500,000 Rail from AMK to buy a new motorbike to replace the old one. The couple has three children, two of whom are studying in the local public school, while the other child is too young to study or work. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Reyna, pertenece al banco comunal  “NUEVA VISION DE URUBAMBA”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas, Urubamba está a 1 hora 10 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 26 años de edad, la socia es soltera y no tiene hijos, ella se dedica desde hace algún tiempo al comercio minorista, ella compra y vende ropa, al por mayor y menor, La socia viaja a la frontera entre Perú y Bolivia, compra en desahuadero ropa al por mayor y lo trae a vender a Urubamba, Nuestra socia tiene un stand en el centro comercial Sr. De Torrechayoc stand A-16; La socia solicita el préstamo para viajar y traer mercadería y ropa escolar.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our member, Reyna, belongs to the NUEVA VISION DE URUBAMBA community bank. She lives in the heart of the sacred valley of the Incas, Urubamba, about an hour and 10 minutes from the city of Cusco. Reyna is 26 years old and single with no children. She has operated a business, buying and selling clothes, for both the retail and wholesale markets for some time. She travels to the border with Bolivia, buys wholesale supplies of clothing at Desaguadero and brings them back to Urubamba to sell. She has a stand in the Sr. De Torrechayoc commercial market, stand A-16. Our member is applying for a loan to pay for a trip to buy school clothing that she will bring back and sell. Reyna is grateful for the opportunity that micro-lending provides her and she is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Sungulu Juma

texts.en:
Sungulu is a 51-year-old married lady and a mother to four children; two grown up and two who are still going to school. Both Sungulu and her husband are farmers which is their primary business. Sungulu also sells cereals as a secondary business from which she gets a total profit of Kshs 4,000 per month. She sells to residents of Gongoni-Malindi area.

She was introduced to Kadet by an existing member and is on her third loan. Sungulu has previously borrowed from KWFT. She has applied for a loan which she will use in the following manner: Kshs 20000 to purchase cereals for resale; Kshs 3000 to prepare land and Kshs 7000 to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting. She plans to continue expanding her business with the extra income she will get from this loan.

Sungulu describes herself as hard-working and she hopes to build business premises and invest in dairy farming.

loans.use: To purchase cereals for resale, prepare land, buy seeds and fertilizers for planting

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is 35 years old and married with seven children – two boys and five girls. Her children attend school and they are excelling. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports their home.
Magdalene sells drinks at wholesale and retail prices. She has been in this business since 2003 and hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger. She loves this business because she does not sell on credit and does not want to incur debts in her business. Magdalene is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma T., from the village of Balite, Sagay, Camiguin Province, is 48 years old, widowed, and the mother of four school-aged children. To make a living, Elma owns and operates a business venture selling charcoal and charcoal-related products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over four years, she earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting her first loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en: T. Nodira is 31 years old, is married and has one child. Ten years ago, she began selling shoes in the market since her husband’s income was not enough to cover her family’s expenses. That was how she got a taste of the business and was convinced that it provided her sufficient revenue. Currently, Nodira works in her business full-time and, thanks to her enthusiasm, she has made a name for herself in the market. However, her clients request more and more things each day, which is why Nodira is requesting a loan for 3,000 USD. With this money, she will be able to purchase more goods and therefore give her business a boost. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchasie new clothing to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Mrs. Vannak K. (in the photo), 31, and her husband, Mr. Sam-ath Sut, 40, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1996 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of the children are in school. 

Vannak has been a garment factory worker for fifteen years and her husband is a policeman. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to school.

loans.name: Margeret Mutebi

texts.en:
N. Margeret Mutebi runs a housing rental business in Kanyanya quarter zone, Kampala. She has run her business for the last eight years and her business has been basking in the glow of her sound customer relationship skills.

Margeret’s business, that started out with two rooms, has now grown into a lucrative franchise that the whole family has been relying on. In a month, her business generates her close to 460,000 Ugandan shillings.

Margeret’s future dream is to transform her business into a powerful and reputable enterprise. With this loan money, she not only wants to renovate her rental apartments, but also to construct more.

loans.use: To renovate her rental apartments and construct more

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel vive en casa alquilada y su mayor sueño es comprar un terreno para construir su casa, Maribel es conviviente, tiene 20 años y 1 hijo que le gustaría que sea profesional.
Maribel es socia del Banco Comunal Brisas y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo del ahorro.
Maribel vende quesos en su casa y barrio, los quesos los adquiere en los diferentes pueblos a donde viaja, además Maribel vende leña que adquiere de los productores. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de leña y quesos.
texts.en:
Maribel lives in a rented house and her biggest dream is to buy a plot of land to build a house of her own. Maribel is 20 years old; she is in a common-law marriage and has a son who she hopes will grow up to become a professional. Maribel is a member of the Brisas Communal Bank, and what she likes most of all is the encouragement to save. Maribel sells cheese from her home and around the neighborhood; she buys the cheeses in different villages where she travels. Maribel also sells firewood. She will invest the loan into the purchase of firewood and cheeses.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood and cheeses

loans.name: Nuevos Horizontes Group

texts.es: Manuela es casada, curso el sexto grado D. primaria, tiene dos hijas, ella y su esposo se  dedican a la Tejeduría, (Elaboración del Cortes Típicos), tiene 5 años con este negocio. Viendo la necesidad D. capital para poder ampliar su negocio, conjuntamente con otras vecinas se organizan para poder formar un grupo el cual se denomina NUEVOS HORIZONTES. Este Banco Comunal cuenta con doce socias, estas señoras se dedican a la tejeduría, algunas otras tienen tiendas D. consumo diario. El préstamo ellas lo utilizarán para compra D. materia prima y así podrán incrementar el volumen D. las ventas que realizan. Dicho grupo resiD. en el Cantón Xecanchavox, San Cristóbal, Totonicapán, esperan obtener mejores ganancias y contribuir al desarrollo D. se fanilia y D. Guatemala.
texts.en:
Manuela is married with a sixth graD. education ,and for the past 5 years has worked alongsiD. her husband in Tejeduria (confection of traditional clothing). Recognizing the need for greater capital to expand her business she joined with her neighbors to form the Nuevos Horizontes group. This community bank has 12 female partners, most of whom work in Tejeduria while some have small shops selling daily use items. They will use the loan to buy raw material to increase their sales volume. This group is from the Xecanchavox canton of San Cristobal, Totonicapan, and hopes to increase their profits and contribute to the development of their families and Guatemala.

Translated from Spanish by SolS. Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 53 years old. He is married and has seven children between the ages of 6 and 24. Five of the children are attending school.

He is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. He has been farming for 20 years and has employed two people from his community. His products are bananas, milk, beans, maize and tea, which he sells locally and to Kenya Tea Development Authority respectively. He is also employed as a primary school teacher.

David recently completed his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of KES.75,000 to renovate his dairy unit and purchase farm supplies. The extra income from this loan will enable him provide the basic needs of his family. He intends to purchase more dairy cows in the future to increase his milk production.

He is requesting Juhudi to increase the amount of loans offered and reduce the interest rate on loans.

loans.use: To renovate his dairy unit and purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 50-year-old single woman from Lebanon living with her mother and one sister. She has owned a toy shop in her town since 1996 and sells all type of games in addition to kids stories and books. She has been working hard in her store to be able, with the cooperation of her sister, to provide better life conditions for her sick mother. In order to fulfill her business objectives and increase the liquidity of her services, she is asking for a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.al. to increase her store purchases before the coming holidays because her sales rise during this period and she has to be prepared. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in her picture, not indicating her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in Microfinance. At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: Increase her store purchases

loans.name: Delilah

texts.en:
Delilah A. is from the village of Bantay, Solana, Cagayan. She is 26 years old. Delilah is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Delilah owns & operates a business, primarily raising goats for sale. Delilah has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Delilah joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Delilah is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to build shelter for her livestock. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Delilah from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To build shelter for the borrower's livestock.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with eight children,; five are in school and the rest are out of school. She has a poultry business and breeds broilers. With the KShs. 20,000 loan she wants to purchase more chicks and broiler mash. The challenge of her business is from thieves as they get away with her chicken at night. She has been in this business for four years. She gains additional income from the sale of piped water to her neighbors. She owns her home and has both water and electricity.

She cites her greatest expenses as the broilers' mash. She hopes to get a reliable customer for her chickens as she depends on her neighboring customers at present.
