loans.use: Buy chicks and broiler mash (feed)

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en: Orlando S. is from the village of Cabisera 27. He is 40 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Orlando owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per harvest. In 2010, Orlando joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his first from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hermenegilda; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes que atiende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia quiere ampliar la tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “KUKULI”.  The bank is located in Cusco District, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the Department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Hermenegilda.  She is 38, married, and has 3 children.  She divides her time with her grocery store that she takes care of from 6 am to 10 pm.  She sells basic supplies such as rice, sugar, milk and oil.  She would like to enlarge her grocery store and she is requesting the loan to buy products for it.

Hermenegilda thanks those who are part of this dream through the bank and loan and promises to make the payments in the established time frame.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to buy products for her grocery store

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Ainura I. is the leader of the group. She is 40 and divorced. She has to take care of her 2 children alone.  The elder daughter keeps house and the son is a schoolboy.  Ainura earns her living by working as an operator at the filling station “Aurdin”, she also makes money by selling bread on the market. Besides this she is planning to start cattle breeding (she now has 2 livestock animals). Her loan is to purchase 5 farm animals for increasing her number of cattle.  She will then be able to sell them and pay for her son’s education at university. Ainura’s intention is also to obtain a flat and provide a proper education for her son.

Toktobubu A., 58, is a widow with 3 children. The eldest son raises money by working as a loader, another one is a cattle farm worker, and the daughter is a house keeper. Toktobubu is a pensioner and her pension benefit is 32,000 soms per month. She is also engaged in cattle breeding. Out of her business profits she has managed to obtain an automobile and also to arrange her children’s weddings. Her loan purpose is to purchase 3 livestock animals. In future she is planning to increase her cattle stock and then to support her children financially.  

Venera S., 31, is married and her spouse is a seller. Currently the family is engaged in a business selling glassware. Past earnings made it possible for them to obtain furniture. The family hopes to get a loan in order to purchase goods for increasing their commodity circulation. In future Venera wants to buy a flat and also, together with her spouse, they are planning to give birth to a child.

Meerim Y., 26, is married. She has to bring up 2 children: the elder daughter goes to school and the younger son to kindergarten. Together with her mother, Meerim runs a business selling glassware. 5 years ago she received 10,000 soms from her mother and since that this kind of business has been the main source of income. The loan purpose is to purchase more goods for further resale. In the autumn Meerim wants to buy a house to give her children a good upbringing.

======================================
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
 
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit:  www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at  www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase farm animals for breeding

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He is from Lebanon. Despite his young age, he has been working as a journeyman for almost five years. He is also attending university. 

He works hard to manage his time between his business and his education. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay for his university fees. He is studying physics and is in his third year of university. He really likes his major and after his third year certificate, he will continue on for his Masters. 

In the future, he is planning to start working in a laboratory to gain experience and be able to expand his career.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees

loans.name: Lela Group

texts.en:
Betty D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Lela. She is 42 years old, married, and has three children who are between 14 and 20 years old. She is a college student. She describes herself as an earnest and hard-working woman. She cares for four siblings.

For two years she has been selling charcoal and water in the Elwa Community on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 9,000 LRD portion of this 45,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of charcoal and sacs of water. Her goal is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and water for resale

loans.name: Shabnam's Group

texts.en:
Shabnam (pictured holding the Asasah Passbook) is a homemaker in the city of Kamokay in Pakistan. She has resided for over five years with her husband, brother-in-law, and father-in-law in an area named Aulakh Abad in a two-room brick house. She stays at home and devotes herself to her numerous household responsibilities. She and her husband have no children.  
  
Her brother-in-law is involved in a medicine-selling business. At present, he operates his business from a room of the family house. He has been in this business for over three years and has developed a good reputation among his customers. People come to him to buy medicines to treat their illnesses and diseases.
 
Shabnam has applied for a loan for the first time from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother-in-law's business. With the loan he will buy medicines as well as renting a shop from which he will operate his business and reach a greater number of customers.
  
Shabnam is sure that through this investment her brother-in-law’s business will expand and become more profitable.

loans.use: To buy medicines and to rent a shop from which to operate the pharmacy business

loans.name: Triunfadoras Leales De Motupe Group

texts.es:
TRIUNFADORAS LEALES D. MOTUPE

Cristina pertenece al grupo D. alcancía comunal “Triunfadoras Leales D. Motupe” tiene 51 años D. edad y tiene el cargo D. presidenta su grupo el cual lleva 2 años trabajando con Edaprospo-Prosperidad y esta  conformado por 7 personas las cuales viven en L. misma calle y D. esa manera se fueron pasando L. voz asta juntarse 7 vecinos responsables y poder formar su alcancía comunal el cual le pusieron el nombre D.  “Triunfadoras Leales D. Motupe” por que todo el grupo se consideran leales unos a otros en L. foto Cristina sale al lado izquierdo D. L. foto con un polo D. color rosado.

Cristina es madre separada y tiene 4 hijos los cuales 3 D. ellos son independientes y 1 es dependiente L. señora Cristina comenzó trabajando en una casa como ayudante D. limpieza pero dejo ese trabajo y comenzó a vender ropa elL. misma como ambulante y D. esa manera Cristina pueD. mantener a su hija y quisiera un capital D. trabajo para poder comprar o alquilar un puesto D. venta en el mercado D. su localidad y asi poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
“TRIUNFADORAS LEALES D. MOTUPE”

Cristina is a member of the community bank “Triunfadoras Leales D. Motupe”. She is 51 years old and she is the president of the group which has been working with Edaprospo-Prosperidad for 2 years. The group is maD. up of 7 people that live on the same street; through word of mouth, they were able to bring together 7 responsible neighbors to form their community bank which was named “Triunfadoras Leales D. Motupe” because they all consider themselves loyal to each other. In the picture, Cristina is on the left and she is wearing a pink blouse.

Cristina is separated and she has 4 children; 3 of them are self-sufficient but 1 is her dependant. Mrs. Cristina started working cleaning a house but she left that job; then she started selling clothes as a street vendor and that is how she supports her daughter. She would like to have working capital to buy or rent a stall in her local market so she can continue supporting her family.

loans.use: Rent a market stall

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora María de Lurdes A. A. vive en la Ribera Morelia Municipio de Coapilla, Estado de Chiapas México, está casada con el señor Jais Vaquerizo Patricio en el cual procrearon cinco hijos cuatro mujeres y un varón. Dos de ellas  ya están casadas y tres aún están a su responsabilidad: Baltzaretti de 15 años, Marco Antonio en sexto de primaria y la más pequeña Estrella Yuriana de cuatro años.
Ella se dedica a su hogar y a la venta de dulces típicos de la región  como son: dulce de nuégados, coco y dulce de leche, también elabora tamales  que se venden en la región, ella solicitó el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes para poder realizar su actividad.
        La que lo motivo a realizar esta actividad fueron sus dos hijas mayores  quienes  le platicaron que es un buen negocio en donde se obtiene buenos resultados, así comenzó con esta actividad en donde le va muy bien ya que no hay necesidad de salir a venderlo fuera de su ribera pues hay personas que lo compra por encargo y  lo que queda lo sale a vender en las casas cercanas de su domicilio. A un a si su esposo la apoya con los ingresos de su hogar trabajando fuera de su pueblo para que juntos salgan adelante con su familia.
        Con las ganancias que obtiene de su venta de dulces y tamales compra más ingredientes para seguir elaborando su actividad, también ahorrar para comprar algunas cosas necesarias que le hacen falta en su hogar.
        "Gracias a KIVA y a FRAC por apoyar a personas como yo en sus negocios"
texts.en:
Mrs María de Lurdes A. A. lives in Ribera Morelia, in the town of Coapilla, in the State of Chiapas, Mexico.  She is married to Mr Jais Vaquerizo Patricio and they have five children: four daughters and one son.  Two of their children are already married and three are still in their care: 15 year-old Baltzaretti, Marco Antonio who is in his sixth year of elementary school and the youngest, Estrella Yuriana, who is 4.

María looks after her home and also sells traditional sweet treats from her region such as 'dulce de nuégados', 'dulce de coco' and 'dulce de leche'.  She also makes tamales that are sold in the region.

María requested her loan to buy ingredients so that she could carry out her business.  Her two daughters motivated her to set herself up in this business because they argued that it is a good business that obtains good results.  She therefore started this business which is doing very well.  She doesn't have to go far to sell her products as there are people who make orders with her and what she has left she goes out to sell in surrounding houses.  Even so, her husband helps her with their household income, working outside their town, so that together they can get their family ahead in life.

María uses the profits that she makes from selling her sweet treats and tamales to buy more ingredients so that she can continue in her business.  She also saves so that she can buy some things that she needs for her home.  "Thank you to Kiva and FRAC for supporting people such as myself in their businesses".

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make traditional sweet treats from her region and also tamales

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Gouloukan, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles font la couture, le commerce des tasses, de tubercules, d’arachides, la vente des galettes.                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.                                                                 
SANATA D. s’approvisionne en merceries et tissus au marché de Dioïla. Après fabrication de draps, elle effectue ses ventes sur place au niveau du village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’homme
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djekafo group, all married, have an average age of 43 and four children, and they all live in traditional extended families in the village of Gouloukan, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted as relatives and as neighbors. They sew and do business selling cups, tubers, peanuts, and cakes. This is their first group loan.

Sanata D. gets her fabric and notions at the Dioïla market. After making sheets, she sells them in the village square, for cash and credit to both men and women.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA, which will be used to pay back the loan and for medical expenses, groceries, and school fees. The rest will be reinvested in the businesses.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and sewing notions

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Rodolfo; el tiene 42 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como ingeniero electrónico, el socio trabaja de manera independiente y por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere seguir mejorando en su trabajo. El  socio solicita el préstamo la construcción de su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is a member of the Communal Bank “Banco del Desarrollo” (Bank of Development), which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

He is 42 years old and single. Rodolfo divides his time between his daily activites and his job as an electrical engineer. He works independently and through his job is able to move his children forward. Rodolfo wants to continue improving in his work. He is requesting this loan to build his house.

Rodolfo is happy with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: Home construction

loans.name: Democrito

texts.en:
Democrito A. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 45 years old. Democrito is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Democrito buys and sells coconuts for copra, dried coconut meat used for oil production. Democrito has been engaged in his business for over 11 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Democrito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Democrito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Democrito is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconuts for copra. This will be the third loan taken out by Democrito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconuts for copra

loans.name: Nolberta

texts.es:
Nolberta es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, departamento de Puno, tiene 50 años de edad, es  conviviente y tiene tres  hijos.  No tiene estudios. 
Se dedica a la producción de trucha, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo. Está trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, su primer crédito fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que utilizó en la compra de alimentos balanceados para la trucha, la trucha es vendido en la comunidad donde radica, debido a que los clientes vienen desde desaguadero a comprar y los productores lo único que hacen es entregar por kilo.
Con éste préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles, podrá comprar seis sacos de alimento, es decir 240 kilos de marca purina para alimentar a las truchas que se encuentran en dos jaulas.
Su sueño es incrementar más jaulas de trucha. Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es la capacitación realizada por la oficial d crédito y la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Nolberta is a member of the communal bank named "Maria Asuncion Galindo", located in the district of Juli, the province of Chucuito-Juli, in the department of Puno. She is 50 years old, married common-law, and she has three children. She did not go to school.

She has a trout hatchery and she runs the business together with her husband. She has been with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past three years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/500 nuevos soles and she used the loan to purchase balanced trout feed. The trout is sold in the community where she lives. Her clients come from Desaguadero to buy and producers sell by the kilo. 

With this loan, amounting to S/1500 nuevos soles, she will purchase six sacks of feed that is 240 kg of Purina brand feed, to feed the trout that live in two basins. Her dream is to have more basins for trout. She most enjoys her communal bank for the training provided by the loan officials and the savings program.

loans.use: To purchase trout feed.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth C. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old. Lilibeth is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Lilibeth owns & operates a business buying and selling seafood products including fish like sardines, mackerel & milk fish in the local community. Lilibeth has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Lilibeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish & working capital. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell like sardines & milkfish. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Lilibeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Gulmira Maksutalieva's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira M., 54, is the leader of this group. She is married, and her husband is an inspector for a local social fund. Twenty years of common life have gifted the couple with two daughters, the older of whom is now married and the younger, a student in college. She lives in the small town of Toktogul which is comprised of thousands of families like Gulmira’s. Gulmira herself is a kindergarten teacher, and together with her husband she breeds and resells cattle.

Seven years ago Gulmira used 7,000 KGS to purchase her first cow. Since then, she has managed to purchase nice furniture for the house and increase their heads of cattle. She is now applying for this loan in order to purchase additional cattle.

About Mol Bulak:

This loan is being presented by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of its “3-Ps” concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow larger) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Macarina

texts.en:
Macarina is 34 years old.  She is married and has 8 children, 5 of whom are in school.

Macarina has an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.   She has been raising pigs for the past 5 years.   To sustain her business, Macarina has borrowed and repaid 15 previous loans from NWTF.   

Macarina has requested a new loan of PHP 20,000  through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  In the future, she would like to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Geline

texts.en:
Geline B. is from Sta. Rosa, Gamu, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 49 years old. Geline is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Geline owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice in the local community. Geline has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Geline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Geline is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase groceries to sell in her store. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Geline from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en una casa propia, la cual cuenta con el servicio solo de luz por ser una zona rural, ubicada en el Cojal que pertenece al distrito de Cayaltí  y se encuentra a unos 30 minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo. Las actividades que se desarrollan es ésta zona es la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

José se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y aves de corral, desde hace 10 años aproximadamente, sus corrales se encuentran a unos minutos de su vivienda. A sus animales los  alimenta con dieta  balanceada y pastos naturales  y una vez que llegaron a su desarrollo ideal los vende en los distintos mercados de la ciudad de chiclayo, una vez que los vende podrá cubrir todas sus necesidades.

A solicitado un crédito José a Edpyme Alternativa de 600 nuevos soles para continuar comprando aves de corral para luego venderlas con la finalidad detener mejores ingresos para poder pagar el crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

José es una persona muy conocida en el lugar donde vive por sus ansias de superarse cada día y darles una  mejor oportunidad a su hijo en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old and lives with his wife and son in their own home.  They live in a rural area so they only have electricity.   They live in Cojal in the district of Cayaltí, 30 minutes from the province of Chiclayo.  The residents of this area work in agriculture, tourism and they raise livestock.  

José has been raising cattle and poultry for approximately 10 years.  His pens are located just a few minutes from his house.  He feeds his animals a balanced diet and natural grasses.  Once they reach their ideal size he sells them in the various markets in the city of Chiclayo.  Once he sells them he will be able to cover all his necessities.  

José is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 600 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] so that he can continue buying poultry to sell with the end result of having a better income to repay his loan and improve his family's quality of life.  

José is very well-known in his area for his desire to excel every day and to give his son a better chance in the near future.    .

loans.use: to purchase more poultry.

loans.name: Adisa

texts.en: For the past four years Adisa has been selling sweet potatoes. Demand for it has increased and therefore she needs a loan to enable her buy sacks of sweet potatoes for resale. The income realized from her sales would be invested in her children's education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a cleaner.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sweet potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Vitalia

texts.es: La señora Vitalia vive la colonia San Carlos, de la localidad de el Torno,  es nacida en valle grande Santa Cruz, su actividad principal es la venta de comida en su propio domicilio, hace unos siete meses que se dedica a esta labor, Convive con el señor Almaquio se dedica a la agricultura en Warnes, tienen tres hijos en edad escolar; el destino del crédito es para comprar un horno para  implementar el negocio de panadería, se sienten agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le a brindado.
texts.en:
Vitalia lives in the village of San Carlos, in the township of El Torno. She was born in the valley of Santa Cruz. Her business is the sale of food from her own home. She has been in this line of business for about seven months. She lives with Almaquio, who works in agriculture in Warnes. They have three school-age children. 

The loan is to buy an oven to start a bakery business. They are very grateful to the organisation for the support received.

loans.use: to buy an oven.

loans.name: Ngeno

texts.en:
Ngeno is a 32-year-old businessman who sells health products in Kenya. He stocks herbal products and also knits on the side for extra income. He has been in this business for four years and employs one person. He operates his business in a highly populated area in a residential estate. 

He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings, which is guaranteed by the members of Stars of Hope SHG group that Ngeno is a member of. With the loan, Ngeno intends to add stock of health products and knitting threads for the two businesses that he operates. Since joining Faulu, Ngeno says that his life has improved. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: to add stock of health products and knitting threads.

loans.name: Julia Xiomara

texts.es: Julia Xiomara tiene 31 años, ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Ella dio inicio con fondos propios, con el asesoramiento de sus compañeras de trabajo empezó dando créditos, a trabajadores de ciertas instituciones, así fue que empezó a obtener sus propios clientes, por lo que las facilidades de pago son quincenales y es mucho más favorables para sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita actualmente es para la compra de pintura de uña, pintura de labios, vanidad y ropa interior.
texts.en: Julia Xiomara is 31 years old, she works selling general merchandise.  She began with her own funds, and with the advice of her co-workers started getting loans through employees of certain institutions.  In this way she began to get her own clients.  She accepts payment every other week, which is much more favorable for her customers.  The funding that she is currently seeking is to buy nail polish, lipstick, vanity items and underwear.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, lipstick, vanity items and underwear.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Emelia has a shop that sells coconut wine by the gallon. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy plastic containers for the coconut wine.

Emelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Emelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy plastic containers for coconut wine

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Sokly is a pig feeder and makes wine to sell. Her husband is a car driver, and their income is $10 per day. She has three children; all of them are studying. 

Every month, she has to spend $83 on food, $15 on electricity, $40 on school fee, $30 on transportation, and $50 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy rice to use for making wine to sell. She used to be a teacher but she could not make a  good income to support her family so she tried raising pigs at home, first one and then two and now she can make good income from selling pigs, so she wants to extend her livestock raising by buying more pigs to feed and sell. As for her children, she will try to support them while they study in the university.

loans.use: To buy rice to use for making wine to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 43 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married, has five children and has made a living for the last five years by selling fish. She is applying for a loan for PHP 3,000 to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for the last two years, and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is 36 years old and married with two children aged 10 and 14. She is engaged in rice farming and hog-raising. Her husband mainly manages their rice farm and she also helps grow rice crops when she can. Mildred spends her time raising pigs and taking care of their children. She does her best to help augment their income and send their children to school. Mildred has requested a loan to purchase 4 sacks of feed and 3 sacks of vitamins for her pigs. She is hoping for her family's living situation to improve.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of feed and 3 sacks of vitamins

loans.name: Wilfrido

texts.es: Wilfrido de 59 años vive con su esposa y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 29 a 34 años. En su negocio ubicado al sur de la ciudad, se dedica a la tapicería y pintura de muebles para el hogar; actividad que inició desde el año 1991, experiencia con la cual ha trabajado durante 20 años y que capitalizó ubicando la microempresa en la parte delantera de su vivienda. En su negocio otorga plazos de 7 dios  y trabaja con anticipos de dineros;   su competencia es fuerte pero se sostiene con calidad y cumplimiento oportuno,  las compras las realiza de contado en el centro de la ciudad a proveedores varios. Las líneas de trabajo en su tapicería, son silla, juegos de sala, comedores, automóviles. Su meta mas adelante es renovar los equipos de su tapicería y lograr adquirir su propia casa. Su mayor desafío es el capital de trabajo que no es suficiente, para lograr rápidamente sus metas de crecimiento y también la utilización del espacio familiar para su desempeño producto, que no le generan el tan anhelado sosiego familiar. Mientras Wilfrido trabaja para conseguir alcanzar sus metas, maneja una razón corriente de 2,96 veces, y una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 39,77%, indicadores a partir de los cuales proyectamos su potencial crecimiento y auguramos una exitosa inversión de su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materiales de tapicería, gomas clavos, hilos telas y forros.
texts.en:
Wilfrido is 59 years old and lives with his wife. They have four children between the ages of 29 and 34. His business is located to the south of the city, where he upholsters and paints household furniture. Wilfrido started this business in 1991 and has 20 years of work experience. He operates his small business in the front part of his home. In his business, Wilfrido provides a term of seven days in which he will work before anticipating payment. The competition is fierce, so he must maintain his quality and complete his work in a timely fashion. He purchases his materials with cash from several suppliers in the central part of town. Wilfredo does upholstery work on chairs, living room sets, dining room sets, and automobiles. His goal later on is to replace his upholstery equipment and to acquire his own home. The greatest challenge he faces is not having enough capital to rapidly achieve his growth targets. He also wants to make use of his living space so that he can develop his products and have some peace-of-mind.

In the meantime, Wilfredo works so that he can reach his goals. He manages a current ratio of 2.96 and a profitability rate from his sales of no less than 39.77%. These indicators predict his growth potential and a successful investment from his Kiva loan, which is his first form of financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Wilfredo will use the money to buy upholstery materials, rubber, nails, thread, fabrics, and lining.

loans.use: to buy upholstery materials, rubber, nails, thread, fabrics, and lining.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood for repairing her house.

loans.name: Zea

texts.en:
Due to thehigh cost of basic commodities, Zea is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase different kinds of vegetables and fruits to sell. Zea hopes to increase her profits so that she can sustain the financial needs of the family and save money for the future. She believes that through her patience in managing her business she will be able to improve the family's standard of living. 

Zea is 33 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. They live in Bantog, Angadanan, Isabela. Her husband is a driver and he also helps her with selling vegetables in the community. Zea uses her income to pay the tuition fees of their children and for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is 38 years old, married and had two children in school. Her family is less fortunate but she is a determined person who find ways to meet their needs, especially in providing a good education for her children. She operates a general store selling soap, sugar, vinegar, cooking oil, and bread. She would like to sell more items to increase her earnings. 

She is now asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy vinegar, bread, eggs, sugar, and canned goods to sell. This would help increase her sales. 

In the future, she would like to strengthen her business in order to acquire more profits and continuously provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy vinegar, bread, eggs, sugar, and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Maria Irene

texts.es:
María D. 44 años D. edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo D. agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito D. Guadalupe que pertenece al departamento D. La Libertad.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

María cuenta con su propia mototaxi, la cual lo alquila para que la trabajen mañana y tarD. movilizando personas que viven en Guadalupe, tiene su propia clientela y con los ingresos que obtenga pueD. cubrir sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1000 nuevos soles para brindarle mantenimiento y cambio D. algunos repuestos a su mototaxi, al encontrarse en buen estado podrá cubrir su crédito otorgado y tener mejoras económicas.  María es una persona amable y conocida porque siempre se preocupa por el bienestar D. los suyos, con el fin D. que en un futuro pueda brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
María, age 44, lives with her husband and son in her own house.  The house only has water and electrical service.  It is located in the Guadalupe district in the La Libertad department.  These areas are devoted to farming and livestock.

María has her own “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle), which she rents out so that it is used to work in the mornings and afternoons transporting the people who live in Guadalupe.  She has her own customers, and she is able to cover the family expenses with the income that she gets.

She has requested a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to proviD. maintenance and to change some replacement parts on her mototaxi.  When it is in good condition she will be able to cover her loan and to have better finances.

María is a very kind person, and she is known for always worrying about the well-being of her loved ones.  In the future she wants to be able to give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to provide maintenance and to change some replacement parts on her mototaxi.

loans.name: Alexander Francisco

texts.es:
Alexander cada dia, trabaja en su taxi, recoriendo la capital, su esposa esta haciendo repochetas y tajadas por la noche en ventas en su casa, y asi poder solventar gastos en su hogar.
Alexander  logro dar un buen mantenimiento a su vehiculo con el credito anterior, lo que trabajo en mejores condiciones de trabajo, luego tuvo dificultad, al tener un pequeño choque, dejando la parte delantera del carro un poco mal, que aun no ha reparado. Y que con este nuevo financiamiento podra enderechar y pintar el carro.
No paso a mayores dificultades, ha trabajado, solo que es su medio de trabajo y tiene que darle siempre mantenimiento. Cuidando su vida y la de los pasajeros. Lo que espera en este nuevo año es que baje el combustible, y asi tener mejor ganancia.
texts.en:
Alexander works in his taxi every day driving through the city. His wife sells Nicaraguan quesadillas and fried plantains at night from their home. Through their work, they can cover the house expenses. Alexander has used his previous credit well in the general maintenance of his car. Unfortunately, he ran into some problems by having a small car accident. The front part of his taxi was damaged, which hasn't been repaired yet. With this new loan, he will carry out some body work and paint his taxi.

He has not had more problems and has managed to keep working with his taxi. Since this is his way of life, he has to provide good maintenance to his taxi. Taking care of his life and the passengers as well. Alexander hopes that the gasoline prices will fall this year to improve his earnings.

loans.use: to paint and do body work for his taxi and continue to provide taxi services to his clients.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is a 31-year-old man who raises and sells flowers as well as runs his own food market. He has 5 years of experience in flowers breeding. 

Elchin`s wife helps him to raise flowers, because Elchin spends most of the time in the shop selling items. Elchin`s profit is 230 AZN and he would like to increase it. For this purpose he applied for a 1000 AZN loan. He will use the loan to purchase more items for his shop, seeds, fertilizers and flowerpots.

loans.use: to purchase more items.

loans.name: Noe Efrain

texts.es:
El señor Noe Efrain  es  casado, tiene 49 años de edad, no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 1 hijo el cual no esta estudiando, se dedica a la elaboración de muebles, de diferente clases: sillas mesas, roperos y entre otros, inicio este trabajo hace 13 años y tiene buena experiencia.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de madera de pino blanco y pino colorado, e incrementar su producción, espera en el futuro ver una mueblería grande.
texts.en:
Mr. Noe Efrain is married, 49, and did not have the opportunity to study. He has one child who is not in school. Noe Efrain makes various kinds of furniture: tables, chairs, wardrobes, and other items. He started this work 13 years ago and is now well-experienced.
He is requesting a loan which he will use to buy white and coloured pine wood, to increase production. He hopes to be a major furniture maker in the future.

loans.use: to buy wood for making furniture.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen, está casada y vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito va comprar una maquina de costura que le hace falta para su taller de costura, y también comprara materiales como telas, hilos, encajes y otros productos más para la elaboración de manualidades. Ella actualmente cuenta con el local de costura y quiere comprar esta máquina para elaborar más trabajo para ella y así aumentara su clientela dándole a su trabaja más respaldo y calidad de acabado. Ella tiene como meta aumentar sus ganancias y darle a su esposo una ayuda extra para las responsabilidades del hogar y así también mejorar o contribuir con la estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
María del Carmen is married and lives with her 3 children and her husband, who are her top priority.

She will use her loan to buy a sewing machine that is needed for her sewing shop, as well as to buy materials such as fabrics, threads, lace and other products for the production of handicrafts. She currently has a location for her shop and wants to buy this sewing machine to produce more and so increase her clientele by giving her work more support and a quality finish. 

Her goal is to increase her profits and give her husband extra help with household responsibilities and thus enhance and contribute to their economic stability. It is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She hasn't had other loans in state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has given her the loan with improved ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of machines and craft materials.

loans.name: Margarida

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, viuva e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais apenas 1 frequenta a Escola. Nunca teve oportunidade de frequentar a Escola por falta de condições financeiras pela parte de seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.

É negociante ha mais de 10 nos dedica-se a venda de roupa usaada, e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Já teve emprestimos noutros bancos e conseguiu pagar sem diculdades. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a sua casa (cimento, pedra, chapas, barrotes, ferro, e outros). O primeiro emprestimo foi de 8.000.00mt, para o comercio.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da sua casa, para tal tensiona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is a widow and has four children, only one of which still attends school. She never had the opportunity to go to school because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has been a businesswoman for over 10 years. She sells used clothing and earns an income of about 3.000mt. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has had loans in other banks and has managed to repay without difficulties. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies for her house (cement, stone, metal sheets, rafters, iron, etc.). The first loan was for 8.000mt, for the retail business.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she plans to finish building her house and for that reason she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for her house (cement, stone, metal sheets, rafters, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Ablaye

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme mariée, père de deux filles. Il est employée comme conducteur de motocyclette de transport urbain depuis près de deux ans. Il arrive difficilement à "joindre les deux bouts" avec son salaire. Pour obtenir assez de revenus et bien entretenir sa famille, il a veut acheter sa propre moto et sollicite ainsi un pret de 400000f auprès de l'UIMCEC.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married man, father to two girls. He has been employed as a motorcycle driver for urban transport for almost two years.

He has difficulty making ends meet with his salary. To obtain enough income and support his family well, he wants to buy his own motorcycle and thus is requesting a loan of 400,000f from the UIMCEC.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a resident of Murang'a in Central Kenya and is aged 60 and married with 3 adult children. He has been in farming for 20 years and currently produces coffee and bananas for the local market. He works as a blacksmith besides farming.

David has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says this will provide him with milk for daily family need and income to meet other supplementary family needs. He adds the venture into dairy farming will provide him with ready cash to carry out expansion of his farming business regularly and make his blacksmith business better. 

David says the costs of feeds has been the greatest challenge to farmers.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is single and has four children. She has received no formal education. Sarah sells doughnuts and operates a provisions store in Krofoforao, near Abura, which she has done for the past twelve years. She uses her income to pay for school fees and other expenses. Sarah will use the loan to purchase items for her provisions store. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sarah plans to care for her children and save up for their education.

loans.use: purchase items for her provisions store

loans.name: Hilda Margarita

texts.en:
My name is Hilda Margarite H., I have had my pulperia(restaurant/market)for four years, it is well loacted and I need to supply my business with a variety of fresh products in order to offer good products and service to my clients. This is a family business and my children help me in the store in their spare time.

Loan Use:Purchase milk, sodas, bread, dairy products, margarine, and other items.

Mi nombre es Hilda Margarita H., tengo una pulperia desde hace cuatro años, esta bien ubicada y necesito surtir mi negocio con producto fresco y variado para brindar buenos productos y servicio a mis clientes. Este es un negocio familiar y mis hijos me ayudan a vender en sus momentos libres.

loans.use: Compra de leche, refrescos, pan, lacteos, margarina y otros

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Naomi would like to buy 5 steers

loans.name: Gogosina

texts.en: All farmers would agree that is hard to keep a plantation going when you lack tools and the right supplies.  Gogosina is experiencing this problem.  She is dedicated to developing her small plot of land into a vegetable farm but she is suffering from a lack of tools.  She is seeking loan funds to buy some fertilizer and a basic toolset to help her plant and harvest.  Her husband has steady work as a security guard at the local school, but his small wages are not enough to cover the family expenses.  Gogosina believes that financial well-being will come from the vegetable crop. She is dedicated to cultivating her land into a dependable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gardening tools

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.en: Rahmatullo Y., 46 years old, has a secondary education and works as a butcher. He is married with 3 children. He rents a sell-point for meat selling.  From his early youth, Rahmatullo helped his father in his butcher shop. Therefore he has long experience in this business. Rahmatullo buys cattle in a market, fattens them, and sells the meat. He is going to buy 4 cows using this loan of $1200, to increase his livestock numbers then sell the meat for a cheaper price to the population.

loans.use: To buy cattle and sell meat.

loans.name: Rovshen

texts.en: Rovshen G. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwest Azerbaijan. He is married and has four children who are in school. He owns a small booth in Beylagan's city bazaar. He sells a variety of clothes with his wife. They established their business thirteen years ago. He needs $1100 to purchase more goods to expand his business.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Djeneba

texts.en: Denedja S. sells fresh, exotic juices and water in the Abobo market, a populated suburb in the north of Abidjan. Djeneba has been in this business for many years to take care of her family and her children. She started her business on a very small scale. She then acquired, last year, a second-hand refrigerator with a loan from AE&I. She has since then improved her productivity and revenue. Djeneba lives with her cohabitant and their children in Abobo. She has been in the AE&I microcredit program since November 2004 and has received several loans that she has reimbursed in a very good manner.

loans.use: Denedja Soro will use the loan to purchase ingredients and sachets for exotic juice

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is small entrepreneur who sells charcoal. She is married to Bryson Kamde, who works with the Tanzania Civil Aviation Authority, and has two children ages 2 and 3. Sophia is a very hard worker and now she wants to open another business to deal with tailoring. She really loves to be an entrepreneur. This is the fourth loan request she has made to SELFINA. She is asking for a loan of USD 875 to buy a scale and sewing machines for the new business. She is proposing to repay in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To buy scale and sewing machines for new shop

loans.name: Myrian

texts.es:
Mrs. Myrian P. is married to Santiago Valentín Gonzalez. They have three school-age children. He distributes books for the Santillanas Publishing House, while she has made blouses, boots, and student uniforms for the last five years.

Myrian has received numerous uniform orders for 2008, and she’d like to begin working on them. That’s why she needs this loan, which she will use to buy different types of fabric for her sewing.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Myrian P. está casada con Santiago Valentín Gonzalez. Ellos tienen 3 hijos en edad escolar. El distribuye libros de la Editorial Santillanas, mientras ella desde hace 5 años confecciona camisas, camperas y uniformes para estudiantes.

Myrian ha recibido un pedido numeroso ya de uniformes para el año 2008, por lo que desea empezar a trabajar en ello, para esto necesita de un crédito con los que comprara diferentes tipos de telas para su confección.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, threads, lace, and other sewing goods.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Miss Chantha D., 29, and her sister, 26, are single. They live with their parents in Koh Dach Iceland by the Mekong River. They and their mother sell groceries in the village to the nearby people. She and her sister cannot finish primary school because the family is not able to support them. Chantha is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the fifth time, this time in the amount of $1,000. She will use this loan to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her stock

loans.name: Hazema

texts.en: Hazema is a 38-year-old woman from Jaruške, near the town Banovići. She is married and her husband works as a miner. He earns about 700KM monthly. They are receiving monthly foreign nursing in the amount of 298KM. Foreign nursing is financial aid that Hazema receives from a social fund for her handicapped child. Hazema is taking this loan to buy a calf and she intends to fatten it with the other stock. She wants to increase her cattle resources in order to increase her family income.

loans.use: Buying a calf.

loans.name: César Orozco

texts.es:
Cesar is 36 years old and lives in the Sandino Memorial section of the city. He is married and has two children (both attending elementary school). Since is very concerned about his children's future and the future opportunities made available to them, he has worked hard to grow and strengthen this business which he started 9 years ago. He has his own furniture shop and before starting this business, worked in other furniture shops for 25 years. He is now asking for this loan in order to buy more wood so that he can comply with the orders presented to him. His 11 year old son works with him daily (after school) and is learning the business too.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Cesar tiene 36 años de edad y habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casado y su esposa para apoyarlo trabaja como afanadora, tiene dos hijos de edad escolar primaria, preocupado por mejorar las oportunidades a sus hijos que una buena educación puede darles, se ha esforzado en ampliar y fortalecer su negocio en el cual lleva 9 años, tiene un taller propio de elaboración de madera, antes de montar su taller trabajó 25 años para otros talleres. Pide su crédito para comprar madera y cumplir con varios encargos de muebles, su hijo de 11 años de edad ya trabaja después de su colegio con él y está aprendiendo el negocio.

loans.use: To purchase wood in order to make furniture.  (Comprar madera para elbaoración de muebles)

loans.name: Jamileth

texts.es:
This client is asking for her third AFODENIC refinancing, in order to invest in improving her homes which 8 years ago she secured with an inheritance from her father: with this loan she is thinking of adding ceramics to her house in zone 5 of New Guinea. She has worked for the last 11 years, as the secretary of the National Union of Farmers, with great responsibility and enthusiasm. She is currently studying at University and is in the second year of a bachelor’s degree in Business Administration. She relies on the support of her husband who is a teacher at the URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea University. They have two children, the elder is 11 years old and in sixth grade and their daughter is 7 years old and studying second grade in primary school.

It is important to explain that this woman is wage earner with scarce economic resources who has struggled to improve her home since she bought it, in order to have a dignified home for her family. Her dream is that her sons will continue studying to become something in life: every day Jamileth gets up at 4.30am to leave breakfast prepared for her family and in the afternoons Jamileth returns home to finish the household tasks. Jamileth feels very grateful towards AFODENIC and has already managed to improve her home with previous credits.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Esta clienta esta solicitando su tercer refinanciamiento con AFODENIC, para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda que hace 8 años obtuvo de una herencia de su papá, con este préstamo piensa echarle la cerámica a su casa ubicada en la zona # 5 de Nueva Guinea, esta se desempeña desde hace 11 años como secretaria en la Unión Nacional de Agricultores y Ganaderos con gran responsabilidad y entusiasmo, actualmente esta estudiando en la Universidad segundo año de Lic. En Administración de Empresas, cuenta con la ayuda de su marido quien es docente de la Universidad URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea, tienen dos hijos, el mayor de 11 años esta cursando su sexto grado y la niña de 7 años estudia 2 do grado de educación primaria.

Es importante explicar que esta señora es una mujer asalariada y de escasos recursos económicos que ha luchado por ir mejorando su vivienda desde que la obtuvieron para tener un hogar digno para su familia, su sueño es que sus hijos estudien para ser alguien en la vida, todos los días Jamileth se levanta a la cuatro y treinta de la mañana para dejar el desayuno hecho a su familia y, por las tardes doña Jamileth llega a su casa a terminar de hacer los quehaceres del hogar. Jamileth se siente agradecida con AFODENIC ya que con los créditos anteriores ha mejorado su vivienda.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Shafqat's Group

texts.en:
Shafqat Rafique A., wife of R. A., is a mother of four children. Her husband is a milkman while she makes decorative embroidered clothes. She needs a loan to buy a garment shop. She plans to expand her garment business if she earns profit from this loan.

Her loan group members include: Naseem B., who wants to expand her grocery shop and Fatima B. who wants to invest her her embroidery business. This loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To invest in a garment business

loans.name: Chantha Seang Group

texts.en:
This group consists of four members in Kol Kup Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Chantha S., the group leader, is a 32-year-old widow with two children. One of the children is enrolled in school, while the younger one is too young to work or attend school.

Mrs. Chantha S. is currently employed in a garment factory and can generate only a small salary. With this small salary, she cannot support her family. In order to improve her family’s standard of living, she wants to start a business buying rice to keep in stock and sell for a better price later in the year. In order to do this, Mrs. Chantha S. decided to ask for a loan.

loans.use: To start a business stocking rice to sell later in the year for a better price

loans.name: Margarita Gaudiosa

texts.es:
Margarita, 65, is divorced. She studied obstetrics but didn't complete her studies because she married and had 4 children who now work in Salaverry. She started her business with the small savings she had, selling fried chicken at her house in Salaverry, in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She wanted to expand her business and when a friend encouraged her to consider Manuela Ramos, she joined the "Las Emprendedoras" ("Enterprising Women") community bank.

With a first loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles), she bought potatoes and cooking oil; that's how she was able to sell other dishes. With a S/.1500 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy cooking oil, pasta, potatoes, chicken and meat because she now makes a wiD. variety of dishes.

Despite her age, Margarita works with great enthusiasm and dreams of traveling and seeing different parts of Peru.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Margarita Gaudiosa tiene 65 años, es divorciada, estudió la carrera D. Obstetricia, pero no culminó sus estudios porque se casó, tiene 04 hijos, los cuales trabajan en Salaverry. La empresaria inició su negocio con un pequeño ahorro que tenía, empezó vendiendo pollo frito en su casa en el Distrito D. Salaverry en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La libertad, pero la socia quería ampliar su negocio, hasta que un día una amiga la animó a participar en Manuela Ramos y ahora pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS”.

Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00, que recibió compró papa, aceite, y pudo así vender otros platos. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00 que cancelará en un plazo D. 06 meses, comprará aceite, fideos, papa, pollo y carne ya que actualmente prepara mucha variedad D. platos.

La señora Margarita pese a su edad trabaja con mucho entusiasmo y sueña con viajar y conocer diversos lugares del Perú.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Ayde Aracely

texts.es:
Ayde Aracely G. B. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

"My name is Ayde Aracely G. B.. I am single. My parents live with me and I work in the administrative department of a transportation company. I intend to change the front door of my house since I feel that it is very unsafe and it leaves me worrying for my parents when I have to leave ,due to the fact that several robberies have occurred in our neighborhood."

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

“Mi nombre es AYDE ARACELY G. B. soy soltera, mis papas vivien conmigo y trabajo en el departamento administrativo de una compañía de transportes, tengo la intención de cambiar la puerta principal de mi casa ya que la siento muy insegura y me quedo preocupada por mis papas cuando tengo que salir debido a que han sucedido varios robos en nuestra colonia”

loans.use: Install a front door on her home.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida D. was born in 1967. She is married and has one child. Zahida lives in Gračanica together with her husband who is retired. Zahida works every day in the marketplace. She sells clothes and she does that together with her mother-in-law.

Zahida and her mother-in-law have been doing this job for a long time and it goes pretty well. She has already been a client of WWI for a while; this is her third loan through WWI, this time in the amount of 1000 KM. She will use this loan to buy new clothes for re-sale. Her wish is to stay in this business and maybe one one day have her own real shop.

loans.use: To buy clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem S., 33, is married and has a little child. She earns income running her own grocery sales business at her home. Mrs. Sem offers a variety of grocery products and makes an average of US$4 per day. 
To make her business more profitable, Sem S. has applied for a loan to purchase more products for sale and thus be able to satisfy the growing demand.

loans.use: Purchase of additional grocery products for sale

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 22 años, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Luz es una joven muy alegre y trabajadora que con su picardía siempre saca una sonrisa a los turistas que visitan su isla, a ella desde niña le ha gustado trabajar es por eso que ahora con sus 22 años, tiene su propio stand donde ofrece sus artesanías. Luz siempre obtiene buenas ventas, ya que es muy sociable y carismática es por eso que quiere expandir su negocio para poder brindarles a sus visitantes mejores y más variadas artesanías. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita comprara algunas artesanías en barro de la ciudad de Pucara y así poder mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz is 22 years old, single, and lives in her parent’s home. Luz is a happy, hardworking young woman who always has a smile for the tourists that visit her island. Ever since she was a little girl she has like to work and that’s why now, at age 22, she has her own stand where she offers her artisan pieces. Luz always has good sales, as she is very social and charismatic and therefore she wants to grow her business to be able to provide her customers better and more varied products. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she will buy some ceramic artisan pieces in Pucara city and in this way be able to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ceramic artisan pieces to sell

loans.name: Dayanet

texts.en: Dayanet A. is 26 years old and lives in Imishli in southern Azerbaijan. He lives with his parents and is not married yet. He is a small business owner who sells different kinds of foodstuff and detergents in his store which is very famous in his community, thus allowing him to have a good clientele. This store generates the only financial income for his family and Dayanet tries very hard to run his business successfully. He is also very focused on being polite with his customers. Today Dayanet is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur. Dayanet's main goal is to get married in near future and provide welfare to his current and future family. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Purchase more food inventories

loans.name: Batbileg

texts.en:
Batbileg Z. is 20 years old. He lives with his mother and his younger sister. Three years ago, his father died. He inherited a small amount of money from his father and started to run a cafe with it. 

But their living situation became untenable, and the family decided to change the business from a café to a foodstuffs store and live in the storage room (a common side benefit to owning a store rather than a cafe in Mongolia). 

Batbileg has taken out student loans before from XacBank, Kiva’s microfinance partner in Mongolia. 

Batbileg has been a diligent saver, using profits from the business to pay for his and his sister's tuition fees and to buy a Mongolian Ger –- the traditional Mongolian nomadic home -- for his family, so they could move out of the store. But now, because of those expenditures, he needs a loan to restock his store.

loans.use: To buy goods for his grocery store

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad D. is a mother of three who is helping her husband-farmer in earning a living through her rice vending business which serves as their alternative source of income. She is also able to help her husband's farming needs through this other source of income.

She is currently requesting a loan of Php 4,000 to be used as additional capital in her rice vending business. She also stressed that she must work hard in order to have unique business strategies to grow her business and ultimately have a higher income for her family. She also hopes to give her children the best education so that they can get decent jobs someday.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Carmen Ernestina,

texts.es:
Carmen se dedica desD. hace tres años aproximadamente a la venta D. piñatas, cotillón y todo lo necesario para decorar una fiesta infantil. Anteriormente, por el tiempo  D. dos años, vendía desayuno en un puesto ambulante en la puerta D. un colegio cercano a su casa.  
La idea D. empezar el negocio D. piñatas nació a raíz D. que su hijo le comentara que el negocio era rentable. Fue así como, entre los dos, alquilaron un puesto en un mercado; sin embargo, después D. un tiempo, el hijo D. Carmen tuvo que dejar D. apoyarla y como el pago del alquiler del local ya no le salía a cuenta ella mudo el negocio a su casa. Hoy solo venD. bajo pedidos a clientes que ya la conocen.
Por otro lado, desD. hace un año recibe diferentes talleres D. bisutería y bordados, estos productos también los venD. para obtener un ingreso adicional en su casa. Junto con su esposo, quien ya esta jubilado, mantiene los gastos del hogar. Solo tienen un hijo a quien mantener.
texts.en:
Carmen has been selling piñatas, party favors, and all kinds of children’s party supplies for approximately three years. Two years prior to that, she used to sell breakfast as a street vendor at the entrance to a school near her house.

She got the idea to start her business after her son told her how profitable it would be. Thus, she and her son rented a stand in the market. However, after some time, her son had to stop giving her support and she was unable to pay the rent for the office space, so she moved the business to her house. She now only handles orders from customers who already know her.

Additionally, she has been selling costume jewelry and embroidered products from home for a year in order to earn extra income. She and her husband, who is now retired, help with the household expenses. They have only one son that they must support financially.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costume jewelry materials

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 37-year-old widow who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with her six children. Hanan has been working as a seamstress since 1990. She requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase thread for her work. This is the first time that Hanan has requested a loan.

Hanan is special in her work because of her good work and quality of work. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She decided on doing her business because she had to improve her family’s financial situation especially since her husband’s death.

loans.use: to purchase thread for her work

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is residing in the peaceful yet rocky village of San Lorenzo, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 46 years old and married to Orlando, a farmer. The couple is blessed with three children: Danny Boy, the eldest is 24 years old and a graduating college student with a course in Agriculture; Rommel, 21 years old, a college undergraduate, and Lailanie, 18 years old, a graduating high school student. Rosalinda shares that her family perseveres together to have a progressive life.

Rosalinda has been managing a piggery business for seven years already. The business is quite good and really of great help to her family. Thus, to further improve her business, Rosalinda is hoping to access a loan amounting to PHP 6,000 that will serve as additional business capital. She plans to use her loan to buy additional piglets. She also aims to have an increase in income so she can help her husband in providing the daily needs of her family and pay for the education of their youngest child. She hopes that the lenders will assist them in the business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Laufofoga

texts.en: Laufofoga P., 35, is married with four children. She has many years of experience in the iced cake business, and sells to her fellow villagers seven days per week. She has no previous loans with Kiva partner, SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 WST. SPBD loans are Laufofoga’s only access to capital because she has never qualified for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer, cordial, sugar and foam cups

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 42-year-old married woman with four children living in Aley, Mount Lebanon, where she has been a home-based hairdresser for 20 years. Today, Amal is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase newer equipment to attract a larger number of clients.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment for her business.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa Y., who is widely known as ‘mother,' is 30 years old and married to Mr. Y., who is a farmer. She is expecting her first child soon. She makes a living selling cereals and grain such as maize in the local market in Dorma, a town in Ghana's Brong Ahafo region. She is applying for this loan to buy additional stocks of maize so that she can expand her business and increase sales. She says her biggest challenge is frequent increases in the price of maize, which force her to work hard to buy just a few bags. She gets her stock in villages that surround Dorma and retails them to her customers.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies of maize

loans.name: Ekaete

texts.en: Ekaete L. sells provisions like milk, sugar, noodles, etc. She is married with three children and she is 36 years old. She hopes for a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Placida Erudita

texts.es:
La señora Placida, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Poderosas D. Santa Rosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Azangaro, Provincia D. Azangaro, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 48 años D. edad, estado civil casada, es madre D. 04 hijos y no tiene estudios,  vive en el Barrio Vilcapaza.
Inicia su trabajo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el cual compró ropa. 

Su deseo es ampliar su negocio y poder generar más ganancias. A ella le gustan los ahorros, y las facilidades D. pago.
texts.en:
Placida is a member of the Community Bank "Las Poderosas D. Santa Rosa", located in the district and province of Azangaro in Puno. She is 48 years old, she is married, and is mother to 4 children. She never went to school. She lives in the region of Vilcapaza.

She started out her business with the help of Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner). Her first loan of S/.500 she purchase clothing.

Her wish is to expand her business and to generate a greater income. She loves to be able to save money, and can easily make her payments.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Bony

texts.es:
Bonny es socia del Bancomunal Melcochita.
Bonny es conviviente tiene 39 años, tiene  un hijo de 19 años que esta estudiando educación superior.
Bonny trabajaba en un mercado vendiendo en un puesto hasta que salio embarazada y decidió dedicarse a las ventas de  de golosinas  en un modulo que la municipalidad le ha dado, ella tiene quince años  vendiendo golosinas 
Desde que Bonny  esta en Finca  aprendió a manejar su dinero y a ser responsable con los pagos.
Bonny necesita un préstamo de 2200 soles, para la compra de golosinas, va comprar una  vitrina, exhibidores para gaseosas.  
El sueño de Bonny es tener una tienda de bazar o una  panadería  en su casa.
texts.en:
Bonny is a member of the Melcochita Community Bank. Bonny is 39 and in a common law marriage. She has a 19 year old son who attends the university. Until she became pregnant, Bonny used to work selling at a stand in the market. She decided to sell sweets from a stand that the municipality gave her. She has been selling sweets for 15 years. Since Bonny has been with Finca, she has learned to manage her money and to be responsible with her payments. Bonny needs a loan for 2,200 PEN to buy sweets, a display case, and refrigerated display cases for soft drinks. Bonny’s dream is to have a store or bakery in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets, a display case, and refrigerated display cases for soft drinks

loans.name: Ronilda

texts.es:
