Ronilda vive en la c/Caupolican la zona Tembladerani en la ciudad D. La Paz
 
Ella, vive en alquiler junto a sus hijos, trabaja como empleada y se dedica a la venta D. productos D. la canasta familiar (arroz, fideos, edredones, aceite) los cuales los venD. en la misma empresa donD. trabaja.

Gracias a los préstamos otorgados anteriormente, cuenta con un pequeño capital D. trabajo con el cual tiene  mejores condiciones D. vida
texts.en:
Ronilda lives on Caupolican Street in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz.

She lives in a rented home with her husband and children. She works as a housekeeper and sells household items (rice, noodles, cooking oil, and comforters) at the same company in which she works.

Thanks to her previous loans, she has some working capital with which she has obtained better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna has been a resident of Barangay General Balao in Solana, Cagayan since she was born. She is now 46 years old and engaged in the business of selling fish in the market.

Aside from vending, Lorna is also a hog-raiser. She wants her business to grow for the future of her children and that is why she asking for a loan from Kiva of PHP 9,000 as additional capital. Her income from vending is wisely divided to purchase feed for her hogs and for the school allowance of her children and for their daily needs.

Lorna is married to Agapito, 47 years old, who is a farmer. They are blessed with six children. Through farming, her husband helps her in providing their needs and also in sending their children to school.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Ogechi

texts.en: Ogechi, 27 years old and married with one child, sells electronics in retail, her main source of income.  Requesting a loan to purchase additional electronics to sell, she hopes to make more profits from her business. Ogechi says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase electronics to sell

loans.name: Ericka Vanesa

texts.es: La joven Erika V. C., tiene la edad de 29 años, habita en el barrio El Edén, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como transportista ellos tienen dos hijos de doce años y ocho, actualmente estudiante , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Erika desde hace 17 años se dedica a la agricultura , ya que su esposo le apoyo para que cultivara las tierras que le heredo sus padres y así poder trabajar y obtener un mejor ingreso , ella esta contenta a pesar de las dificultades que paso , por que cuando inicio paso por muchas dificultades , pero gracias al financiamiento que obtuvo en Afodenic ha mejorado sus cultivo y se siente muy agradecida por la confianza que le hemos brindado durante seis ciclo el cual comprara fertilizantes y poder aplicar al cultivo , con esto espera tener buenos frutos y poder vender a buen precio en el mercado.

loans.use: Comprar fertilizantes y mejorar el cultivo

loans.name: Betriz Irene

texts.es: Beatriz Irene R. M. is married, her husband is a steelworker. They have a four year old son who isn’t in school yet. Beatriz started her business with the sale of cooked beans, since, she has expanded to offer cheese, soft drinks, milk and cream and fire wood for other people’s stoves. She plans to use this loan to buy a high quality stove with an oven. With the continued success of her business, Beatriz dreams of increasing the amount of products she has to offer. Beatriz took a course in small restaurant management and hopes to open her own shop where she will offer products of the highest quality.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Guillermo Noel

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo C. es muy esforzado porque se dedica a su negocio de venta de celulares y de repuestos de celulares teniendo su propio negocio en el departamento de Chinandega en el mercado el bisne.

Inició su negocio con pocos productos pero a medida que ha venido transcurriendo el tiempo, ha mejorado las condiciones del negocio. Ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito para la compra de los repuestos de celulares y así continuar en su actividad.
texts.en:
Guillermo C. is very hardworking and dedicated to his business selling cellular phones and phone parts. He owns this business, located in a street market in the department of Chinandega. He started his business with only a few products, but with time he has made many improvements. Guillermo has approached Ceprodel to request a loan to buy cellular parts and thus continue his work.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cellular phone parts.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es:
La señora Pelagia es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el del distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 4 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Capana, estudió educación primaria incompleta.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de pescado.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles,  el mismo que será invertido en la compra de redes, ella manifiesta que las mallas son lo primero que se malogra es por eso que requieren cambiarlas.

Su mayor deseo es poder comprarse un carro y así facilitar su trabajo.

A ella le  gustan las oportunidades que les da Manuela Ramos para que las mujeres realicen sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Sra. Pelagia is a member of the Communal Bank “Juchuy Niño” located in the District of Capachica, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 37 years old, married, has 4 children, and lives in the community of Capana. Pelagia did not finish elementary school.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 6 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to increase her business capital for selling fish.

Pelagia is now requesting a new loan of 1000 soles to buy fishing nets. This piece of equipment is the first thing that tends to deteriorate, so it needs to be replaced regularly. She someday hopes to buy a cart in order to make her work easier.

Pelagia enjoys the opportunities Manuela Ramos provides women to develop in their work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Hydie

texts.en: Hydie, age 27, manages a rice farming business in Surallah, South Cotabato.  She is the mother of two children, the eldest is 8 years old.  With rice farming, she and her husband Bryant are able to support their family.  Hydie is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to help support the needs of her farm. She will use it to buy farm inputs.  She is grateful to CEVI for the opportunity to receivel a loan with a low interest.

loans.use: To help support the needs of her farm.

loans.name: Susan

texts.es:
Nuestra socia SUSAN tiene 31 años, es soltera, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL” de la Asociación Arariwa.     
 
La socia y su novio tienen un pequeño negocio de venta de accesorios de computadoras en su domicilio. Ella cuenta que al principio vendió una computadora y ahora vende computadoras portátiles. Ya son varios años con el negocio y les ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que ponen en su trabajo. Nuestra socia y su novio son unos jóvenes, trabajadores y emprendedores que salen adelante a pesar de las adversidades. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más accesorios de computadoras pues en esta época del año es cuando más se vende.
      
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Susan is 31 years old, single, and a native of Cusco. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Emprendedores de San Cristobal”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa.

Susan and her boyfriend have a small business selling computer accessories out of her home. She says this business started when she sold a computer, and now she sells laptops. Susan has been in business for a few years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. She and her boyfriend are young hardworking entrepreneurs who have managed to get ahead despite facing adversity. Susan is requesting a loan to buy more computer accessories since her sales increase during this time of the year.

She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computer accessories

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Maria tiene 56 años de edad, mujer trabajadora y esforzada en todos estos largos años ha logrado poder hacer su casa de concreto, trabaja como cocinera en un colegio privado y comercializa ropa en tiempos libres, durante veintiún año a laborado para el colegio, en la venta de ropa hace tres año lo hizo con el propósito de obtener  otros ingresos, ya que su mama se enfermo y tenia que comprarle el medicamento, pues para ella ha sido difícil salir adelante con sus dos hijos ya ahora mayor por ser madre soltera, y ahora que mi madre falleció ha sido muy triste. Con el crédito anterior logro hacer un muro para mejor seguridad, y con este préstamo comprara material de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc para comenzar la obra, para terminar de construir un cuarto, falta parte del techo y las divisiones. Para su negocio es aumentar el inventario de su venta para poder sacar para su cuota, y sus necesidades diarias. Muy contenta ya que a través del financiamiento ha logrado poder hacer las mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria, 56, is a hard-working woman who, after many long years of effort, has managed to build her concrete house. She works as a cook in a private school and in her spare time sells clothing. She has worked for the school for 21 years and in clothing sales for 3 years. She began the latter in order to earn extra income because her mother fell ill and she needed to buy medicines. It has been a difficult struggle for her. She was a single mother to her two children, now adults. Now that her mother has passed away, it is very sad for her. With her previous loan she built a wall for better security. She will use this one to buy building materials like: stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc metal sheeting, to start a project: she wants to finish building a bedroom, complete the roof, which is missing a section, and put up the interior dividing walls. For her business, she wants to increase stock so that her earnings will also increase thereby meeting her required sales quota to meet daily expenses. She is very happy that the financing has allowed her to make improvements on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, sand, cement, iron, and zinc metal sheeting to finish enclosing her house.

loans.name: Ladie Claire

texts.en:
Ladie Claire S. is from the village of Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 24 years old. Ladie Claire is a widow and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ladie Claire owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for her trade comes from a la cart business. She grills chicken parts like chicken feet, hot dogs and intestines, to sell in the local community. Ladie Claire is just starting this business.

In 2009, Ladie Claire joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ladie Claire is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further develop her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products

loans.name: G.s. Mujeres Responsable Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Mujeres Responsable. Tiene 2 integrantes por lo que cada una de ellas realiza diferentes actividades económicas. En el caso de Justina es madre soltera y tiene 47 años con 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de golosinas y refrescos. A pesar de lo difícil que es mantener el negocio es una de las mujeres más emprendedoras y dinámicas del grupo.  Su otra socia Modesta tiene 44 años. Su actividad económica es venta de ropa. Ella dio inicio a su negocio con mucho sacrificio y debido a su muy buena administración ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio pues es una mujer muy responsable. Ellas se han unido con el fin de salir adelante, a pesar de que han tenidos muchos desafíos son muy luchadoras y trabajadoras. Por lo que el motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. El sueño de las 2 socias es ayudar a sus familias y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The supportive group known as Responsible Women consists of 2 members who each carry out different economic activities. In the case of Justina, she is a single mother, 47 years old, with 2 under-age children in her care. Her economic activity is the sale of snacks and refreshments. In spite of the difficulty that she has to maintain the business, she is one of the most enterprising and dynamic women of the group. The other associate, Modesta, is 44 years old. Her economic activity is clothing sales. She began her business with a lot of sacrifice and due to her very good administration she has managed to do well with her business. She is a very responsible woman. They have united in order to do well. In spite of the fact that they have had many challenges, they are very persevering and hard-working. The reason for the loan is for working capital for the purchase of merchandise for their businesses. The dream of the 2 associates is to help their families and to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 31-year-old married mother of two children who attend school.  She has been in the grocery business selling tomatoes, potatoes and onions among other groceries for three years.  She previously owned a retail shop.  She has previously taken out three loans from Faulu Kenya and she plans to take another loan of Kes. 20,000 to add stocks of tomatoes, potatoes and onions to her business.  She dreams of owning a plot of land and building her own house in future.  She describes herself as hard-working.

loans.use: Add to her inventory

loans.name: Viviano

texts.es:
El señor Viviano, tiene 46 años de edad, está casado hace 27 años con la señora Sixta , tienen 4 hijos, 1 varón llamado Aldo el cual tiene 26 años edad, y tres hijas, Blasida de 25, Vivian de 24 y Luana de 9 años de edad, todos ellos aun viven en casa de sus padres. 
El señor Viviano es carpintero, posee una carpintería en su domicilio hace mas de 18 años, fabrica todo tipo de muebles como roperos, mesas, sillas, placares, cómodas, muebles para cocina, muebles para equipo de sonidos, camas de diversas formas y tamaños.  
Sus mercaderías las vende en el Chaco donde tiene su mayor venta, ya que también fabrica muebles sobre pedido a particulares de la ciudad de Itá, Yaguarón y alrededores, también realiza la compra-venta de colchones y almohadas el cual consigue de una empresa renombrada del país. 
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de madera, ya que tiene buena cantidad de pedidos y no quiere a fallar con sus clientes.
texts.en:
46-year old Señor Viviano has been married for 27 years to his wife Sixta. They live together with their four children, a son Aldo who is 26, and three daughters Blasida (25), Vivian (24), and Luana (9). Señor Viviano is a carpenter and has had a workshop in his home for more than 18 years. He makes all kinds of furniture like closets, tables, chairs, built-in furniture, chests, kitchen furniture, entertainment centres, and various types and sizes of beds. Most of his sales are in El Chaco. Viviano also takes individual orders from customers from the towns of Itá, Yaguarón, and the areas around them. As well he buys and sells mattresses and pillows obtained from a business that is well-known in the country. With the loan he wishes to buy wood as he has many orders and does not want to lose his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe L. is from the village of Tambagan, Gingoog City. She is 42 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Fe owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Fe is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 5th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children’s education. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Bwera Twekundire Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
B. Nicholas, 38 years old, is the married father of three children. All his children are in school and he is also taking care of two orphans.

Nicholas runs a crafts shop business in Rwamunyari, Ibanda district. He has been plying his business for the last seven years and it is with these profits that he has managed to shoulder his family responsibilities.

Nicholas’s major drawback over the years has been clients who take most of his items on credit. In a way this has retarded his progress. However, his strong reserves of hard work have helped him overcome this and, as it is now, he is making a modest 60,000 shillings a month.

The future of Nicholas’s business will improve, he says, if he can get this loan. He plans on buying more indigenous and foreign art crafts for his shop.

loans.use: To purchase more art crafts for his business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites J. is from the village of Brgy. Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old. Marites is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dried fish in the market. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marites is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marites from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Um Y., 46, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She is employed at the province hall for an income of about USD 4 per day. Her husband is a carpenter and a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses.  Y. is now requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase pig food for the pigs and repair the old motorbike. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. Y. appears in the photograph at home.

loans.use: To buy pig food and repair the old motorbike

loans.name: Rotana

texts.en: Mrs. Rotana P. is a 27-year-old married woman who lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Reth Mov, are farmers who own one hectare of land and a plowing machine to cultivate rice. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Rotana P. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water machine and the rest of the loan she wants use to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and pesticide and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm. Aside from farming, Mr. Reth Mov, is also a construction worker where he receives a small salary to support his family living. This couple has two children. One of the children is a student and the other one is too young to study or work. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase a water machine, fertilizer, rice seed, and pesticide and to pay for laborer to plow her farm.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 45 años, es una madre  de familia muy trabajadora y noble, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de18 años teje chompas, siendo éstas exportadas al extranjero. Desde siempre teje y mas por las madrugada, horario en donde se concentra más para realizar los puntos y deja que su imaginación le ayude a elaborar lo mas hermosos diseños y formas. Después de una revisión acuciosa del tejido por parte de la empresa que compra su mercadería, es reconocida por el matiz y el acabado que tiene dichos tejidos. En esta silla cubierta de frazadas, como a vemos en la foto, se alista para empezar a tejer sin parar. Se siente a gusto con su labor, aunque últimamente tiene problemas visuales, es por ello que en adelante piensa retomar su venta de productos nutricionales, que los había dejado para tener ingresos adicionales a su economía. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP y se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas, puesto que sabe y valora lo beneficioso que es, y se siente contenta de trabajar  con sus compañeros de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos nutricionales al por mayor, para que de ese modo amplíe su negocio y capte más rentas, pero sin dejar de elaborar prendas tejidas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old and a mother of a very hard-working and dignified family. She lives with her husband and their three children in their own home. For more than 18 years she has knitted sweaters that are exported out of the country. She has been knitting her whole life and does it mostly during the early mornings, when she concentrates on making her stitches and lets her imagination help her make the most beautiful designs and forms. After a painstaking review by the company that purchases her merchandise, Rosa has been recognized for the hue and quality of her items. The chair covered with blankets in the photo is where Rosa knits nonstop. She enjoys her work, although lately she has had some problems with her eye sight, which is why in the future she plans to renew her business of selling nutritional products, which she had done to earn additional income. This is her ninth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time. She knows and values the benefits of these loans, and she enjoys working with her fellow members of her community bank. With the loan she is requesting, Rosa plans to purchase nutritional products at wholesale so she can expand her business and capture more revenue, but without giving up her knitting business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase nutritional products to earn additional income

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona P. is in the business of selling bread, tomatoes and cooking oil at the market and is requesting a loan so as to stock dried fish to sell.

Lona is a woman whose husband died a long time ago and she has four children who all attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she intends to sustain her family by providing them with the basic needs and by providing food security at home.

loans.use: To stock dried fish to sell

loans.name: Kweyamba Womens Group 3-Namawojjolo -Lugazi

texts.en: N. Christine, 28, earns her living waiting for travelers to buy bottled fruit juices and chicken from her stand. It is not always a rosy picture! One has to have reserves of resilience to succeed in this business. Anyone who has traversed the Kampala-Jinja highway will bear witness to the stiff competition that exists at this popular stop-over for refreshments. Christine is now four years into this business and says she has managed to give one of her young children an education out of the profits. In a week she makes close to 45,000 shillings, and is anticipating better prospects with the acquisition of this loan. Through the sale of more bottled soft drinks and roast chicken she will be able to earn more money.

loans.use: Buy more bottled soft drinks and roast chicken to sell

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim N. (pictured above) and her husband, Mr. Chhay Lun, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh about 25 kilometers away. They have been married since 1973 and have nine children--four sons and five daughters. Five of them are married and live outside the family home. One sells groceries at home and other three attend school. 
 
Sim sells ice at home. Her husband has been operating a business renting out a wedding and ceremony hall for four years. Sim is asking for her first loan of US$ 1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to school.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary B. is currently in the business of selling mixed goods in a small shop such as biscuits, soap, perfumes, etc. and is requesting a loan to stock bags of sugar, cartons of salt, etc. to sell.  Mary is 38 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by extending the floor of her shop from a small floor to a larger floor.

loans.use: Stock bags of sugar, cartons of salt, etc. to sell

loans.name: Juldie

texts.en:
Juldie M. is from the village of San Miguel, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 39 years old, married, and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Juldie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Juldie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Teresa Jahaira

texts.es: Teresa Jahaira es una madre de familia de 30 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, ella busca la forma de salir adelante con su negocio,  tiene una gran variedad de clientes que asisten a su negocio, ella es una persona muy tranquila y que disfruta de hablar con sus clientes. Teresa desea ampliar su negocio para lograr adquirir más ganancias siempre le ha gustado trabajar para mantener a su familia. Se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez un crédito con el objetivo de comprar pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y trajes. Ella es una persona bastante entregada a su familia y que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar a los que la necesitan. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Teresa Jahaira is a 30 year old mother. She sells clothing and is looking for ways to succeed in her business. Teresa has a variety of customers who come to her business. She is a peaceful person who enjoys talking with her customers.

Teresa wants to expand her business so that she can generate more income. She always enjoys working in order to support her family. Teresa found it necessary to request her first loan so that she can buy trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, and suits. She is very devoted to her family and always willing to help those who are in need. The people who know her consider her to be a quiet and responsible woman.

loans.use: Purchase trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, and suits

loans.name: Vanessa Jireh

texts.en:
Vanessa Jireh C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 21 years old and married. She has one child, who is now one year and six months old. She grows pigs and farms for a living. Her pigs are for fattening and sold at the market. She plants and harvests rice crops for consumption and sale. Vanessa does her best to help provide for her family.

Vanessa Jireh joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vanessa Jireh has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Vanessa Jireh is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm supplies and livestock feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and livestock feeds

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
This is 32 year-old Sushila B..  She is married and has one child, aged 5.  In 1998, she established  her tailoring business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to purchase raw materials for her tailoring work.  In the future, Sushila plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buy raw materials for tailoring work

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Teresa, ella tiene 47 años de edad; casada  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como son arroz, azúcar, leche, la socia desea ampliar su negocio  .

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "PUNTUALITO". The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 
The member is Mrs. Teresa and she is 47 years old. She is married and has 3 children. The member alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business where she sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar and milk. The member wants her business to grow. 

The member is requesting a loan to set up her grocery store. 

The member thanks those who are helping her with this dream and she promises to complete her payments in the established installments.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to set up a grocery store.

loans.name: Rubare Ole

texts.en:
Rubare Ole K. is 47 years old, married to Nkarana Kimwathi and a father of two children who attend school. Rubare is a businessman involved in the livestock trade and he gets good profits after fattening the animals and later selling then to other clients.

Rubare learned about KADET LTD from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his first loan and he is planning to spend it on more animals to fatten and eventually sell. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his business and become a commercial animal seller.

Rubare‘s dream is do well in this business and start dairy farming. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: buy more animals to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Juntos Unidos Iremos Al Camino Del Exito Group

texts.es: Rosa, es la presidenta del grupo “Juntos Unidos Iremos al Camino del Éxito” el grupo está conformado por 13 miembros que a su vez son amigos y vecinos que tiene como objetivo alcanzar metas en conjunto. Entre ellos  está la presidenta Rosa D. 41 años D. edad casada y madre D. tres hijos D. los cuales uno a un está a su cuidado por ser menor D. edad. Rosa es dueña D. un locutorio y cabinas D. internet por lo cual este es su único medio D. ingresos económicos, cuenta con este negocio hace más D. tres años, el cual le ha dado una economía estable en su hogar. Con el reciente préstamo piensa invertirlo en la compra D. mercadería como, tarjetas D. recargas virtuales para teléfonos celulares. En el futuro le gustaría abrir un restaurant y continuar con el negocio D. locutorio. Así como Rosa cada integrante del grupo, tiene una meta en particular, que es el éxito y la mejoría económica para ellos y sus familias.
texts.en:
Rosa is President of the “Juntos Unidos Iremos al Camino del Éxito” (Together as One We’ll Go to the Road to Success” group.  The group has 13 members who are friends and neighbors whose objective is to reach their goals together.

Among them is the President, Rosa, 41.  She’s married and mother of three children one of whom is a minor and still in her care.

Rosa owns a telephone booth and Internet access booths which are her only source of income.  She’s had the business for over three years.  It has provided her home with stable income.

She plans to use the recent loan to buy merchandise like telephone service recharge cards and virtual recharge cards for cellular phones.

In the future she’d like to open a restaurant and continue with the telephone booth.

Like Rosa, each member of the group has a particular goal which is success and economic improvement for themselves and their families.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: Maria tiene 50 años donde vive con su dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 10 años, trabaja todos el día desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, aprendió a este negocio por su mama que le enseño este medio de vida. Esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería granos básicos, verduras, platos, bolsas y cubiertos además de comprar mesas y sillas para ampliar la atención adecuada a los clientes.La aspiración principal es generar ganancias para cubrir los gastos del hogar y pagar este préstamo.
texts.en: Maria is 50 years old; she lives with her two children. She sells meals; she has had this business for 10 years, working every day from 5 am to 10 pm. She learned this business from her mother, who taught her this way of life. She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies such as basic grains, vegetables, plates, bags, and cutlery, as well as buy tables and chairs to draw appropriate attention from her customers. Her main goal is to generate revenue to cover household expenses and repay this loan.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Badenya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 41 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Massigui, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font le commerce d’habillements et de céréales.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des tissus, des habillements et des céréales.                                                                          
ROKIA D. s’approvisionne  en habillements en au marché de Massigui. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 90 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Badenya are all married and average 41 years of age and three children living in traditional extended families in the city of Massigui, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members know one another through ties of kinship and community, and they do commerce in clothing and in grains.  The group members are on their 15th solidarity loan, which will be used to buy cloth, clothing, and grain. 

Ms. ROKIA D. gets her supplies of clothing at the Massigui market.  Accepting cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men, she makes her sales locally and at surrounding fairs. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to cover expenses related to health care, food, and schooling.  The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Buying clothing

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Héctor, de 19 años, es un joven muy responsable, es el mayor de 3 hermanos y vive en casa de su abuela. Este emprendedor joven se dedica al negocio de ropa, mochillas y juguetes; de acuerdo a la temporada cambia de mercaderías y de ese modo dinamiza su negocio. Su puesto se encuentra dentro de un mercado muy concurrido al cual alquila.  De esta manera Héctor poco a poco fue forjando su negocio,  y gracias a ello; ahora estudia por las mañanas en una academia, ya que su mayor anhelo es ingresar a la universidad y forjarse una carrera. Y para subsistirse de sus gastos, por las mañanas a contratado  una persona que le ayude en sus ventas; mientras el estudia. El negocio que realiza le gusta mucho, pero tampoco quiere quedarse sin tener una carrera. Es el noveno crédito con MFP, y sabe lo útil que le será este dinero para mejorar su negocio, por ello se compromete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. De obtener el crédito que solicita, incrementará polos y short para la temporada de verano.
texts.en: Hector is 19 years old and he is a very responsible young man. He is the eldest of 3 children who live with their grandmother. This enterprising young man sells clothing, knapsacks and toys. In order to make his business more dynamic he varies the merchandise he sells depending on the season. He rents a stand and it is located in a well-traveled market. This is how Hector has been shaping his business and thank to this he is able to go to school in the mornings. His greatest goal is to go to university and to have a career. In provide for his expenses, in the mornings while he's at school, he has an employee who helps him with the sales.  He really enjoys his business but he doesn't want to be left without a career. This is his ninth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he knows how helpful this support will be for his business. He will purchase polo shirts and shorts for the summer season.

loans.use: To purchase polo shirts and shorts

loans.name: Airk

texts.en:
From Kompong Tom province, Airk M. is a 59-year-old woman, married to Rouy Reng, age 65, and they are local farmers. This old couple lives with three of their employed children who always contribute their profits to Airk M. every month to use for the family’s needs. 

One of them is a recycling seller - he buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. He always uses his existing bicycle as a way to reach the place where he buys the used goods, and it is really hard for him when he needs to travel far.  

To improve this situation, Airk M. has decided to ask for a loan from Kiva through HKL, to buy a motorcycle for her son to use on longer trips.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her son to use on longer trips for buying used goods.

loans.name: Elver

texts.es: Elver, de 30 años de edad, natural del distrito de kimbiri, es un Joven muy alegre y trabajador; convive con Raquel de 25, juntos tienen dos hijos, Rabí de 03 años y Bill de 01 año de edad y todos viven en su propia casa en la Comunidad de Kimbiri Alto. Elver, es un hombre de mucho provecho, se dedica con mucho esmero a la labor que realiza. Su trabajo consiste en labrar la tierra, es campesino y cuenta con 06 hectáreas de terreno; donde ha cultivado, café, hojas de coca, cacao y barbasco; que son plantas oriundas de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Ha trabajado durante 10 años y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros; de esa manera extrae rápido los frutos y comercializa dichos productos a las empresas acopiadoras, quienes le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo de cada producto que vende. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos de cacao, café y hojas  de coca pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para expandir sus sembríos y aumentar en su producción. Para así darle una buena estabilidad económica a  su  familia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo y esta dispuesto a cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos. Agradece a la institución Prisma por concederle el préstamo. Con los  2,500 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Elver is 30 years old and from Kimbiri district.  He is a very cheerful and hard-working young man.  He lives with 25 year-old Raquel and together they have two children: 3 year-old Rabí and 1 year-old Bill.  They live in their own home in Kimbiri Alto community.

Elver is a very hard-working man who puts a lot of care into farming his land.  Elver is a farmer and he has 6 hectares of land where he grows coffee, coca leaf, cacao and barbasco.  These are all plants which are native to the jungle region of the Apurimac Valley.  Elver has been working for 10 years and during harvest time he has the support of laborers.  In this way, he harvests his crops quickly and sells them to traders who pay him very well for each kilogram of produce that he sells.

Elver considers that the most difficult part of his work is transporting his products from the farm to the town of San Francisco which is where they offer him the best prices for his cacao beans, coffee and coca leaf.   However, right now he is giving priority to buying more land so that he can sow more crops and expand his production in order to provide his family with good financial stability.

This is Elver's first loan with MFP.  He feels that this support will help him a lot in making progress in his work and he is ready to make his loan repayments according to schedule.  He is grateful to Prisma for offering him the loan.  He will use the 2,500 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy cacao and coffee seeds.

loans.use: To buy cacao and coffee seeds

loans.name: Fikret

texts.ru: Fikret D. 32 qoda. On jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka. Fikret yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuili qoroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On uje 4 qoda kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji obuvi. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit pomesheniye dlya toqo chtobi umestiti bolshe tovara dlya prodaji v svoyom magazine. Fikret ranshe rabotal prodavcom v magazine svoyeqo dyadi a potom reshil otkrit svoy magazin.
texts.en: Fikret D. is 32 years old. He is married and has one child. Fikret is an internally displaced person and has been relocated from the town of Fuzili and now lives in the Fuzili region together with his family. He has been in the business of selling shoes for four years now. At this time he needs 2000 AZN to expand his store space to be able to house more merchandise for resale. Fikret has worked as a salesperson before in the store of his uncle and later decided to open his own store.

loans.use: to expand the space of his shoe store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy another buffalo for the dairy business

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita G. is from the village of San Francisco, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Pablita is married and has six adult children. 

To make a living, Pablita buys and sells bananas and coconuts for copra (coconut meat for making oil) in the local community. Pablita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Pablita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Pablita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Pablita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional green bananas and coconuts for copras. This will be the third loan taken out by Pablita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional green bananas and coconuts for copra

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is currently in a business of selling maize grain. She is 40 years old, married, with five children, all of whom go to school. Joyce borrowed a loan to stock more maize grain to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: stock more maize grain to sell.

loans.name: Elbis Roel

texts.es:
Elbis es un señor de 30 años de edad que tiene una familia a cargo, una esposa y una hija. Ellos viven en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz- Chiclayo. Este distrito es uno de los tantos distritos de Chiclayo que comenzó siendo una zona urbano –marginal (de condición muy pobre) y se fue desarrollando poco a poco gracias al esfuerzo de sus habitantes. Esta comunidad, es una comunidad de grandes comerciantes.

Elbis, tiene 6 años de experiencia en el ámbito de construcción civil. 

Elbis es un cliente antiguo de Edpyme Alternativa y solicita  un préstamo de 2500 nuevos soles para comprar materiales de construcción, para realizar una obra que le han dejado a cargo. Con la remuneración de esta obra el podrá cancelar el préstamo y usar otra parte del dinero para los gastos del hogar.

Elbis cuenta con buena reputación en la empresa, por haber cancelado puntualmente más de 5 créditos.
texts.en:
Elbis is 30 years old and has a dependent family, a wife and daughter. They live in the José Leonardo Ortiz- Chiclayo district.  This district is one of the many of Chiclayo that started becoming marginally urban (of poor condition) and was developed little by little thanks to the force of the residents. This community is a large community of traders.

Elbis has 6 years of experience in civil construction. 

Elbis is an old client of Edpyme Alternativa and is requesting a loan of 2500 soles to buy building materials to complete a job that remains in progress. With the compensation from this job he will be able to cancel the loan and use part of the money for home expenses. 

Elbis has a good reputation in the company, having paid on time more than 5 loans.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a single parent. Mercy sells hair clips, lipstick, etc, by moving from one area to another in a village called Kwaprow. She has been selling these items for three years and wants to increase her sales.  She is requesting a loan to buy hair clips, lipstick, etc. to resell. She hopes to build a shop with the profits from her sales.

loans.use: to purchase hair clips, lipstick, etc.

loans.name: Bunthea

texts.en:
Bunthea (pictured here) is a truck driver. He has been married since 2007 and has a young son. His wife works in factory that produces clothes. They live in a village along National Road Number Four, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Bunthea is applying for a loan of $1,000 to purchase new wheels for his truck, because the existing ones are old.

loans.use: To replace the wheels on his truck.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 28-year-old husband and father of one daughter and two sons. He is a bakery worker and has a small field of olive trees, which he takes care of with the help of his wife.

Working in the bakery brings in only a small wage for Muhammad so that he had to find another source of income. Muhammad, who appears in the picture, took out $1,000 from FATEN to purchase fertilizers and fix the field's sprinklers so as to have a better crop and sell better and also be able  to make olive oil to use in his house instead of buying it as it is very expensive.

loans.use: to purchase agriculture inputs for olive tree field: fertilizers, repair sprinklers, etc.

loans.name: Jairo Josue

texts.es: Jairo Josué tiene 25 años, tiene 2 hijos, su esposa se dedica al hogar. El se considera un luchador, ya que el negocio al que él se dedica es duro pero se busca la forma de ganarse la vida. El es ofrece el servicio de venta y repuestos de bicicleta. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Es algo cansado pero siempre trabaja para mejorar las condiciones de su familia. Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar cadenas, asientos, cables, aceite y grasa.
texts.en: Jairo Josué, 25, has two children; his wife’s a housewife.  He considers himself a fighter since the business he’s in is hard but he looks for a way to earn a living.  He offers bicycle sales and repair services.  He works every day from 7am until 8pm.  It’s somewhat tiring but he always works to improve his family’s living conditions.  He will use this loan to buy chains, seats, cables, oil and grease.

loans.use: to buy chains, seats, cables, oil and grease.

loans.name: Brang

texts.en:
Brang, 32 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a motorbike repairer. She has 2 children, 11 and 2 years old, one of whom attends school. Every month, Brang spends around $50 on all the family's expenses.

Brang would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a plot of land to pump the sand to sell. Her husband has been doing motorbike repair for about ten years and now he wants to get another career (pumping the sand) so that he can earn more income because he is the only one earning money to support the family.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land to pump the sand to sell

loans.name: Dieynaba

texts.fr: Madame Dieynaba est agée de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. C'est sous l'influence de sa belle soeur, une grande commerçante, qu'elle a commencé à faire du commerce afin de combattre l'oisiveté et subveniraux besoins de ses enfants. C'est ainsi qu'elle s'est virée dans le commerce de tissus. Enfin elle souhaitait un crédit de 100 000 FCFA pour développer son commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs Dieynaba is 33 years old. She is married and a mother of three.
Under the influence of her sister-in-law, an established merchant, she started in retail to combat idleness and support her children. This is how she got her start in retailing fabrics.
She now wishes to be granted a loan of 100,000 FCFA to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to retail.

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr:
Ayoko est une femme agée de 29ans. Elle est mariée å un employé à la pharmacie. Elle a 02 enfants.  
Ayoko travaille comme revendeuse de cartes de rechages depuis 2008. Elle est aidée par 02 personnes et vend à ses clients. Elle achète les produits à Tokoin Ramco. 
Ayoko a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des cartes de recharges.
texts.en:
Ayoko is a 29 year old woman. She is married to a pharmacy employee. She has 02 children.
Ayoko has worked as a top-up card retailer since 2008.She is assisted by 02 people and she sells to her  customers. She buys her merchandise at Tokoin Ramco.
Ayoko has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase top-up cards.

loans.use: Purchase top-up cards

loans.name: Torees Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her late 20's, is married, with three children.  Two of them go to school.  She has been running a business as a food vendor for two years now.  She works from 10 a.m. to 8 p.m daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She wants to use it to increase her food stock.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Torees", which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase food stock.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.es: Madeleine de 25 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, es madre de dos niños con quienes vive en casa propia junto su pareja. El trabajo de Madeleine consiste en la venta de frutas, ella se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado Bellavista a vender, este trabajo lo hace sola desde hace ya dos años aproximadamente. Asmismo trabaja enviando a Lima frutas regionales como papaya, plátano, aguaje y todo clase de frutas que se encuentren en temporada. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que siempre esta en movimiento y vende a diario, le gustaría mas adelante poder poner una bodega en su casa así ganaría más dinero. Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene y espera contar nuevamente con su ayuda. Con el monto solicitado, comprará frutas para implementar su negocio.
texts.en: Madeleine is 25 years old. She is a very happy and hard working woman. She is mother to two children with whom she lives in her own house along with her partner. Madeleine's work consists of selling fruit. She wakes up very early to go to the Bellavista market to sell. She has done this work alone for approximately two years. At the same time, she works sending regional fruit to Lima, such as papaya, banana, aguaje, and all types of fruit that are seasonal. What she likes about her job is that she is always moving and she sells daily. She would like to be able to start a store in her house in the future in order to earn more money. This is the second loan she's taken and she hopes she can count on your help again. With the amount requested, she will buy fruit for her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Kumrikhon

texts.ru: Кумрихон проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 41 год. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж находится на заработках заграницей. Сама Кумрихон более 12 лет занимается торговлей. Она арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает детскую одежду. Кредит берет для покупки ползунков, носков, шапок и костюмчиков.
texts.en: Kumrikhon lives in the Vahdat district.  She is 41 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband works abroad.  Kumrikhon has been involved in sales for over 12 years.  She leases a retail outlet at a market, where she sells children's clothing.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of infant pants, socks, hats and bodysuits.

loans.use: to purchase infant pants, socks, hats and bodysuits

loans.name: Wend Mi Group

texts.fr:
Mme Maïmouna est la représentante du groupe WEND MI. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans et le moins âgé 01an.01 va à l’école. Elle a 04 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des objets plastiques (plats, sceau, des pots pour enfants, des paniers etc.) depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 23 en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter des sceaux, des plats, des bols et des gobelets en plastique tous en douzaine.

Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour améliorer son activité et aider son mari dans la scolarité des enfants. Elle ambitionne voyager en Côte d’Ivoire pour acheter ses marchandises et devenir une grande commerçante.
texts.en:
Maïmouna is the representative of the "Wend Mi" group. She is married and the mother of 3 children aged between 1 and 7, one of whom attends school. Maïmouna has 4 dependents in all. She has been selling plastic items (plates, buckets, potties, baskets, etc.) for 5 years, and she gets her supplies from her local town market in sector 23. She will use this loan to restock with a dozen buckets, plates, bowls and goblets. 

Maïmouna plans to use her profits to improve her business and support her husband with the children's educational expenses. She hopes one day to become a large retailer and to be able to travel to the Ivory Coast to get her supplies.

loans.use: to buy a dozen plastic buckets, plates, bowls and goblets.

loans.name: Marrisa

texts.en:
Marrisa, 34, is satisfied with her business where she sells a great variety of merchandise, especially basic necessities, to meet each customer’s needs. She has been running her store for three years and she is able to earn about 2,000 PHP a month. Marissa is married and has been blessed with four children. 

Marrisa would like to request an additional capital amount of 13,000 PHP, allowing her to restock her retail store. She knows that obtaining the loan will be of great help to her, as it will enable her to supply and meet the demands of her customers. In this way, her sales and profits will increase. She hopes that her economic situation will improve, thus enabling her to offer a better standard of living and support her children in their studies and save some for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to restock her store business

loans.name: German

texts.es: El señor  German es cliente nuevo que esta en su primera secuencia de  su crédito esta casado con la señora  Elizabeth  tienen dos hijos que están en la edad escolar  y viven en casa propia   en la zona de  vino tinto de la ciudad de La Paz, el préstamo  invertirá en la compra de harina y azúcar  por quintal  los cliente trabajan sacrificadamente de lunes a domingo desde horas 5:00 de la mañana hasta  21:00 horas se sienten  muy contentos por ser otorgado con el crédito Kiva, el deseo del Sr. German es el de ver a sus hijos profesionales y personas de bien.
texts.en: German is a new client who is in the process of his first loan. He is married to Elizabeth and they have two school age children. They live in their own home in the red wine zone of the city of La Paz.  The loan will be used to invest in the purchase of flour and sugar by the quintal.  These clients work sacrificially from Monday to Sunday from 5:00 in the morning to 9:00 at night.  They feel very happy to be offered the Kiva loan. German's desire is to see his children become professionals and people of goodwill.

loans.use: to purchase flour and sugar.

loans.name: Rosa Dilma

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Dilma, tiene 41 años de edad, casada, vive en una aldea de Omoa, Cortes, junto a su esposo y dos hijos uno de 8 y  21 años de edad. Los dos hijos están estudiando actualmente.
Ella  es una persona cristiana, y bien conocida en la aldea, trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio. Hace 3 años que se dedica a generar sus propios ingresos con la venta de mercadería, como Ropa americana y tambien zapatos.las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante o a domicilio por pedidos. su esposo recibe ingresos de su trabajo como jardinero en una propiedad privada.
Es su primer préstamo con ODEF, y es  para invertirlo en compra de zapatos y ropa para mantener siempre productos y dar una buena atención a sus clientes,  ya que es de donde obtiene ingresos para dar una mejor vida a su familia. También cubrir gastos de educación de sus hijos
texts.en:
Rosa Dilma is 41 years old and married.  She lives in the village of Omoa, Cortes with her husband and their two children, ages 8 and 21.  The two children are currently in school.

She is a Christian person, and she is well-known in the village.  She is a hard-worker and devoted to her business.  For three years she has been generating her own income by selling merchandise like American clothes and shoes.  She sells in an itinerant manner or by home orders.  Her husband earns income by working as a gardener on a private property.

This is her first loan with ODEF.  She will use the loan to buy shoes and clothes in order to always have products on hand and to give her customers good service.  Her business is where she gets income to give her family a better life.  It also covers her children’s educational expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.es:
Martha's Group está conformado por tres mujeres, en este grupo la presidenta es Martha ya que es una persona tranquila, amorosa, responsable y muy trabajadora. Martha tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 14, 8 y 1 año de edad. Vive con su familia en Latacunga que se encuentra en la Sierra Centro de Ecuador.

Martha trabaja con su esposo y sus hermanas en la confección de ropa es por eso que solicita a Fodemi un crédito para la compra de materia prima como es la tela que le ayudará a incrementar su producción y así mejorar su calidad de vida obteniendo mejores ventas y de al mismo tiempo buenos ingresos que le servirán para mantener a su familia. Inició su negocio con una sola máquina de cocer y poco a poco a ido incrementando su negocio.

Su sueño es estar muy bien con su familia y que su negocio siga creciendo para así poder tener una gran productividad.
texts.en:
Martha’s group consists of three women and she serves as the president. Martha is a peaceful, loving, responsible, and hardworking person. She is 35 years old, married, and has three children (ages 14, 8, and 1). Martha and her family live in Latacunga, which is located in the central mountains of Ecuador.

Martha works with her husband and her sisters. They produce clothing, so she is requesting a loan from FODEMI in order to buy raw materials, such as fabric, so that she can increase production and improve her quality of life. By improving her sales and generating more income at the same time, Martha will be able to maintain her family. She started this business with only one sewing machine and has gradually increased her business.

Her dreams include seeing her family do well and growing her business so that it has reaches an outstanding level of productivity.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for making clothes.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
La señora Emilia tiene 44 años de edad, está casada hace 17 años con el señor Ramón de 50 años de edad, el matrimonio tiene dos hijos, uno 16 y 2 años respectivamente, la mayor está cursando el 2do de la media del bachillerato técnico en informática, el menor todavía no ha empezado la escuela.
La sra. Emilia se dedica a la venta ambulante hace 1 año, como no le resultó su negocio anterior de agroveterinaria emprendió este nuevo proyecto. Comenta que su marido trabaja como empleado en un negocio de veterinaria en Ciudad del Este y juntos se ayudan a llevar adelante los gastos de la familia y asi costear el estudio de su hija ya que falta poco para empezar a estudiar una carrera universitaria. Ellos tienen como sueño que se hija sea una profesional universitaria.                                                    Solicita este préstamo para la compra de productos para su negocio como ser ollas a presión, cacerolas, jarra forrada, latonas, remeras, blusas, y otros articulos que le permitira ofrecer variedad a sus clientes y poder mejorar su ingreso mensual.-
texts.en:
Emilia, 44, has been married to Ramón, 50, for 17 years.  They have two children who are 16 and 2 years old respectively.  The oldest is in the second years of technical high school studying computer sciences and the youngest hasn’t started school yet.

Emilia has been a street vendor for a year because her previous business, a veterinary/farm supply, did not work out.  She comments that her husband works as an employee in a veterinary shop in Ciudad del Este and together they try to cover family expenses and to pay for their daughter’s studies since she’s soon to start her university career.  Their dream is that she graduates university with a profession.  She’s asking for the loan to buy products for her business like: pressure cookers, pots, thermos bottles, brass bowls, t-shirts, blouses and other items that will allow her to offer a variety to her customers and thus improve her monthly income.

loans.use: to buy a pressure cooker, pots, lined jug, t-shirts, blouses and other items.

loans.name: Madai Gabina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”RICCHARY CUSCO; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Madai;  La socia tiene 38 años de edad, la socia es soltera, La socia tiene 3 hijos de 18, 12, 7 años de edad;  La socia se dedica  a la compra venta de granos la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra y venta de granos secos y de cereales en el mercado, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cereales y de granos.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: The member belongs to the communal bank, “Ricchary Cusco.” The communal bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and district of Cusco. The member is Mrs. Madai. She is 38 years old and single. She has 3 children ages 18, 12, and 7. She  buys and sells grain for a living. She wants to invest her loan in the purchase and sale of dry grains and cereals in the market. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of cereals and grains. She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payment of the loan installments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of cereals and grains.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Teodoro is 39 years old, married and has three children. Teodoro is an experienced farmer. He has been growing rice for almost 20 years now. Through his income, he provides meals, allowances and other basic needs for his family. Teodoro now realizes that he should increase his income as his family's expenses for allowances and meals have been increasing. He is asking for P30,000 to buy 18 bags of fertilizers and pesticides to improve his crop production and yield for abundant harvest.

Through his farming activities, Teodoro aims that someday, he can make his family live progressively.

loans.use: to buy 18 bags of fertilizers and pesticides for use in farming

loans.name: Faty Arele

texts.fr:
Faty Arèle est une femme de 44 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère de deux enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois depuis le 14 mai 2010. Elle fait partie du groupe de solidarité "BOKK JOM"

Elle développe un petit commerce de tissus, de lait caillé et de "thiakri" (couscous au lait). Elle a une bonne dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs années

Avec son nouveau crédit de 350.000 francs cfa elle va développer son activité en renforçant son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises (tissus, lait et "thiakri" pour satisfaire sa clientèle. 

Son objectif de prendre en charge les besoins scolaires et sanitaires de ses deux enfants tout en renforçant ses épargnes dans le Banc Villageois
texts.en: Faty Arèle is a 44 year old woman. She is divorced and mother of two dependent children. She has been a member of the Villageois Bank since May 14, 2010.  She is a member of the BOKK JOM  solidarity group. She runs a small business selling fabric, curdled milk and "thiakri" (coucous with milk).  She is doing well since she has been in business for many years. With her new loan of 350,000 francs, she will develop her business by increasing her supply of goods (fabric, milk, and "thiakri") to satisfy her customers.  Her goal is to take care of the educational and health needs of her two children while building her savings at the Villageois Bank.

loans.use: to buy fabric, curdled milk and "thiakri".

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: El señor Abel es jubilado y tiene una tienda de venta de abarrotes . El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mercadería (arroz, azúcar, fideos, dulces, refrescos, etc.) para tener una variedad de productos que ofrecer a su clientela. Abel  es casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Vive en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la zona Alto Seguencoma   de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la segunda vez que trabaja con kiva y la sexta vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO, de tal manera que tiene un historial crediticio excelente.
texts.en:
Abel is retired, and he has a grocery store.  He needs the loan to buy merchandise (rice, sugar, noodles, sweets, and soft drinks, etc.) in order to have a variety of products to offer his customers.

Abel is married and has four children.  He lives in his own house in the Alto Sequencoma zone of the city of La Paz.

This is the second time he has worked with Kiva and the sixth time he has requested a loan with IMPRO.  He therefore has an excellent credit history.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, sugar, and other products for his grocery store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 45 years old and married to Amos. The couple has two children, a boy and a girl age 19 and 15 years old.

Rose has a retail shop that she has been running for the past 11 years.

She has applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her to add stock to her business. 

She hopes to buy a piece of land and build business premises.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, bread, milk, etc., to add to her stock.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.en:
ENGLISH

17 years ago Maria Guadalupe G. and her husband started a small business where they sell motor oil and spare parts. With the support of her husband and their children, the business has been growing and now it is the unique source of the family income.

Lupita is requesting a loan of $925 USD and she offers to pay back in 6-12 months. This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise to sell in their store. She knows the key of success is to supply a great variety of products and when their clients visit her store, they will find what they need at a good price. With the loan she plans to buy as a wholesaler, diminishing their cost. And then she will offer her merchandise at better prices and consequently, she will obtain the preference of their clients.

ESPAÑOL

Desde hace 17 años María Guadalupe G. y su esposo iniciaron un pequeño negocio de venta de lubricantes y refacciones para automóviles. Con la ayuda de su esposo y sus hijos han hecho crecer el negocio, el cual es la única fuente de ingresos de la familia.

Lupita esta solicitando un crédito por $925 USD para surtir de mercancía su negocio, ya que sabe que la clave de su éxito es tener de todo un poco para que cuando el cliente llegue, encuentre lo que necesita y a un buen precio. Es por eso que con el préstamo podrá comprar en mayor volumen, reduciendo sus costos y podrá ofrecer sus productos a mejores precios, consiguiendo de esta forma la preferencia de sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Rohane

texts.en:
Rohane was born in 1969 and lives in a household of 17 in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Rohane lost his left hand during the war and has had lots of financial problems since.

He decided to start a small business in the bazaar to solve his family problems. To start off with he bought socks and hats, then he took loans through AFSG to increase his business and buy more hats, socks and t-shirts, but because there are so many family members  this could not fulfill the family's financial needs. Therefore, he and his two brothers also have a second business that trades in the same products.

He hopes that by selling the products, slowly, he can improve his family's financial situation.

loans.use: To buy hats, socks and T-Shirts

loans.name: Laga

texts.en: Mrs. T. is married with two children. She operated a small food stall when she received her first loan from SPBD. She cooks assorted dishes like taro, palusami (a food make from taro leaves) and fish. She buys the taro, taro leaves and fish for her dishes from the market.  She is now repaying her second loan of $1250ST, which was used to improve her business and make house repairs. She is thinking of finding a spot at the flea market in Apia to extend her business. She believes she will attract more customers there. Therefore, when she receives another loan, she will have to increase the number of dishes she sells. Laga is very glad for the program’s assistance because now she is able to financially support her family and provide for their personal needs.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken leg quarters, onions, soya, sausages, mutton flaps, pepper and stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy 2 young piglets.

loans.name: Simón

texts.es:
Simón is a native of the town of Apodaca in Nuevo León. He is married and has five children. Fourteen years ago Simón opened up his carpentry shop. He began working in his home with very few tools, but fortunately he was able to increase his sales and he constantly was receiving more requests for work. He kept growing and acquiring more specialized tools that allowed him to do jobs of higher quality. Since then he has obtained a rental site to establish his business in a better location and have more clients.

Now Simón is requesting a loan of $925 dollars that he will use to purchase material to finish the orders that await him. He will return this loan in six months. Today is the time to help. Simón needs and appreciates your support. Choose to help Simón!

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Simón es originario de la localidad de Apodaca en Nuevo León, está casado y tiene cinco hijos. Desde hace catorce años Simón inició su carpintería, comenzó a trabajar en su casa con muy poca herramienta, pero afortunadamente logró incrementar sus ventas y cada vez le solicitaban más trabajos, así fue creciendo y adquiriendo herramienta más especializada lo que le permite realizar trabajos de muy buena calidad, después consiguió rentar un local para establecer su negocio en un mejor punto y tener más clientes.

Ahora Simón está solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de material para terminar los pedidos que tiene pendientes, él se responsabiliza a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar, Simón necesita y agradece mucho tu apoyo, ¡decídete a ayudarlo!

loans.use: Buy carpentry material

loans.name: María Gladys

texts.es:
Maria is a native of Orcotuna and has stayed in her native land to progress there, that is why five years ago she decided to move forward with raising livestock. She began with just one cow and now has many. Every morning, Maria goes out early so that her beloved cows may graze among the hills all day in hopes that they return happy and satisfied.

Maria is motivated to continue in this arduous work by the thought of her eight children, who along with her husband, also help her with the cows.

In order to succeed in her business, Maria and her family look to nourish the animals and keep them happy, in hopes of ultimately selling them at a just price. Thanks to her continued activity in her occupation, Maria and her family are able to sustain themselves and this fills Maria with great satisfaction.
