However, with the support of this loan, she would now like to also purchase more species of livestock to increase her clientele. With your support, Maria will be able to accomplish her business goals thus, helping to fund the education of all eight of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Wendy Wise, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria es natural de Orcotuna y se quedó en su tierra natal para progresar en ella, es por ello que hace 5 años decidió optar por la crianza de animales; comenzó con tan solo una vaca y en la actualidad tiene varias su habilidad para la crianza la heredó de sus padres que se dedicaron durante toda su vida a la ganadería y sumado al esfuerzo diario, con dedicación ha logrado llegar hasta donde está.Doña Maria cada mañana sale muy temprano para que sus queridas vacas ubiquen en el campo sus sustento diario y recorre cerros completos a fin de que regresen satisfechas y muy contentas, aunque el trabajo suele ser muchas veces agotador ella motiva su actividad cuando piensa en el futuro de sus 8 hijos que día a día la esperan muy contentos jugando en su hogar.Los mayores también participan en el cuidado de sus animales en compañía de su esposo para poder conocer e interactuar de cerca con esta noble actividad y buscan nutrirlos para venderlos a un precio que justifica su continuo esfuerzo.Gracias a esta actividad Doña Maria y su familia tienen el sustento diario y esto la llena de satisfacción. Sin embrago piensa seguir adelante y ahora desea comprar forraje y más animalitos de raza con el propósito de incrementar su nivel de vida y otorgarles una adecuada educación a su numerosa familia.Con tu valioso aporte podrá alcanzar sus sueños en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Compra de forraje y animalitos pequeños para su crianza y posterior venta.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge is 39 years old and for the last four years he has lived as a couple with Gladys who is 25 years old. Together they have a three-year old daughter who is adored by the young couple.

Jorge tells us that he started in the hairdressing profession 18 years ago: he is a professional hairdresser who has studied to achieve this professional qualification and is one of the most well-known in his town, Ita. His salon is completely equipped and his clientèle consists of boys, teenagers and men of all ages.

Thanks to his work he has managed to build his own house and also owns his own car. According to Jorge, the weekends are when he has the largest number of clients.

He needs a loan to buy creams, shampoo, hair conditioner, gel etc. that he uses in his salon.

Translated by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Jorge tiene 39 años y vive en pareja desde hace 4 años con Gladys que tiene 25 años. Juntos tienen una hija de 3 años y que es la adoración de la joven pareja.

Jorge cuenta que se inició en la profesión de peluquero hace 18 años, es peluquero profesional ya que estudió para adquirir dicha profesión y es uno de los más conocidos de su ciudad (Itá). Cuenta con un local totalmente equipado y su clientela está constituida por niños, adolescentes y hombres de todas las edades.

Gracias a su trabajo logró edificar su casa propia y también cuenta con vehiculo propio. Según comentó, los fines de semana es cuando tiene mayor afluencia de clientela.

Necesita de un crédito para la compra de cremas, shampoo, acondicionadores para el cabello, gel, etc. que utiliza en su peluquería.

loans.use: Purchase shampoos, creams, talcum powder, hair conditioner, etc.

loans.name: Ramon Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio O. is a very responsible and hardworking gentleman. He is married and has two children, so he struggles to sustain his family. Using his savvy in the jewelry field, Mr. O. has been efficiently making and repairing jewelry for 3 years.

He is currently working in the Chinandega market. He had rough beginnings in this business because he used to borrow tools from other people and did not have a display case in which to place his jewelry.

Currently, Mr. O. has invested in his business with Ceprodel loans—at total of 25—which he has wisely spent buying his own work tools, improving his shop, and providing an education for his 2 children who so urgently need it.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Antonio O. es un caballero muy responsable y trabajador. Casado y con dos hijos a su cargo se esfuerza para sustentar a su núcleo familiar. Desde hace 3 años el señor O. se dedica a la elaboración y reparación de joyas el cual se ha desempeñado con mucha eficiencia por ser muy conocedor en este ramo.

Actualmente se encuentra laborando en el mercado de Chinandega, sus inicios fueron bastante difíciles puesto que comenzó a trabajar con herramientas prestadas y no teniendo alguna vitrina donde colocar las joyas.

Actualmente el señor O. ha invertido en su negocio por medio de créditos que le ha otorgado Ceprodel (25 créditos) que los ha utilizado muy sabiamente para comprar sus propias herramientas de trabajo, para mejorar su local y también para poder continuar brindándole los estudios a sus dos hijos que tanto lo necesitan.

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Savy

texts.en: Mrs. Savy was married in 1991 and has three children who are all studying in the primary and high school. She sells dessert in front of her house to the students and people of the village, while her husband drives a motor taxi in Phnom Penh. They live in Dey Eth Commune along national road number one, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $800 to fix their house, where she makes her desserts to sell.

loans.use: To fix the house

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary E. has worked as a trader for the past 20 years.  She is married, has five children and makes a living selling food, mineral water and clothing at the Cape Coast University science market.  She is requesting a loan of $425 to expand her selection of goods by buying more clothing and food items to sell. Mary is a member of the Anointing Group, which is made up of 10 borrowers who live in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy clothing and food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Irineo

texts.es:
Ireneo is 37 years old, married to Alejandrina Alfonso and with two small children. Their children are still attending school but they all live in harmony in their humble home.

Ireneo began to work with "Fundacion Paraguaya" as a member of a male enterpreneur's group. Thanks to the fact that he made his payments on time every month, the foundation was able to give him more personal loans.

Ireneo sells wholesale foods in order to provide kiosks and other small stores. He sells items such as: wines, candy, noodles, rice, coffee, sugar, flour, fruits, vegetables.

He's been doing this for over 4 years and tells us that it is going great. He has a nice amount of clients in different parts of the city. Ireneo requests this credit in order to purchase more goods, since prices continue to increase.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Ireneo tiene 37 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Alejandrina Alfonso, tienen 2 hijos menores aún, que van a la escuela, viven todos juntos en armonía en una pequeña casa.

Ireneo comenzó a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya como cliente formando parte de un grupo solidario de préstamo para hombres emprendedores. Gracias a su puntualidad en sus pagos y por demostrar gran interés de superación, la Fundación ahora accedió al sistema financiero de préstamos personales.

Ireneo se dedica a la venta al por mayor de mercaderías para proveer a despensas y kioscos, mercaderías como: vinos, golosinas, fideos, arroz, café, azúcar, harina, porotos, hortalizas, entre otras cosas.

Hace ya más de cuatro años que se dedica a esto, y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, posee una buena cantidad de clientes y en diferentes ciudades del país. Ireneo solicita el crédito con el que podrá adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías a mejor precio, ya que hoy día la competencia en precios con los supermercados es bastante alta.

loans.use: Purchase of bulk items: wine, candy, noodles, rice, coffee, sugar, flour, fruits, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is 29 years old, married and has two children.  Musa started his business seven years ago after dropping out of school.  He started the business at a very small scale and expanded it with previous loans.  He is requesting a loan of Le. 3,500,000 to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Loi Lubega's Group

texts.en:
Loi is leader of a group of four members. She is 63 years old and married with six children aged between 40 and 20 years. Two are still in school. She has been able to educate her children to university level. The community she resides and works in is semi-urban.

She has been making and selling samosas, cassava, pancakes, and chapattis for the last 24 years in school canteens and the surrounding areas. There is always a market for her products. Because of the high prices of the ingredients she uses, she would like to use this loan to buy materials for her business.

Loi has successfully paid back more than 15 loans.

loans.use: To buy materials for her food business

loans.name: Vaysiddin

texts.ru:
Vaysiddin R. lives in the Khuroson region. Vaysiddin has a large family, and that is why he needs to work long hours to provide for his family. He owns a piece of land, which he uses to plant various cultures. In order for him to work the land, he needs to purchase a number of fertilizers. To finance this purchase he is applying for a 10-months loan. This will help him grow quality crops, which he will be able to sell without any problems.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Рустамов Вайсиддин проживает в районе Хуросон. Работает агрономом , а так же в частном порядке занимается земледелием.Имеет участок земли , который засеивает различными сельхозкультурами. Для того , чтобы обработать землю ему необходимо закупить удобрения , Но для этого нужно получить кредит со сроком в 10 месяцев. Это поможет ему получить качественный урожай , который он сможет продать без каких-либо проблем. У Вайсиддина большая семья , и поэтому ему приходится много работать для того , чтобы обеспечить свою семью

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is a married, 36-year-old mother of five children. Irma sells various clothing for all ages, footwear, traditional clothing, etc. that she acquires from Lima. She sells her products in a stand at the Carmen Alto Market. Furthermore, Irma travels every fifteen days to the community of Viscapalca where she purchases cheeses and sell them on credit to different institutions in the city of Ayacucho. Irma also plans to set up a new stall to sell baby and children’s clothing.

Irma is a member of the Florecer Village Bank. She needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (US$ 375) to invest in baby clothing sets, blankets and christening dresses.

Irma’s dream is to have a new successful business, to buy a car, and to have her children move forward.

loans.use: to invest in baby clothing sets, blankets and christening dresses

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Mrs. Pha S., born in 1968, lives in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province where she is a Khmer noodle maker. Her husband, Mr. Each Orl, shown on the right in the photo, is a Tuk Tuk driver in Phnom Penh City. Unfortunately, Mrs. S.’s noodle machine is old and beyond repair, so she is requesting a loan to buy a new one for her business. 

Mrs. S. has seven children, one of whom is a driver for a company while another is a Khmer cake seller. Four others are enrolled in school while the youngest one is of preschool age.

loans.use: To buy a new noodle machine to make a good product to sell

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris B. is 43 years old. She's a wife and the mother of two children. Her children are currently in school. To support her household, she has been selling foodstuffs such as maize, plantains, beans, cassava and palm kernel oil for the past eight years in the neighborhood to her loyal customers.

Doris says selling these products is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make good income to support her family. Doris is a member of the group called Isaiah Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like maize, plantains, cassava, gari (manioc flour) and beans for re-sale

loans.name: Mak

texts.en: Mak N., 46, is married and lives with her eight children in the Prey Veng province. She and her husband work as vendors selling fruit and typically make about US$5 per day. They are also supported by four of their children who work in a garment factory. Selling fruit has been a difficult business, mostly due to weather conditions that have not been conducive to a good growing season. Therefore, Mak is asking for a loan of US$1,200 to purchase more fruit for sale. She is confident that this loan will help increase her daily income and allow her to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits for sale.

loans.name: Ziyadkhan

texts.en: Ziyadkhan is 50 years old, is married, has one child. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, and is settled in Baku city. He has been in the general store business for fifteen years. He would like a loan of 970 AZN to buy more goods to help improve his general store.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty D. sells sugar and oil and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Betty is 38 years old, married, and has five children. Her husband is a peasant. Her children all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a vehicle.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Mrs. Thorn S. is a farmer in the Tbeng Village in the Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Thom Chin, uses a motorbike to transport firewood to re-sell. Even though they work very hard on their businesses, they still earn insufficient income to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Thorn S. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. She is 52 years old and the mother of a child who helps the father’s business. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en: Mwanahawa M. runs a kiosk at Mbagala Ward in Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children, one is in kindergarten and the other one is in primary school. She sells soft drinks and other domestic items. She intends to open a big shop but unfortunately she doesn't have enough funds.She requests a loan of Tshs 800,000. to boost up the business

loans.use: To purchase more business stock

loans.name: Jhenny

texts.es: La señora Jenny H. se dedica a la venta de Dvd's y CD´S que compra al mayoréo en  El Desaguadero, Perú, productos que vende al por menor en las ciudades de Oruro y la feria 16 de Julio en El Alto, Bolivi. Su esposo para ayudarle con los gastos familiares trabaja de chofer asalariado, y esta jovén familia vive en la casa de sus padres a quienes ayudan en los gastos del hogar. Tienen un pequeño niño, ambos son muy  trabajadores y responsables con sus obligaciones, tanto con la familia como en el trabajo.
texts.en:
Jenny H. sells DVDs and CDs which she buys in bulk in El Desaguadero, Perú, products which she retails in the towns of Oruro and at the 16 of July festival in El Alto, Bolivia. Her husband is a salaried driver and helps with the household expenses. This young family lives in their parents' house whom they help by contributing to the household expenses. They have a young son; both are very hardworking and responsible both in their family life as in their professional life.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mariam D.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Mariam M. from Mbeya. She is single and has children aged of 16 and 19. Mariam has been selling firewood since 2005. She buys buying trees and then chops the firewood and selling it. 

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Mariam currently earns about $260 USD each month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $625 USD to purchase more trees for making firewood. In the future, she plans to open the same business at a new location. Mariam thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more trees for making firewood

loans.name: Joylin

texts.en:
Joylin D. grows rice. She is 30 years old and has 2 children. School is quite expensive now. She started to worry about how she would be able to stretch their limited income. Her husband, Henry D., is also a farmer. They manage their small rice farm business together, to support their children's growing needs.

She is asking for a loan of PHP12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more fertilizers and pesticides for her farm. The loan will make her farm have a better yield. In that way, she believes, she has more support to give to her own family.

CEVI is reaching out to more farmers, especially the poor, to sustain their livelihood. CEVI gives their clients credit, training, and insurance coverage to help their small businesses grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Hafsa

texts.en:
Hafsa  has made a living selling chickens in the Melinne neighborhood of  Zanzibar for the last two years. She is a member of the Tujitahidi loan group, and currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Hafsa works at her business for seven hours a day. She is applying for her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more chickens to sell. She hopes that his loan will allow her to increase her profits and expand her business.  

Hafsa is 28  years old, married and has two children, ages 4  and 2.

loans.use: To improve her business by buying more chickens to sell

loans.name: Cam's Group

texts.en:
Cẩm Thị Trương was born in 1956 (no: 010102050015). She has a shoe shop in the market. She lives with her husband and 2 grandsons. Her husband is a farmer. They have a monthly income of about 3,500,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $197). She has been considerably enlarging her business but doesn’t have enough money. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 dong (about US $233) to buy more shoes to sell.

There are 4 other fund participants in her group: - Thảo Thị Nguyễn was born in 1961 (no: 010102050018). She wants to borrow 1,962,000 dong (about US $110) to buy scrap iron to resell.
- Từ Thị Nguyễn was born in 1979 (no: 010102050016) She sells vegetables in the market. She wants to borrow 4,578,000 dong (about US $257) to buy more vegetables and other goods to sell.
- Hà T. Nguyễn was born in 1980 (no: 010102050017). She is a weaver. She wants to borrow 4,578,000 dong (about US $257) to buy wool.
- Trước Thị Trương was born in 1970 (no: 010102050014). She sells vegetables in the market. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 dong (about US $233) to buy more vegetables and goods to sell.

loans.use: To expand shoe store inventory

loans.name: Harriet Nakalembe‘S Group

texts.en:
Harriet is the leader of four members of a group. She is 37 years old and married with five children aged between 5 and 20 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she is staying with eight people. Harriet takes care of additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Harriet resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Harriet sells secondhand clothes in Owino Market. She sells to an average of fifteen people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week.

Harriet buys clothes from Owino, one of the busiest markets in Kampala city, and pays for transportation costs to and from work. Her major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises and electricity. She has been in this business for the last six years. Her main challenges are thieves and seasonality.

Harriet has been with MCDT for over six years and is servicing her twelfth loan, working all this time with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more clothes to sell. Harriet is aspiring to own a permanent shop for her business.

loans.use: To buy more used-clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open her own store for her business.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, el señor Vidal A. se dedica a su negocio de venta de productos lácteos como lo son el queso y la cuajada siendo este negocio el que le genera ingresos para sustentar su amada familia.

Con el propósito de mejorar y ampliar sus ventas, ha solicitado en Ceprodel un crédito para la compra del queso para ofrecerlo en su establecimiento y así continuar mejorando poco a poco su nivel de ingresos y logrando la satisfacción de todos y cada uno de los clientes por medio del negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Vidal A. sells dairy products like cheese and cuajada (milk curd, a typical Nicaraguan food) in Managua's Mayoreo Market. This business provides him with enough of an income to support his beloved family. With the aim of improving and increasing his sales, he has requested a loan from Ceprodel that he will use to buy cheese to sell in his establishment, and so continue gradually to improve his income level and satisfy each and every one of his customers with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cheese

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo tiene 40 años, como esposa y madre de un hijo lucha junto a su pareja por brindarle las mejores atenciones dentro y fuera de su casa. Desde que contrajo matrimonio puso en practica las habilidades que desde niña aprendió gracias a su madre, quien le enseñó a elaborar diversos trabajos de costura. Pues Consuelo se casó con una persona dedicada a la confección de ropa, por lo que tuvo que ampliar sus conocimientos. Ahora trabajan juntos arduamente atendiendo los pedidos que les hacen sus clientes, ya sean personas particulares o instituciones. Esta actividad la vienen realizando hace 5 años en el taller que acondicionaron en su casa, donde ella elabora los diseños de las diversas prendas y posteriormente su pareja los lleve al mercado central donde están la mayoría de sus clientes. Consuelo tiene proyectado instalar nuevas maquinarias en su taller para mejorar la calidad de  acabados de las prendas y con el tiempo tener una marca exclusiva que distingan sus diseños. Los 6 créditos que ha tenido con Microfinanzas PRISMA  fueron de gran ayuda para ella y sus compañeras de banco comunal, y con este 7mo préstamo se compromete a trabajar con la misma responsabilidad y entusiasmo. Los 2000 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de telas para elaborar las prendas que tiene como pedidos para este fin de mes.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 40 years old and is a wife and mother of a child for whom she, along with her husband, struggles to provide with all the necessities. Since being married, she has put into practice the skills that she learned as a child thanks to her mother who taught her various sewing skills. Consuelo married someone that worked making clothing, and as a result increased her knowledge. They now work hard together, attending the requests that their customers give them, whether they are individuals or institutions. They have been doing this for 5 years in the workshop that they set up in their house, where she creates the designs for the various garments and later her husband takes them to the central market where the majority of their clients are located. Consuelo is planning to put new machinery in their workshop to improve the quality of their garment and with time, to have their own exclusive brand which is distinguished by their designs. The 6 loans that they have had with Microfinanzas PRISMA were of great help to her and her friends in the communal bank, and with this 7th loan she promises to work with same responsibility and enthusiasm. The 2000 Nuevos Soles that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of cloth to make garments for which she has orders by the end of the month.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sewing materials

loans.name: Soloi

texts.en:
Soloi M. is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Fasitoo Tai. She is married and has four small children. Soloi makes and sells food for a living: the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling baked goods in the local community. Soloi has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 300 WST a month.

In 2009, Soloi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. This is the first time she has requested a loan from SPBD. She is requesting 1,000 WST, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make baked products for sale. Soloi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive, and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make baked products for sale

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene D. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 40 years old. Arlene is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Arlene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Arlene from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: Claudia Maria Pérez F. tiene 32 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo. Claudia se dedica a una pulpería, ella ha logrado obtener clientes fijos desde que inicio su negocio y esto le ha permitido obtener ganancias que le han ayudado a solventar gastos en su hogar pues ella es madre y padre para su hijo. Hoy recurre a esta organización con la necesidad de un financiamiento que le permita comprar ciertos artículos como  delineadores, pinturas labiales, golosinas, pan, azúcar, pollo, refrescos naturales y jugos.
texts.en:
Claudia Maria Pérez F. is 32 years old and has 1 child. She manages a grocery store and has been able to secure regular customers since she started her business. This has allowed her to generate profits to help cover her household expenses since she has to be both mother and father to her child.

She has returned to this organization to request a loan to buy certain items such as eyeliners, lipsticks, candy, bread, sugar, chicken, natural sodas, and juices.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital
